story:
Short Summary

My name's Lars Doucet from Level Up Labs, we made the game Defender's Quest using HaxeFlixel, a popular free & open source cross-platform game framework which we also contribute to. Most notably, we contributed Defender's Quest's user interface library, which became flixel-ui.

HaxeFlixel has been run entirely by volunteers, and we now have an opportunity to hire a professional to work on it for a full year. That professional is the framework's own founder, Alexander Hohlov.

Because he lives in Russia, just a small amount of money can fully support him, which would have a huge impact on HaxeFlixel's progress. I owe my game's success to this framework, as do many other game developers, and we want to make it even better.

Thunderclap it! (help us go big on social media)
http://thndr.me/pGKVgg

What We Need

We need $3,000 USD.

That's it.

Alexander can live on just $6,000 for an entire year (thanks to the difference in purchasing power between Russia and the west). The core HaxeFlixel contributors are providing $3,000, and we're asking you for the other half.

Since HaxeFlixel has no legal status (it's neither a corporation nor a non-profit foundation), Level Up Labs, LLC is stepping in to handle the paperwork. Level Up Labs is a full United States Limited Liability Corporation, and has operated as HaxeFlixel's small-time corporate sponsor for several years now.

Level Up Labs will hire Alex as an independent contractor, under a contract in which all work that he does on HaxeFlixel is immediately released publicly under the MIT license -- basically all the same stuff he's been doing so far, just more of it. Level Up Labs is uniquely suited to this because not only do we have experience with doing these sorts of "open source bounties", we also have a lot of experience specifically with hiring contractors from Russia, several of whom have worked on Defender's Quest DX and the upcoming Defender's Quest II.


What You Get

As of this writing, no less than eleven game developers from the Flixel and HaxeFlixel communities have offered Steam Keys for their free and commercial games as pledge rewards, which we'll distribute throughout the various pledge tiers. This is your chance to get great games like Defender's Quest DX, NEO Scavenger, Dino Run DX, The Enchanted Cave 2, and many more, all while supporting the free game framework that will make even more awesome games available in the future! (If you want to add your game, it's not too late! Comment here or here).

Furthermore, if you contribute above a certain amount we'll credit you on both the HaxeFlixel.com website and in an internal credits list distributed in the library itself. HaxeFlixel game developers will have access to this list and are thus able to include you in the credits for their games should they so choose.

UPDATE (8/16/2016): Thanks to the generosity of Leonardo Cavaletti, anyone who donates at the $15 tier or above will receive a free copy of the Discover HaxeFlixel ebook!

And if you're a corporate sponsor, we have Silver, Gold, Platinum, and Unobtanium sponsorship tiers for you if you want to get your logo* on the HaxeFlixel website!

*Subject to approval -- if your site is something like "SuperPornGambling.haxxors" we'll have to politely decline, same goes for anything particularly divisive.

Here's a full list of the games on offer, so you know what you're getting:

HaxeFlixel Fun Pack:
Swing Time
Journey of Coins
How to be Corny
Critical Admission
Flesh to Stone

Commercial Games:
Dino Run DX
SpaceJacked
NEO Scavenger
Defender's Quest: Valley of the Forgotten DX
The Enchanted Cave 2
Holobunnies
Defend Your Crypt (3DS)
Blasting Agent (3DS)


The Impact

I can't emphasize enough how much it will help to have a professional on board. It's amazing what volunteers can do, but their time is necessarily limited. Going from zero full time contributors to one is a huge step.

All the things you love about HaxeFlixel already -- features, demos, documentation, can be improved with a professional at the helm. And this won't be just anyone -- it will be our project's own founder, who knows the library inside and out!


Risks & Challenges

Handling Money

We're not asking for a lot of money, but it's important that we're responsible for it. That's why Level Up Labs and the HaxeFlixel contributors are dedicated to transparency. The $3,000 we're asking for today, as well as the other $3,000 we've already raised, will be exclusively earmarked for Alex. We'll provide copies of all relevant contracts, invoices, receipts, and other paperwork (with sensitive personal information redacted), and post them publicly. We'll also do our best to put out news updates on the HaxeFlixel website so you can know what we've been doing.

Russia

We're not asking for a lot of money, but we are setting up an arrangement where an American company hires a Russian contractor. Given the current political climate, some people are probably wondering how sanctions and other things enter in.

This is where experience is helpful. Level Up Labs has been working with Russian contractors for several years now, and despite the current political climate, it is perfectly legal to work with Russian contractors. The one wrinkle is tax withholding -- the United States has a law on the books that requires that 30% of all payments to international contractors be withheld and sent to the IRS. However, this tariff is waived entirely if the country in question is on a special list. Russia remains on that list, and only an act of congress can change that.

What if we raise more than $3,000?

If we raise more than the $3,000 we ask for, we have plenty of other uses for the money. For one, we can simply give Alexander a raise. Beyond that, we can use the money to hire other HaxeFlixel contributors, or post open source bounties for the HaxeFlixel community, as well as supporting the open source libraries upon which HaxeFlixel depends (OpenFL, Lime, and Haxe itself).

We're not counting on this happening, but if it does, we will be as transparent as possible in our decision making process.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't pledge money, there's lots of other things you can do to help.

Get the word out

Tell all your friends, and be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools! Tweet, post on facebook, post in forums, you name it.

Donate your game

If you made a game in Flixel or HaxeFlixel, or if you just feel like being generous, give us some keys for your game to give out as pledge rewards! We expect limited tiers to run out fast and it would be nice to refill them or add new ones!

Contribute to the library

Consider getting involved in the open source community :)

We could always use more contributors helping us with bugfixes, features, and patches. And if you don't feel ready to work on the framework itself, we could always use new demos, or some help with the documentation!

Thunderclap it

We have a thunderclap campaign set up, if you could help us reach our audience goal, it will make a big difference on social media:
http://thndr.me/pGKVgg

Level Up Labs is a full United States Limited Liability Corporation, and has operated as HaxeFlixel's small-time corporate sponsor for several years now. Level Up Labs will hire Alex as an independent contractor, under a contract in which all work that he does on HaxeFlixel is immediately released publicly under the MIT license -- basically all the same stuff he's been doing so far, just more of it. Level Up Labs is uniquely suited to this because not only do we have experience with doing these sorts of "open source bounties", we also have a lot of experience specifically with hiring contractors from Russia, several of whom have worked on Defender's Quest DX and the upcoming Defender's Quest II. 
What You Get 
As of this writing, no less than eleven game developers from the Flixel and HaxeFlixel communities have offered Steam Keys for their free and commercial games as pledge rewards, which we'll distribute throughout the various pledge tiers. This is your chance to get great games like Defender's Quest DX, NEO Scavenger, Dino Run DX, The Enchanted Cave 2, and many more, all while supporting the free game framework that will make even more awesome games available in the future! (If you want to add your game, it's not too late! Comment here or here).Furthermore, if you contribute above a certain amount we'll credit you on both the HaxeFlixel.com website and in an internal credits list distributed in the library itself. HaxeFlixel game developers will have access to this list and are thus able to include you in the credits for their games should they so choose.UPDATE (8/16/2016): Thanks to the generosity of Leonardo Cavaletti, anyone who donates at the $15 tier or above will receive a free copy of the Discover HaxeFlixel ebook! And if you're a corporate sponsor, we have Silver, Gold, Platinum, and Unobtanium sponsorship tiers for you if you want to get your logo* on the HaxeFlixel website! *Subject to approval -- if your site is something like "SuperPornGambling.haxxors" we'll have to politely decline, same goes for anything particularly divisive.Here's a full list of the games on offer, so you know what you're getting:HaxeFlixel Fun Pack:Swing TimeJourney of CoinsHow to be CornyCritical AdmissionFlesh to StoneCommercial Games:Dino Run DXSpaceJackedNEO ScavengerDefender's Quest: Valley of the Forgotten DXThe Enchanted Cave 2HolobunniesDefend Your Crypt (3DS)Blasting Agent (3DS)The Impact
I can't emphasize enough how much it will help to have a professional on board. It's amazing what volunteers can do, but their time is necessarily limited. Going from zero full time contributors to one is a huge step. All the things you love about HaxeFlixel already -- features, demos, documentation, can be improved with a professional at the helm. And this won't be just anyone -- it will be our project's own founder, who knows the library inside and out!
Risks & Challenges
Handling Money
We're not asking for a lot of money, but it's important that we're responsible for it. That's why Level Up Labs and the HaxeFlixel contributors are dedicated to transparency. The $3,000 we're asking for today, as well as the other $3,000 we've already raised, will be exclusively earmarked for Alex. We'll provide copies of all relevant contracts, invoices, receipts, and other paperwork (with sensitive personal information redacted), and post them publicly. We'll also do our best to put out news updates on the HaxeFlixel website so you can know what we've been doing. Russia
 We're not asking for a lot of money, but we are setting up an arrangement where an American company hires a Russian contractor. Given the current political climate, some people are probably wondering how sanctions and other things enter in. This is where experience is helpful. Level Up Labs has been working with Russian contractors for several years now, and despite the current political climate, it is perfectly legal to work with Russian contractors. The one wrinkle is tax withholding -- the United States has a law on the books that requires that 30% of all payments to international contractors be withheld and sent to the IRS. However, this tariff is waived entirely if the country in question is on a special list. Russia remains on that list, and only an act of congress can change that.What if we raise more than $3,000?
If we raise more than the $3,000 we ask for, we have plenty of other uses for the money. For one, we can simply give Alexander a raise. Beyond that, we can use the money to hire other HaxeFlixel contributors, or post open source bounties for the HaxeFlixel community, as well as supporting the open source libraries upon which HaxeFlixel depends (OpenFL, Lime, and Haxe itself).We're not counting on this happening, but if it does, we will be as transparent as possible in our decision making process.Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't pledge money, there's lots of other things you can do to help.Get the word outTell all your friends, and be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools! Tweet, post on facebook, post in forums, you name it.Donate your gameIf you made a game in Flixel or HaxeFlixel, or if you just feel like being generous, give us some keys for your game to give out as pledge rewards! We expect limited tiers to run out fast and it would be nice to refill them or add new ones! Contribute to the libraryConsider getting involved in the open source community :)We could always use more contributors helping us with bugfixes, features, and patches. And if you don't feel ready to work on the framework itself, we could always use new demos, or some help with the documentation!Thunderclap itWe have a thunderclap campaign set up, if you could help us reach our audience goal, it will make a big difference on social media:http://thndr.me/pGKVgg

story:
The video above is the type of thing I'm trying to develop, it's not the actual product just very similar and costs in the region of £7000 and is from Segsolutions.com

As an active wheelchair user and keen adventurer, I've always wanted to get out there and see everything I can. After being in a wheelchair for 21 years, it is clear to me that it's an able bodied world and conventional wheelchairs and even power chairs don't quite cut it in some terrains, beaches, Forrest's and country parks are still inaccessible to conventional wheelchairs. 


I stumbled across a Segway wheelchair by accident a couple if years ago but the price tag is over €10000 or about £9000. My plan is to use the same technology, an all terrain personal transporter and create a cheaper sitting option, to reduce the overall cost. I have sourced a cheaper option from a supplier in China - retail £2100 and have some creative ideas of how to fix a stable seating system for all non walking disabled people, at a fraction of the cost. This will result in the whole thing costing under £3000, about the same cost as a bespoke manual/ conventional wheelchair.


This will mean a more affordable and more All Terrain wheelchair for more disabled people to use in areas that have been out if bounds for years.

story:
Who I am?

I´m 24 years old passionate extreme ski-mountaineer from Czech Republic. I´ve already ski some super steep lines in European Alps and in Cordillera Blanca (highest tropical mountain range) in Peru. Now I´d like to push myself again a little bit futher.

What I want to do?

I want to establish the first complete ski descent of 7th highest peak in the world - Dhaulagiri (8167m, 26 795 ft) - ever. Date: September, October 2014.

Why I want to do that?

Mountains are my life and I´m just having a great time in mountains. And during my last year expedition in Peru, I fell in love with high altitude climbing and skiing. Despite I lost there my best friend and climbing partner... But I´m pretty sure he would be as excited as me about going on some himalayan giant! Skiing on eightthousander was our big dream. In my opinion, the fascination by unknown and the desire of discovering white places on the map are genuine emotions and attributes, which make difference between human and animal.

What is the problem?

Big-mountain-skiing in Czech Republic is not so popular and has no support from sponsorship. And it is very difficult to earn so huge amount of money (10 000 $ for expedition per person - check out the Adventure Perk!!!) in my motherland and at my age of 24... Any amount of money from this fund will help me to be closer to my project.


More information:

https://www.facebook.com/KejdaSkiTeam

http://vimeo.com/user2178276


Don´t forget to check my perks - postcards and the possibility of going there together with me!!!

Please share my campaign by getting the word out or by using Indiegogo share tools!


Thank you for your attention and see ya in mountains!

story:
We are team broder, a premiership Team Fortress 2 team of six Northern European gamers. We need your help to get our team to Insomnia 49 this August.

Broder currently stands as the second best team in the European Team Fortress 2 League (ETF2L.org), having fought a close battle in the Season 14 Grand Final but ultimately losing out to Epsilon eSports. For those of you who haven't seen the match, be sure to check it out for some exciting 6v6 action.

Map 1 http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vrPbVAjs6yE&list=PLf27BHuLrQCaI71mDpYZmDQlTn1B1pHUU

Map 2 http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q0t5zkrIiPc&list=PLf27BHuLrQCaI71mDpYZmDQlTn1B1pHUU

Map 3 http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DrwfiAR48xk&list=PLf27BHuLrQCaI71mDpYZmDQlTn1B1pHUU

TEAM ROSTER
As of Season 15, our team is:
bybben (SWE) and cookye (FIN) on scout,
jukebox (SWE) and Zebbosai (SWE) on soldier,
ryb (SWE) on demoman and Mirelin (LVA) on medic.

WHAT'S THE MONEY GOING TOWARDS?
Any kind donations received will go towards LAN-associated costs for our team members. In the main, these are international flights for our six, as well as accommodation in the university rooms near the i49 venue.

WHAT ARE THE EXTRA BONUSES?
We have three tiers of donor rewards, which can be seen in the sidebar. As well as this, our main man Mr. Medic Mirelin will be doing a video log of his time in Telford.

SHOUTOUTS
TCM Gaming have kindly agreed to further help us in our LAN-going effort, and are providing us with tickets as well as PCs at their booth. We thank them very much for their generous support.

Leave your steamid in the comments for the perks.

See you guys there!

story:
Felice Puzzle 1st Edition Soccer Ball.

Welcome to the next generation of Puzzle crazes. This patented 3D puzzle will challenge the most hardened of puzzle aficionados. You may have seen the 15 Puzzle, which originated in 1878, then approximately 100 years later came the Rubik's Cube. Now only 35 years later we bring you what we like to call the "Felice Puzzle", or translated the "Happy Puzzle", the more you play, the faster it "shape shifts" into another dimension. Let's get the world smiling again; as we hope to put a smile on your face as you discover the many aspects we can apply to this concept. The "Felice 3D-Puzzle" is set to become the most popular puzzle of our generation making all of its predecessors look like child's play.

If you think the Cube's 43 Quintillion possibilities, that's 43 billion billion variations, and 36 ways to get home is difficult, the Felice Ball is many times more difficult! It has only one solution, 6 ways to get home and billions of possible combinations. Do you think you have what it takes to meet the challenge of finding just one of the 6 ways to solve the "Felice 3D-Puzzle"?

Since late last year we've had many balls in the air, hard at work establishing World Wide Patents and PCT's, modelling hand-made variations, each one of these taking in excess of 300 hours to precisely manufacture just one of the "Felice 3D-Puzzles". Our team from Simply Puzzling Pty Ltd and PolyPlastics Pty Ltd can now produce this Mind Bending Puzzle in a fraction of the time. We have reduced this process to the extent that we are now ready to bring this Mind-Bending Puzzle to you. After extensive testing and prototyping we are now entering the production phase. This is where you come in to get the ball rolling.

What We Need & What You Get

With your help we will create the biggest craze in puzzles to be released in many years. It will also add an intellectual component to your lives. Never again will you be referred to as a couch potato of your sport, because you can now claim to be an intellectual sports follower. You'll want to take your "Felice 3D-Puzzle" everywhere because you won't be able to put it down.

The first edition of this Mind Bending Puzzle by Simply Puzzling and Polyplastics will be in the form of a "3D Soccer Ball". Your support is needed to fund the initial production dies, tooling, surface pattern production and robotic assembly line. As a result of your support the 3D Puzzle Balls will be available to generations of puzzle and ball sport followers. The Selective Laser Sintering and PolyJet 3D printing models are now ready to create the robotic assembly line.

Your Impact on Our Project

Your commitment today will provide the funds necessary to expedite our final phase – that is getting the product to you as soon as possible. Later we will be bringing the Puzzle to you in many other forms. Due to our unique supportive company structure, not only will you be funding the Puzzle, but your order will also assist the funding of other worthwhile causes such as our new totally Plastic Wheelchair, many years in development, that will provide a cost efficient means of mobility to Developing Countries. Others are the Lupus and Heart Foundation, helping find cures for these disorders – we are committed to each of these causes for a variety of reasons.

Simply Puzzling in conjunction with PolyPlastics are proud to be working together with a fantastic team of enthusiasts, committed to bringing the "Felice 3D-Puzzle" to the world. With over 60 years commercial experience between our companies we know we have the capacity to bring to you, a new dimension of Mind Bending Puzzle, the "Felice 3D-Puzzle".

Other Ways You Can Help

So please pass on the details of our perks to your friends and help us at Simply Puzzling bring the Mind Bending "Felice 3D-Puzzle" to you soon. We look forward to your support and thank you for taking the time to view the Mind Bending Challenges we are bringing to you soon. This is just the beginning so keep watching this space to discover the many variations we are developing to keep you smiling. You will find us on the https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/felice-puzzle or you can find the link on our website http://simplypuzzling.com.au.

Thank you for watching and please support our campaign.

story:
Animus: The Rising of Souls

Hey everyone!, My name is Kyle Grey and my crew and I are making a one of a kind card game! We want our game to be unique and fun... And we are doing so by putting the Player on the front line in battle! Rather than creatures to collect we offer you Weapons, Soul Shards, Powers, and Armor.

    As a kid, I loved Pokemon, as an adult I love Magic: The Gathering, but one thing that I found a card game never really had was Player Involvement, why have creatures on the battlefield? why not have more fun and place us on the battlefield?



    What We Need & What You Will Get

    What we need is $20,000... to most people that may seem like a lot of money, but when you break it down in our expenses for Animus, it will only bring us through the front door of our upcoming presentation in Toronto, Ontario.  Here is a list of what exactly we need to get done and why:

    • A book based on a guide to how to play Animus
    • 150 first generation cards (not including Soul Shard cards)
    • And a Placement mat for beginners
    Though this may seem like we have a lot to get done, we will still have fun on our journey ahead with tons of unique perks, events, and videos to let you know about our every step of the way!

    Risks & Challenges What We Need & What You Will Get

    We have our first meeting on October 25th in Toronto, Ontario with a Gaming Company. What we will need in our presentation is a book on how to play Animus, a placement mat, 150 Cards, and an amazing presentation for them to accept our project! I am confident our crew can pull it off! We will keep you updated in all of our progress by posting videos and blogs of our coming events and challenges, thank you!


    New Update! - September 15th
    Tutorial Book: Sneak Peak!

    New Update! - September 26th
    Placement Mat: Sneak Peak!

    There is a lot more coming!, Keep tuned for more Updates on our progress! Thank you!

story:
Maia is a new god game from indie developer Simon Roth.


Welcome to Maia's Indiegogo campaign! I'm putting up this project for those who want to support the game via Paypal to help us reach our goals of a robot designer and the three new worlds of the Telluric variation expansion

$16,000 - Robot Designer

$96,000 - Telluric Variation Expansion

Inspired heavily by the 70's Sci-fi aesthetic, Maia is a colony management simulator where you must keep your colonists safe, fed and happy. Liberally influenced by nineties god games, the game will have a dark sense of humour and more toys to play with than you can shake a Molyneux at.

Gameplay

You must excavate an underground colony to escape the hostile surface of the world. Mine minerals for construction, build rooms to house, feed and entertain your colonists and intricate defenses to protect them from dangerous wildlife.

Battle the hostile environment of intense seismic activity, meteor strikes, solar flares and the alien ecosystem, whilst maintaining the atmosphere, temperature and integrity of your base.

Carefully manage your lighting to control the unstable moods of your colonists, guide your precious robots and to slow the encroaching jungle.

Research sources of power, water and food. Explore the surface and perform science to produce the future technology you need to survive your new home.

Maia supports Linux, Mac and Windows!

 

"[Maia is] right up there in the top branches of indie games to stare at with creepily unblinking desire." - Alec Meer. RockPaperShotgun

"Sounds suspiciously like the best idea ever." - Futile Position

"Maia is still in an early alpha stage, but it already looks like a fascinating game with a great deal of potential." - Paul Dean. Eurogamer

"I'm hugely excited for Maia. It's great to see developers with this much ambition, and Simon's already made some fantastic progress." - Lewie Procter. SavyGamer

"I'm no Ninjaologist. But that shouldn't diminish one unassailable fact: Simon Roth is a Ninja. I cannot wait to throw my money at the screen..." - Mike Bithell. Thomas was alone

"it’s fair to say that the features list reads like many of my wildest dreams" - Rowan Davies. IndieGameMag

 

Development

Maia is currently in early alpha. A playable alpha release will be available as soon as late January. The game will run on Windows, Mac and Linux and have absolutely no DRM.

The game will ship in summer 2013. After that, development will continue indefinitely, with regular updates, and swathes of new content every month.

Features

  • Up to 2km x 2km x 2km of procedural world
  • Complex colonist AI
  • Dark humour
  • A unique aesthetic
  • Water and Lava simulation
  • A dark ambient soundtrack
  • Cellular Atmosphere
  • A simple minimalist UI
  • Inspired by 1970s hard sci-fi
  • Intricate defense systems
  • Bi-polar androids
  • First person mode
  • Open data for modders.

 

Who is Simon Roth? I hear he has really good hair!

Simon is an indie developer who has made it his mission to be a disruptive force in the games industry. After leaving AAA development (Kinectimals, The Outsider), he went indie, working on the critically acclaimed VVVVVV for Terry Cavanagh and doing graphics research and development for Mode 7 Games.

He is now working full time on Maia.

“I have worked with Simon for a couple of years and I found him to be an excellent game engine designer and developer. I found that Simon was always able to find pragmatic and practical solutions to difficult design and implementation problems. The key to his success as a designer is that he manages to keep things simple to avoid feature creep in his designs.” - Professor Peter Comninos, Founder of the National Center For Computer Animation

"Simon is dead wicked" - Terry Cavanagh, VVVVVV

 

 

Share and Enjoy™

Maia on Twitter, Facebook, Reddit, Forums.

There's the newsletter and RSS feed for keeping up to date.

We also have a very active IRC channel. #maiagame @ http://irc.quakenet.org

 

Interviews about the game:

Beefjack, CitizenGame, Hookshot inc, PC Gamer, PlaySF, PCGamesN.

$16,000 - Robot Designer
$96,000 - Telluric Variation Expansion
Inspired heavily by the 70's Sci-fi aesthetic, Maia is a colony management simulator where you must keep your colonists safe, fed and happy. Liberally influenced by nineties god games, the game will have a dark sense of humour and more toys to play with than you can shake a Molyneux at.
Gameplay
You must excavate an underground colony to escape the hostile surface of the world. Mine minerals for construction, build rooms to house, feed and entertain your colonists and intricate defenses to protect them from dangerous wildlife.
Battle the hostile environment of intense seismic activity, meteor strikes, solar flares and the alien ecosystem, whilst maintaining the atmosphere, temperature and integrity of your base.
Carefully manage your lighting to control the unstable moods of your colonists, guide your precious robots and to slow the encroaching jungle.
Research sources of power, water and food. Explore the surface and perform science to produce the future technology you need to survive your new home.
Maia supports Linux, Mac and Windows!
 
"[Maia is] right up there in the top branches of indie games to stare at with creepily unblinking desire." - Alec Meer. RockPaperShotgun
"Sounds suspiciously like the best idea ever." - Futile Position
"Maia is still in an early alpha stage, but it already looks like a fascinating game with a great deal of potential." - Paul Dean. Eurogamer
"I'm hugely excited for Maia. It's great to see developers with this much ambition, and Simon's already made some fantastic progress." - Lewie Procter. SavyGamer
"I'm no Ninjaologist. But that shouldn't diminish one unassailable fact: Simon Roth is a Ninja. I cannot wait to throw my money at the screen..." - Mike Bithell. Thomas was alone
"it’s fair to say that the features list reads like many of my wildest dreams" - Rowan Davies. IndieGameMag

 
Development
Maia is currently in early alpha. A playable alpha release will be available as soon as late January. The game will run on Windows, Mac and Linux and have absolutely no DRM.
The game will ship in summer 2013. After that, development will continue indefinitely, with regular updates, and swathes of new content every month.
Features

Up to 2km x 2km x 2km of procedural world
Complex colonist AI
Dark humour
A unique aesthetic
Water and Lava simulation
A dark ambient soundtrack
Cellular Atmosphere
A simple minimalist UI
Inspired by 1970s hard sci-fi
Intricate defense systems
Bi-polar androids
First person mode
Open data for modders.
 
Who is Simon Roth? I hear he has really good hair!
Simon is an indie developer who has made it his mission to be a disruptive force in the games industry. After leaving AAA development (Kinectimals, The Outsider), he went indie, working on the critically acclaimed VVVVVV for Terry Cavanagh and doing graphics research and development for Mode 7 Games.
He is now working full time on Maia.
“I have worked with Simon for a couple of years and I found him to be an excellent game engine designer and developer. I found that Simon was always able to find pragmatic and practical solutions to difficult design and implementation problems. The key to his success as a designer is that he manages to keep things simple to avoid feature creep in his designs.” - Professor Peter Comninos, Founder of the National Center For Computer Animation
"Simon is dead wicked" - Terry Cavanagh, VVVVVV
 

 
Share and Enjoy™
Maia on Twitter, Facebook, Reddit, Forums.
There's the newsletter and RSS feed for keeping up to date.
We also have a very active IRC channel. #maiagame @ http://irc.quakenet.org
 

Interviews about the game:
Beefjack, CitizenGame, Hookshot inc, PC Gamer, PlaySF, PCGamesN.

story:
About The Game Crafter

The Game Crafter offers game designers an easy-to-use system to make a board game, card game, or custom playing cards. Free templates, instructions, videos, and proofing tools are available to help people create quality products. The service is print on demand and this means that designers can purchase 1 copy or as many as they need.

Our community of gamers and game designers has grown to over 24,000 users in just a few years. Designers have created over 20,000 different game titles and many have moved on to successful deals with traditional publishers. Our service has matured over the years with a wide range of new products and higher quality game components.

Taking It To The Next Level

We have continued to improve our service over the years and it's an exciting time because designers are now able to make games that look good enough to be sold on the shelves of retailers. The only thing preventing this is the game boxes we produce are not shrink wrapped when they leave our production facility. It's time to change that.

We've always been open to the idea of shrink wrapping the games we make, but it hasn't been a priority because it's not something that we'll make a profit doing. Once you have the machine, the material/labor costs are minimal and those we could easily include in the price of manufacturing the game. However, there is a large upfront cost to buying a high-end shrink wrapping machine and that's what has prevented us from doing it.

However, at this point we've heard from enough people in the community to confirm that there's a real demand for shrink wrapping. Many of you have said that you'd be happy to support a crowdfunded campaign to pay for a shrink wrap solution. We have heard you loud and clear and created this opportunity for you to contribute.

The Shrink Wrap Machines

We have researched and found the best shrink wrapping solutions for an on-demand production system like ours. We are presenting 3 different options below and your financial support will determine which machine will be integrated into The Game Crafter's production process.

Solution 1: Basic Machine ($3,000) - FUNDED!

The basic machine will give us the capability to shrink wrap games after they're manufactured. However, this machine is the slowest of the 3 options and only provides basic functionality with no automation. Therefore, we would not automatically shrink wrap every game that comes off the production line. Instead, it would be a selectable option and it would cost $.75/game. While this machine is the cheapest option when it comes to purchase price, the ongoing costs to use it are higher since it's slower and requires more labor.

Solution 2: Advanced Machine ($7,000) - FUNDED!

The advanced machine costs more than double the Basic Machine. However, the cost is justified because this machine is much faster and allows for limited programming and automation. Faster shrink wrapping and less labor means that it would only cost $.20/game. This is a huge improvement in ongoing costs versus the Basic Machine and the automation means that every game will be shrink wrapped through this process.

Solution 3: Self-Aware Shrink Wrap Robot ($10,000) - FUNDED!

Finally, we have the most efficient (and possibly the scariest) option! The Self-Aware Shrink Wrap Robot! This is truly the best solution because it is the fastest, most capable machine and it streamlines the shrink wrapping process. The automation decreases labor costs and the cost savings allows us to provide an amazing benefit. Choosing this machine means that shrink wrapping for every game is free, for everyone, forever.

Note: We expect delivery and setup of the machine to be completed within 56 days (8 weeks) after the campaign is funded. If possible, we will bring the machine online sooner and begin shrink wrapping all orders.

Vote on New Custom Printable Products!

MANY of you have told us that you want to donate towards specific, new custom printable products in this campaign and you don't want to wait until you can support them as stretch goals. So we have come up with a solution to allow you to vote for the custom printable product you want us to release next! (in April)
 
We now have 3 new voting perks that you can buy and these give you votes to tell us what product(s) you want us to release next. For every $500 we receive from vote perks, we will release 1 new printable product. The product with the most votes will be released first and additional products will be released each time we raise another $500 in voting perks. This means that the most popular products will be funded and released in this campaign! (The initial development of these products costs more than $500/each, but we decided to cover the additional expense beyond that so that products are more cost efficient for the community during this campaign.) We have raised $1100 in Voting Perks so 2 products are guaranteed to be released in late April or early May!
 
Custom Printable Products You Can Vote On:
  1. Bridge Tuck Box (72, 90, or 108-card)
  2. Square Tuck Box (72, 84, 96, or 108-card)
  3. Jumbo Tuck Box (78, 84, 90, 96, 102, or 108-card)
  4. 8" x 10" Game Board
  5. 10 x 10" Game Board   [28 Votes - There is a tie!]
  6. 4" x 10" Game Board   
  7. 4" x 4" Game Board     [11 Votes]
  8. 18-card Booster Packaging   [28 Votes - There is a tie!]

*There is one unused vote at this time. We are trying to reach the voter.

Once you get the voting perk, post your vote on the comments tab!

Because of these changes, we've adjusted our "Additional Stretch Goals" and removed several of the products that were previously listed. Since they can be voted on now, there's no reason to include them as a stretch goal.

Additional Stretch Goals

We receive requests for new features and products almost every single day. It's difficult for us to measure demand for new products & features so we thought it would be a great to add them as stretch goals and let the community decide if they want to support them. If all of the goals below are funded then we'll create new goals with even more features & products!

$11,000 - The Medium Pro Game Box is Released - FUNDED!

The Small Pro Game Box has been a HUGE hit with designers and customers. At this stretch goal, we could design and release a telescoping, full-color, custom printable, Medium Pro Game Box. Delivery within 31-days of campaign and goal being funded.

$14,000 Goal - Bi-Fold Chipboard Game Board Released - $2143 TO GO!

This stretch goal would allow us to design and release a new custom printable bi-fold game board. The game board would be 9" x 18" and be made of the same chipboard material as the quad-fold game boards we currently offer. Delivery within 45 days of campaign and goal being funded.

Note: Fund the stretch goals above and we'll release new ones!

Perks (Frequently Asked Questions)

"What are crafter points and what can you do with them?"

They are like frequent flier miles from an airline. You can cash them in for special perks on our site. Full details are available here. 

"Is it possible to upgrade my perk to a higher one?"

Yes, follow the instructions provided by Indiegogo.

"Is it possible to purchase 2 or more perks?"

Yes, Indiegogo processes every contribution individually. Just make another contribution and you are all set. Read full answer

"My perk is no longer showing up in the list. What happened?"

Indiegogo only allows 12 active perks to be displayed on a campaign. Therefore, when perks sell out, they will disappear from the list and new perks will be added in their place. You're still getting that perk and there is no reason to worry. In fact, you should be happy you got the perk before it sold out! Congrats!

The Game Crafter Team

JT Smith originally founded The Game Crafter in 2001. He self-published his own game titles under the brand and learned how difficult it was to self-publish a tabletop game. In 2009 he put his experience to use and teamed up with co-founders, Tavis Parker and Jamie Vrbsky, to relaunch The Game Crafter as a print on demand game publisher. The rest is history!

All three co-founders LOVE gaming but they are also serial entrepreneurs and enjoy starting new projects and businesses. Each partner has unique skills that help guarantee success:

  • JT Smith is an accomplished technical visionary who develops the software behind The Game Crafter website and builds the automation used in the production processes.
  • Tavis Parker is a passionate marketeer who loves meeting new people and enhancing The Game Crafter brand. He stays busy with promotions, SEO, social media, and copywriting.
  • Jamie Vrbsky is an experienced operations manager who oversees finances, logistics, and personnel. He's the one who makes sure all of our 700+ game parts are in stock!

story:
As the economical crisis advances, the discontent of an entire population cannot help but outburst in Riots, where the sounds of many voices get heard at once. The Director Leonard Menchiari has been experiencing this form of protest in person, and the game "Riot"  was born as a way to express it and to tell the stories of these fights. What is it that triggers such a strife? What does a cop feel during the conflict? In "Riot", the player will experience both sides of a fight in which there is no such thing as "victory" or "defeat".

Only comments and reports from the people joining the conflicts will be taken into consideration, attempting to depict both sides of the fight without bias, only objectivity and facts.

In addition to the rent and living expenses of the people involved, the costs for the research phase and the eventual contribution of other composers, software licenses are required to release the game.

Living in a country drowning in debt and corruption, it is practically impossible for the team to find way to fund the project in Italy and we are therefore asking for your help. We need you to spread the voice on an important issue through the medium of videogames.

Stop listening to the lies of the media, shut down the television and get yourself in the line, to fight for your freedom of speech.

 

Official Website: http://www.riotgame.org
Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/riotgame.org
Twitter Page: https://twitter.com/LMenchiari
Presskit: http://www.riotgame.org/presskit/
FAQs : http://www.riotgame.org/FAQ/

Now on Steam Greenlight http://bit.ly/Yssx0P

 

Contact email:

Leonard Menchiari (creator, Director, Artist): leonard.menchiari@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I'm Trevor Strunk and you might know me better as Hegelbon on twitter and as the author/host of No Cartridge, a podcast and blog about games. 

Thanks to the generosity and support of so many of you, I've been able to make writing about and talking about video games part of my life. The aesthetic and critical approach I've taken has been called unique, welcome, necessary -- but I'm happiest to be contributing to the discourse around games in the best way I know how.

This project is a way for me to expand on that. I want to explore eSports and gaming competition on the ground. And in order to do that, I want to go all-in: building an arcade stick; training up to become competent; and ultimately competing at the highest level (for however briefly that lasts). 

In short, this isn't meant as a new No Cartridge or a new ask for the same material -- this is a one-time longform piece that doesn't have a home or publisher -- yet! -- and which I need some capital to pursue. That's where you come in.

What We Need & What You Get

For this project I need three things:

- An arcade stick, basically the controller people use to actually play fighting games instead of mashing keyboard buttons. These are complex things to build, and, frankly, a large part of the project as it stands. The craft involved in the fighting game scene is unparalleled on the controller level and I need to immerse myself in that to tell this story. I expect this will cost between 100-150 dollars.

- A plane ticket to wherever EVO is. This hasn't been announced yet, so who knows where it'll be? Exciting but expensive. 

- Entry fees to EVO. See above, though I'm guessing this will run 50-100 dollars.

If I only get partially funded, I expect I'll pursue tips, freelance, etc to supplement. The money will first go to the controller, as I'll need that to start the project in earnest. If I get more than the money, I'll provide added journalism, diaries, et al. Updates here, either way.

The Impact

This project has been described as an eSports version of the classic sports journalism text Paper Lion, and I believe humanizing and complicating eSports as a new model for competitive entertainment is important. I have not seen the on-the-ground, material analysis of this rapidly growing sphere, and I want very much to provide it.

Risks & Challenges

Frankly, the biggest risk is that I'm so terrible at fighting games in a competitive scene that I'm unable to qualify for or attend EVO. To the best of my understanding, this should be moot as anyone may register for EVO, but it's a niggling doubt for sure.

Beyond this, I suppose logistics and the complexity and ambition of the project could get in the way. But I do not doubt my ability to write and produce the work at a high quality and unique level.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can share the campaign and suggest stuff for sure! And read my work at no-cartridge.com and listen to the podcast at No Cartridge Audio. The patreon and all is a separate project though, and I want to keep them separate for probably arbitrary reasons, so don't feel compelled or obligated to donate there (though you're of course more than welcome!)

story:
Short Summary


Hello there,

My name is Chris Fernandez. I am a 24 year old photographer based in Edinburgh, Scotland.

My project will act as a commentary on the 'wrong man in the wrong place at the wrong time' genre. Ranging from the likes of North by Northwest to Die Hard, I hope to parody the idea of the Hollywood Every-man; substituting a more contemporary Scottish Every-man in place of the traditional handsome leading male. At the same time, I hope to pay tribute to the style and aesthetics of US and world cinema alike. 

I have been working on this project for the best part of a year, not including the planning, and am currently looking for completion funding to put on exhibitions in Edinburgh, London and Oslo. So far, I have funded the project myself, but looking for a little help printing images, improving PR and renting the exhibition space. 

With any luck, this project will help me establish myself within the field of fine art photography, and ideally; help me find work as a cinematographer.



Funding would really help launch my career and reputation, both locally and internationally. Again, I am looking to exhibit in Edinburgh, London and Oslo. 

What We Need & What You Get

In terms of funding, I am looking to raise £500. This will be spent on printing images for the show; printing out flyers and raising public awareness as to when and where the exhibition will be held; as well as paying for the exhibition space.  Even then, I will be putting up a lot of money myself.

In exchange for funding, I will be more than happy to send out a copy of any requested prints. I have added a couple of raw images from the project to my page. The complete collection will be updated to my website: www.christopherfernandez.com after the exhibition. Please have a look. 

The Impact

The inspiration of this project comes down to my love of film, as well as the success I had with similar, film-style images;

 


A number of film-inspired images went down well before and I was able to sell several prints; I am hoping to do the same with this upcoming project. 

Thanks for reading;

Chris.

story:
Version Française au bas.

Blitztream and Third Epoch

Blitztream believes games can make the world better. Our games are a lens through which to advocate human potential.

Our first iOS and Android game, Third Epoch, is an epic turn-based “3T” (trading, travel, tactics) space game of spaceships, discovery, and adventure.

We’ve taken well-loved elements of classic space strategy games, and redesigned them with a positive bent:

  • Fight with brains, not brawn. Use scientific tools, instead of conventional weapons, to neutralize dangerous space anomalies and disable hostile ships.
  • Personality based perspective. Are you a thinker or doer? Do you bend the rules or play by the book? Your actions determine who you are and what you discover.
  • Discovery driven missions. From the Cryptoliths on Zamzummin to the Sealed Vessel in the Outer Rim, follow assignments that gradually reveal epic cosmic mysteries.
  • Travel interstellar trade routes. Coffee, tea, spices, rare metals... The universe is criss-crossed with trade routes defined by the culture and histories of their different regions.
  • Cinematic replays. See the outcomes of your tactical decisions played back in exciting cinematic sequences.

Third Epoch is free-to-play. You can top-up with in-app micro-purchases when you need to or
want to.

The scope of the game - ships, star systems, tools, characters, and stories - will expand over a series of three campaigns, with each one building up to the next epic cosmic event. Each introduces new interstellar civilizations from beyond the known universe with mission arcs that challenge important social, environmental, economic, and scientific themes.


What We Need & What You Get

We’ve been working hard for the past year on our pilot version. Third Epoch:Rising is a prelude to the first campaign that introduces players to a scaled-down version of the game and universe. We’ll gradually expand these over incremental updates. Rising will launch with the following:

  • 3 initial “star-system” distance ship classes, with multiple models per ship class.
  • 1 star cluster (known as The Bean Route) with 5 star systems and 9 space stations.
  • 15 initial different tools that can be mounted to ships.
  • 3-5 major mission arcs.
  • Single player mode

But we want to give players more. So we’re asking the community of space game fans to play a role in expanding the Third Epoch universe.

Crowdfunding will enable us to do the following:

  • 12 star clusters with complete star systems
  • 20 story-arc multi-assignment missions featuring point-of-view characters
  • 10 new ships from Freighter and a Explorer classes
  • Level 2 and 3 tools
  • Asynchronous multiplayer
  • A whole bunch of refinements and improvements to the UI

We’re offering some amazing rewards starting as low as $1. AR mini-cards of ships complete with 3D exploded views, detailed specs, and histories. Gorgeous AR wall posters with zoom-ins and information on planets and star systems in the universe. A limited edition book all about Third Epoch’s trade routes, ships and technology, characters, and board game rules you can play with your AR mini-cards. Top tier backers get to co-create parts of the universe with us. We’ll immortalize elite backers by including your ideas into mission arcs and essential characters. Everyone who backs us automatically receives extra Ambers when they start the game. And, since Blitztream believes in social good, we’re committing 10% of our revenue to sponsor worthwhile causes, including organizations like Child’s Play and Right To Play that bring the gift of games and sports to under-privileged kids.


The Impact

A lot of game designers and publishers in the mobile space are simply making cheap disposable games.  We have a different mission.  We believe games have the same artistic responsibility as literature and film.  There’s enormous potential for games to have a very positive influence on how we envision and consequently create the future.

With Third Epoch, we wanted to redefine epic gaming on mobile platforms, by creating the first "hardcore science fiction" game. By this, we mean using our fictional universe in the format of an epic game to explore possibilities in context to social ideas.

We realized there was an opportunity to do something different - to create a modern take on a game focused instead on exploration, discovery, and intelligent heroism - and dispel the negative stereotypes games have been criticized for. Epic cosmic plots, culturally-diverse interstellar trade-routes, non-destructive combat, topical mission arcs, and a personality-based character alignment system are all elements we re-imagined for this purpose.


Other Ways You Can Help

We hope that if you’re a fan of science fiction and turn-based “3T” space games and share our belief in games that have a positive influence, you’ll get behind our project and back us. You'll be the fuel for the start of a paradigm shifting movement in gaming. However, you can also help by spreading the word and sharing Blitztream and Third Epoch with your friends. Add your Like to our Facebook page here - www.facebook.com/Blitztream - and follow us on Twitter - www.twitter.com/Blitztream. Or use the Share tools on Indiegogo to reach out to your social network. Either way, we’d love to know what you think, so leave us your comments.

------------------------------

Blitztream et Third Epoch

Blitztream croit que les jeux peuvent rendre le monde meilleur. Nos jeux sont un prisme à travers lequel nous préconisons le potentiel humain.

"Third Epoch" est notre premier jeu iOS et Android, qui est une épopée dans l'espace de jeu de vaisseaux spatiaux, la découverte et l'aventure.

Nous avons pris les éléments appréciés des autres jeux de stratégie classiques et l'avons créé avec un esprit positif:

  • Combattre avec l’intelligence plutôt que la force physique. Utiliser des
    outils scientifiques au lieu des armes conventionnelles pour neutraliser des éléments hostiles.
  • Personnalité évolutive. Êtes-vous impulsif ou réfléchi? Contournez-vous les règles ou les respectez-vous? Vos actions déterminent qui vous êtes et ce que vous découvrez.
  • Missions d'exploration. Des Cryptoliths sur Zamzoummin jusqu'aux vaisseaux navigants aux lointaines contrées de l'univers. Recevez des affectations qui vous révèlent peu à peu des mystères cosmiques.
  • Voyagez sur des routes commerciales interstellaires. Café, thé, épices et métaux rares... L'univers est sillonnée de routes commerciales définies par la culture et l'histoire de leurs différentes régions.
  • Rediffusion cinématographique. Voir les résultats de vos décisions tactiques dans des séquences en temps réelle.

"Third Epoch" est un jeu gratuit. Par contre, il sera possible d'acheter des extras à même le jeu lorsque vous le désirez.


Nos besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Nous avons travaillé dur pour la dernière année sur notre version première. "Third Epoch: Rising"
est un prélude à la première campagne qui introduit les joueurs à une version réduite du jeu et de l'univers. Nous allons progressivement l’accroître aux cours de mises à jour. "Rising" lancera ce
qui suit:

  • 3 catégories de vaisseaux spatiaux, avec de multiples sous-modèles
    par catégories,
  • 1 amas stellaire avec 5 systèmes solaires et 9 stations spatiales,
  • 15 outils qui peuvent être montés à bord des vaisseaux,
  • 3 à 5 missions majeurs,
  • Possibilité de jouer avec un seul joueur.

Mais nous voulons donner aux joueurs plus. Nous demandons donc à la communauté des amateurs de jeux spatiaux à jouer un rôle dans l'expansion de "Third Epoch".

Les fonds amassés par cette campagne nous permettrons de faire ce qui suit:

  • 12 amas stellaires avec des systèmes solaires complets,
  • 20 missions avec différentes affectations présentant de nouveaux personnages,
  • 10 nouveaux vaisseaux de cargo et explorateur,
  • Augmentation de la performance des outils,
  • Multijoueur asynchrone,
  • Plusieurs ajustements et améliorations de l'interface d'utilisateur.

Nous offrons des récompenses intéressantes en échange de vos contributions commençant à aussi peu que 1$ telles que des cartes de vaisseaux en réalité augmentée avec des vues 3D éclatées, des spécifications détaillées et leur histoire, des affiches murales en réalité augmentée avec l'information sur les planètes et systèmes stellaires, un livre en édition limitée de l'univers "Third Epoch", leurs vaisseaux, technologie et personnages. Les contributeurs de catégorie "Rear Admiral" et supérieur pourront co-créer une parties de l'univers avec nous. Nous allons immortaliser les contributeurs "Admiral" en incluant vos idées de mission et les personnages essentiels. Tout le monde qui nous supportent reçoivent automatiquement des "ambres" (monnaie) supplémentaires au début de la partie. Et puisque Blitztream croit en les causes sociales, nous nous engageons à donner 10% de notre chiffre d'affaires à parrainer des causes valables, y compris des organisations telles que "Child's Play" et "Right to Play".


L'impact

Un grand nombre de concepteurs et éditeurs de jeux dans le monde mobile ne font que produire des jeux jetables à bas prix. Nous avons une mission différente. Nous croyons que les jeux ont la même responsabilité artistique que la littérature et le cinéma. Il y a un énorme potentiel pour les jeux d'avoir une influence très positive sur la façon dont nous envisageons l'avenir.


Avec "Third Epoch", nous voulons redéfinir les jeux mémorables sur les plate-formes mobiles en explorant les possibilités dans le contexte d'idées sociales.

Nous avons réalisé qu'il y avait une occasion de faire quelque chose de différent, de créer une version moderne d'un jeu axé plutôt sur l'exploration, la découverte et l'héroïsme intelligent et dissiper les stéréotypes négatifs. Les combats non-destructif et des personnalités à caractère évolutif sont tous des éléments que nous recréons dans ce but.


D'autres façons d'aider

Nous espérons que si vous êtes un amateur de science-fiction et de jeux spatiaux et partagez notre croyance dans les jeux qui ont une influence positive, vous serez derrière notre projet et nous supporterez. Cependant, vous pouvez aussi aider en passant le mot et en partageant Blitztream et "Third Epoch" avec vos amis sur vos réseaux sociaux.

Nous aimerions savoir ce que vous pensez, alors laissez-nous vos commentaires.
story_txt:
Version Française au bas.





Blitztream and Third Epoch
Blitztream believes games can make the world better. Our games are a lens through which to advocate human potential.
Our first iOS and Android game, Third Epoch, is an epic turn-based “3T” (trading, travel, tactics) space game of spaceships, discovery, and adventure.
We’ve taken well-loved elements of classic space strategy games, and redesigned them with a positive bent:


Fight with brains, not brawn. Use scientific tools, instead of conventional weapons, to neutralize dangerous space anomalies and disable hostile ships.

Personality based perspective. Are you a thinker or doer? Do you bend the rules or play by the book? Your actions determine who you are and what you discover.

Discovery driven missions. From the Cryptoliths on Zamzummin to the Sealed Vessel in the Outer Rim, follow assignments that gradually reveal epic cosmic mysteries.

Travel interstellar trade routes. Coffee, tea, spices, rare metals... The universe is criss-crossed with trade routes defined by the culture and histories of their different regions.

Cinematic replays. See the outcomes of your tactical decisions played back in exciting cinematic sequences.

Third Epoch is free-to-play. You can top-up with in-app micro-purchases when you need to or want to.
The scope of the game - ships, star systems, tools, characters, and stories - will expand over a series of three campaigns, with each one building up to the next epic cosmic event. Each introduces new interstellar civilizations from beyond the known universe with mission arcs that challenge important social, environmental, economic, and scientific themes.










What We Need & What You Get
We’ve been working hard for the past year on our pilot version. Third Epoch:Rising is a prelude to the first campaign that introduces players to a scaled-down version of the game and universe. We’ll gradually expand these over incremental updates. Rising will launch with the following:

3 initial “star-system” distance ship classes, with multiple models per ship class.
1 star cluster (known as The Bean Route) with 5 star systems and 9 space stations.
15 initial different tools that can be mounted to ships.
3-5 major mission arcs.
Single player mode

But we want to give players more. So we’re asking the community of space game fans to play a role in expanding the Third Epoch universe.
Crowdfunding will enable us to do the following:

12 star clusters with complete star systems
20 story-arc multi-assignment missions featuring point-of-view characters
10 new ships from Freighter and a Explorer classes
Level 2 and 3 tools
Asynchronous multiplayer
A whole bunch of refinements and improvements to the UI

We’re offering some amazing rewards starting as low as $1. AR mini-cards of ships complete with 3D exploded views, detailed specs, and histories. Gorgeous AR wall posters with zoom-ins and information on planets and star systems in the universe. A limited edition book all about Third Epoch’s trade routes, ships and technology, characters, and board game rules you can play with your AR mini-cards. Top tier backers get to co-create parts of the universe with us. We’ll immortalize elite backers by including your ideas into mission arcs and essential characters. Everyone who backs us automatically receives extra Ambers when they start the game. And, since Blitztream believes in social good, we’re committing 10% of our revenue to sponsor worthwhile causes, including organizations like Child’s Play and Right To Play that bring the gift of games and sports to under-privileged kids.



The Impact
A lot of game designers and publishers in the mobile space are simply making cheap disposable games.  We have a different mission.  We believe games have the same artistic responsibility as literature and film.  There’s enormous potential for games to have a very positive influence on how we envision and consequently create the future.
With Third Epoch, we wanted to redefine epic gaming on mobile platforms, by creating the first "hardcore science fiction" game. By this, we mean using our fictional universe in the format of an epic game to explore possibilities in context to social ideas.
We realized there was an opportunity to do something different - to create a modern take on a game focused instead on exploration, discovery, and intelligent heroism - and dispel the negative stereotypes games have been criticized for. Epic cosmic plots, culturally-diverse interstellar trade-routes, non-destructive combat, topical mission arcs, and a personality-based character alignment system are all elements we re-imagined for this purpose.


Other Ways You Can Help
We hope that if you’re a fan of science fiction and turn-based “3T” space games and share our belief in games that have a positive influence, you’ll get behind our project and back us. You'll be the fuel for the start of a paradigm shifting movement in gaming. However, you can also help by spreading the word and sharing Blitztream and Third Epoch with your friends. Add your Like to our Facebook page here - www.facebook.com/Blitztream - and follow us on Twitter - www.twitter.com/Blitztream. Or use the Share tools on Indiegogo to reach out to your social network. Either way, we’d love to know what you think, so leave us your comments. ------------------------------Blitztream et Third Epoch

Blitztream croit que les jeux peuvent rendre le monde meilleur. Nos jeux sont un prisme à travers lequel nous préconisons le potentiel humain.
"Third Epoch" est notre premier jeu iOS et Android, qui est une épopée dans l'espace de jeu de vaisseaux spatiaux, la découverte et l'aventure.
Nous avons pris les éléments appréciés des autres jeux de stratégie classiques et l'avons créé avec un esprit positif:

Combattre avec l’intelligence plutôt que la force physique. Utiliser des outils scientifiques au lieu des armes conventionnelles pour neutraliser des éléments hostiles.
Personnalité évolutive. Êtes-vous impulsif ou réfléchi? Contournez-vous les règles ou les respectez-vous? Vos actions déterminent qui vous êtes et ce que vous découvrez.

Mais nous voulons donner aux joueurs plus. Nous demandons donc à la communauté des amateurs de jeux spatiaux à jouer un rôle dans l'expansion de "Third Epoch".

Plusieurs ajustements et améliorations de l'interface d'utilisateur. 

Nous offrons des récompenses intéressantes en échange de vos contributions commençant à aussi peu que 1$ telles que des cartes de vaisseaux en réalité augmentée avec des vues 3D éclatées, des spécifications détaillées et leur histoire, des affiches murales en réalité augmentée avec l'information sur les planètes et systèmes stellaires, un livre en édition limitée de l'univers "Third Epoch", leurs vaisseaux, technologie et personnages. Les contributeurs de catégorie "Rear Admiral" et supérieur pourront co-créer une parties de l'univers avec nous. Nous allons immortaliser les contributeurs "Admiral" en incluant vos idées de mission et les personnages essentiels. Tout le monde qui nous supportent reçoivent automatiquement des "ambres" (monnaie) supplémentaires au début de la partie. Et puisque Blitztream croit en les causes sociales, nous nous engageons à donner 10% de notre chiffre d'affaires à parrainer des causes valables, y compris des organisations telles que "Child's Play" et "Right to Play".

L'impact

Un grand nombre de concepteurs et éditeurs de jeux dans le monde mobile ne font que produire des jeux jetables à bas prix. Nous avons une mission différente. Nous croyons que les jeux ont la même responsabilité artistique que la littérature et le cinéma. Il y a un énorme potentiel pour les jeux d'avoir une influence très positive sur la façon dont nous envisageons l'avenir.Avec "Third Epoch", nous voulons redéfinir les jeux mémorables sur les plate-formes mobiles en explorant les possibilités dans le contexte d'idées sociales.

Les combats non-destructif et des personnalités à caractère évolutif sont tous des éléments que nous recréons dans ce but.

D'autres façons d'aider

Nous espérons que si vous êtes un amateur de science-fiction et de jeux spatiaux et partagez notre croyance dans les jeux qui ont une influence positive, vous serez derrière notre projet et nous supporterez. story:
see more at http://www.indiedb.com/games/frozen-nightmare

 

In the year 2023 the U.S government started to work on a drug that was capable of taking any body and increase its muscles size and strength, the first test on an actual human was performed on the year 2025, the results were horrendous, the human dramatically gained muscle size but the tested subject became extremely dumb and violent, he was described as a gorilla and had to be killed right away. The drug stopped being produced and tested. In the year 2028 a hospital in Michigan reported a huge number of people infected with an unknown virus, the virus got the name of "gorilla virus", people infected by it were described as wild animals that just wanted to destroy things, including other humans. The virus rapidly spread across the U.S and later across the world. 

You are one of the lucky (if lucky is to watch you whole family and friends turn to monsters and try to kill you ) survivors that are immune to the virus, you were raised in Alaska, the whole state is infected , your task is to survive as long as you can. In order to do that you got to take care of your health, nutrition and water bar. to survive you have to explore the terrain to find water, medicine and meat. The terrain is huge so keep that in mind, vehicle are planned to be added. 

 

what will be done with the money?!!!
--buy unity pro
- hire people (i need a 3d modeler)
- pay for the music
-pay for the web hosting
-pay for my food and needs!
-buy better hardware (a better pc)

story:
Drill Deep is an arcade mobile game inspired by titles such as the (Super) Motherload and Miner Disturbance. The gameplay consists of drilling procedurally generated tunnels two blocks at the time while maintaining hull integrity and fuel. You collect different minerals and gems on your way to the core of the planet. During your journey you will come across stations where you can unload your cargo and buy upgrades - will you enlarge your fuel tank for those long journeys, or will you improve your hull plating to protect yourself?

Drill Deep has three gameplay modes split across three worlds. All of these can be accessed from the planet selection screen.
  • The main game is located on an Earth-like planet, and it contains four soil layers, each harder and more rewarding than the previous. All money earned here can be used to buy tickets to other stellar bodies.
  • The planet's icy moon hosts a slow paced mode for a carefree endless drilling, accompanied by a releaxing soundtrack and vibe.
  • A hot dwarf hosts the competitive mode. Fast paced drilling through the magma-ridden dwarf with weekly leaderboards with various in-game prizes. A single mistake means failure - How long can you last?

The engine is mostly complete, we have graphics for most of the stuff, and we have a few sound effects as well as some music. However, all planets apart from Terra have little to no gameplay for now. Since our engine is modular, we only have to finish Terra, and the rest will follow. The store and upgrades are partially implemented, but they need some work before they can be properly used. So in a nutshell, we have to finish the main planet, and some fixes to the rest. It isn't as easy as it sounds, but we're getting there.

We consist of two Finnish students. Both of us have aspired to create a game of our own for what seems to be ages, and we're close to releasing one. Drill Deep is mostly developed by me, Michael, with the occasional help and bughunt from a very dear friend of mine - Riku. For the last few years, I have spent countless hours making up stories, characters and worlds in my head while going about my day. Some of these have ended up having sprite sheets, deep backstories and sometimes even complete 3d-models, all at the expense of my studies and social life. During this time I have learned how to sprite using various techniques, draw using countless unique programs and 3d-model pretty much anything from creatures to landscapes; I am a designer at heart.

We are also accompanied by the amazing Bright Primate! They are a futurepunk duo from the dystopian submerged city of Boston Massachusetts in the year 2199. Inspired by psycho-acoustic images from both the deep past and far future, their signature sound of raw hardware chiptune synthesis and powerful vocal stylings evoke both gracefully mutated pop and blistering electronic noise rock.

As students, money is a huge brickwall to us when it comes to developing this game. We believe that crowdfunding is the perfect solution to push the game into completion, as we simply cannot afford to do so. So far we've worked with practically nothing, and our resources are limited, as we have to pay for the engine, devkits and publishing fees as well as the folk behind the amazing soundtrack. Some most basic software wouldn't hurt either.

story:
Godly Corp is an over-the-top simulator where you play as intern god in a corporation. Use your tentacle arm to perform many unusual office tasks. Master woobly tentacle physics and try to not destroy all life on the planets that you take care of. Every day brings completely new challenges.

 

USEFUL LINKS

  • Playable demo on Itch.io
  • Stay updated at the TR8 Torus dev blog
  • Steam Store Page
  • For more detailed information check out the press kit

 

 

There  won't be time for you to get bored in this game as EVERY day is a completely new challenge. On Monday you will be fighting bug infestation, Tuesdays are usually the days when someone tries to rob us, Wednesday might be the casual day! If these assignments sound too easy to you then we guarantee that the more experienced you are the more interesting challenges you will get! 

And we mean it. Godly Corp is divided into levels / days, and every day presents a new challenge. Player will be forced to multitask and master the tentacle mechanics to complete the level. Each level takes 4-7 minutes to complete (although some of theme might take couple tries since they are pretty challenging)

 

At beginning of each level player will be provided with instructions and when ready, the start button can be pushed to begin the level. Sometimes you will have to 'survive' until the end of the shift and sometimes you will have to complete some task before the clock rings. The levels themselves also often contain different twists that change rules mid level.

All levels take place next to your desk but the environment often changes. Sometimes you will be closed in your cubicle, on other days you will have view on the whole office and on some days your cubicle might get launched in space to perform some special assignments.

 

 

Most of the fun comes from game presentation, hilarious tentacle mechanics and tasks that you have to perform. At the end of the level, your performance is evaluated. You might try to improve your score or switch to harder difficulty to get better modifier.

 

Godly Corp is inspired by games like Surgeon Simulator, Octodad and Goat Simulator. 

 
 
 
 

 

Godly Corp is mostly done, at least for PC. There are 11 levels already done and polished and another 9 that are still in progress. During the beta testing phase, tester suggested doing VR version. However we didn't plan the budget for extended development time that making this port would take. We  also need to get necessary equipment to be able to start working on VR. 

 

 

Perks and rewards in details

Applicant 5$ - We really appreciate your support and want to thank you by putting your name in credits in backers section.

Intern 10$ - You will get Steam key for Godly Corp as soon as game is released and your name will be in the credits.

Office Assistant 20$ - Get all perks above but right after the campaign finishes, you will get Steam key. So far game is available on Windows, Linux and Mac. When campaign ends, we will start working on VR. You will be able to play the game whenever you want and check progress and suggest some changes in Godly Corp.

Virtual Assistant 50$ - Your recorder audio clip will be in the pool of songs that radio is playing during levels! The clip shouldn't be longer than 15-20 seconds. You have to have rights to the audio clip that you want to put in the game.

File Clerk 80$ - Your picture / avatar will be in 'Employee of the Month' frame that is visible above your desk! You will be able to choose one level in which you can put your picture. Not all levels have 'Employee of the Month' frame through the whole duration of the 'shift' so after campaign ends, you can choose from available levels. You have to have rights to the picture / avatar that you want to put in the game.

Office Support Manager 150$ - You get to give the idea for the whole level! Don't hold back and let your imagination go all out as existing levels are hectic and full of twists! After campaign ends we will talk about your idea and make sure that you are satisfied with the level.

 

Backers will get all perks and rewards even if campaign won't reach it's goal since this crowdfunding has flexible goal. TR8 Torus Studios reserves the right to refuse ideas and content that we deem objectionable, controversial, political, religious, etc. We will work something out if the initial content / idea was not acceptable for the game.

 

 

Let's start with the history of the Godly Corp. This game started as game jam project, it was made under 48 hours. According to scores, Godly Corp did great and many players liked the humor and unusual game mechanics. At this point we knew that there is potential in this game and we decided to give Godly Corp a shot! After a week or two we had the first prototype of new Tentacle! Feel free to read the whole 'backstory' of the Godly Corp.

There are three people working on the game. All of us are experienced in game dev in one way or another but none of us worked on a commercial title until now. 

 

 

The development shouldn't take longer than 3 months. Although if the campaign won't reach the goal, then we will continue working on the game. But in that case, first we will release PC version and then if it will be financially possible, we will work on VR port. 

This project won't be abandoned, we already put too much time and work in Godly Corp. Testers are pretty happy with the game but as with any game, the risk is that it might not land with some players.

 

 

Well thank you for reading through all of that and your time! Any kind of support is highly appreciated. If you can't support the campaign financially, please Tweet about our project and tell your friends about. We are extremely grateful for all the support and thank you very much for helping us make this game happened. Hopefully you will be happy with the game and have a lot fun playing Godly Corp.

If you have any questions, suggestions or anything that you want to talk about with us, please contact us. We are more than happy to answer any questions and your suggestion might be extremely useful as we are still in development phase and nothing is 100% set in stone.

 

ARTICLES

“Apparently, there’s a lot you can do with a desk, a globe, and a tentacle”

– Lucia Taylor, Cliqist

 

“The game is packed with many funny references. Some of them are straightforward and some are a little hidden.”

– Luis ‘Jazzking2001’ Holguin-Veras (interview), Neocrisis

 

“This game feels like one of those hidden indie game gems just waiting to be discovered!”

– Behind The Indies (interview)
