  There  won't be time for you to get bored in this game as EVERY day is a completely new challenge. On Monday you will be fighting bug infestation, Tuesdays are usually the days when someone tries to rob us, Wednesday might be the casual day! If these assignments sound too easy to you then we guarantee that the more experienced you are the more interesting challenges you will get! And we mean it. Godly Corp is divided into levels / days, and every day presents a new challenge. Player will be forced to multitask and master the tentacle mechanics to complete the level. Each level takes 4-7 minutes to complete (although some of theme might take couple tries since they are pretty challenging) At beginning of each level player will be provided with instructions and when ready, the start button can be pushed to begin the level. Sometimes you will have to 'survive' until the end of the shift and sometimes you will have to complete some task before the clock rings. The levels themselves also often contain different twists that change rules mid level.All levels take place next to your desk but the environment often changes. Sometimes you will be closed in your cubicle, on other days you will have view on the whole office and on some days your cubicle might get launched in space to perform some special assignments.  Most of the fun comes from game presentation, hilarious tentacle mechanics and tasks that you have to perform. At the end of the level, your performance is evaluated. You might try to improve your score or switch to harder difficulty to get better modifier. Godly Corp is inspired by games like Surgeon Simulator, Octodad and Goat Simulator.      Godly Corp is mostly done, at least for PC. There are 11 levels already done and polished and another 9 that are still in progress. During the beta testing phase, tester suggested doing VR version. However we didn't plan the budget for extended development time that making this port would take. We  also need to get necessary equipment to be able to start working on VR.   Perks and rewards in detailsApplicant 5$ - We really appreciate your support and want to thank you by putting your name in credits in backers section.Intern 10$ - You will get Steam key for Godly Corp as soon as game is released and your name will be in the credits.Office Assistant 20$ - Get all perks above but right after the campaign finishes, you will get Steam key. So far game is available on Windows, Linux and Mac. When campaign ends, we will start working on VR. You will be able to play the game whenever you want and check progress and suggest some changes in Godly Corp.Virtual Assistant 50$ - Your recorder audio clip will be in the pool of songs that radio is playing during levels! The clip shouldn't be longer than 15-20 seconds. You have to have rights to the audio clip that you want to put in the game.File Clerk 80$ - Your picture / avatar will be in 'Employee of the Month' frame that is visible above your desk! You will be able to choose one level in which you can put your picture. Not all levels have 'Employee of the Month' frame through the whole duration of the 'shift' so after campaign ends, you can choose from available levels. You have to have rights to the picture / avatar that you want to put in the game.Office Support Manager 150$ - You get to give the idea for the whole level! Don't hold back and let your imagination go all out as existing levels are hectic and full of twists! After campaign ends we will talk about your idea and make sure that you are satisfied with the level. Backers will get all perks and rewards even if campaign won't reach it's goal since this crowdfunding has flexible goal. TR8 Torus Studios reserves the right to refuse ideas and content that we deem objectionable, controversial, political, religious, etc. We will work something out if the initial content / idea was not acceptable for the game.  Let's start with the history of the Godly Corp. This game started as game jam project, it was made under 48 hours. According to scores, Godly Corp did great and many players liked the humor and unusual game mechanics. At this point we knew that there is potential in this game and we decided to give Godly Corp a shot! After a week or two we had the first prototype of new Tentacle! Feel free to read the whole 'backstory' of the Godly Corp.There are three people working on the game. All of us are experienced in game dev in one way or another but none of us worked on a commercial title until now.   The development shouldn't take longer than 3 months. Although if the campaign won't reach the goal, then we will continue working on the game. But in that case, first we will release PC version and then if it will be financially possible, we will work on VR port. This project won't be abandoned, we already put too much time and work in Godly Corp. Testers are pretty happy with the game but as with any game, the risk is that it might not land with some players.  Well thank you for reading through all of that and your time! Any kind of support is highly appreciated. If you can't support the campaign financially, please Tweet about our project and tell your friends about. We are extremely grateful for all the support and thank you very much for helping us make this game happened. Hopefully you will be happy with the game and have a lot fun playing Godly Corp.If you have any questions, suggestions or anything that you want to talk about with us, please contact us. We are more than happy to answer any questions and your suggestion might be extremely useful as we are still in development phase and nothing is 100% set in stone. ARTICLES“Apparently, there’s a lot you can do with a desk, a globe, and a tentacle”– Lucia Taylor, Cliqist “The game is packed with many funny references. Some of them are straightforward and some are a little hidden.”– Luis ‘Jazzking2001’ Holguin-Veras (interview), Neocrisis “This game feels like one of those hidden indie game gems just waiting to be discovered!”– Behind The Indies (interview)

story:
CompleTech Entertainment Center

We are a small game store with big dreams within Charlotte, MI. Our current location  on Cochran Ave. is too small for our growing community. We have an opportunity to acquire a significantly larger building that will allow us to continue growing for many years to come. 

What We Need & What You Get

Let's be honest, this is a call for the community to help us grow. 
  • A friendly, open tabletop gaming atmosphere located between five of Michigan's larger cities (Battle Creek, Grand Rapids, Jackson, Kalamazoo, and Lansing).
  • A safe, family friendly environment to meet new friends, play games with family, and rediscover the fun of tabletop gaming. 
  • A variety of perks as thanks (with additional goals being added once we reach out goal)

The Impact

In this day and age, kids are either inside playing video games or outside causing mischief and getting into trouble. Tabletop gaming provides a socially interactive environment with the same entertainment value of a video game while also helping to build social skills. Additionally, we have to face the reality that there are many places that provide a negative impact that can lead kids astray towards unsavory activities. 
One of our main priorities is to help our community grow in a healthy way and we feel that our store provides that opportunity. 

Risks & Challenges

It is possible that despite getting the required funds, we may be unable to acquire the building due to it being an auction. However, any funds received will be used to improve our current location with a substantial amount being set aside to put an offer on the next opportunity to expand. 
The time-frame to act on this opportunity is very small and we must act quickly to come together as a community to make this dream a reality. Every little bit counts and we greatly appreciate any assistance you can give!

Other Ways You Can Help

We absolutely understand if you find yourself unable to donate, but you can still help in other ways! Such as:

  • Sharing our cause, whether on social media or by word of mouth
  • Coming to the store to show your support
  • Come visit us at the upcoming free Cabin Fever tabletop convention in Hastings at the Barry Expo Center. Attend our booth to meet us and participate in other events.

story:
ULTIMATE PUMP - For Female Muscle Fans!

This is a dating sim/RPG for those of us who love strong women!

Play as Aria (or whatever you name her) and navigate the city of Crestpeak Bay. It's totally up to you how buff you can get and how many girls you can woo successfully!

Best of all, this game will be made available FREE to everyone!

The base game will include:

  • 9 locations that are affected by the time of day and day of the week
  • 6 "dateable" girls with several unique interactions and events
  • The ability for Aria to gain up to 500 pounds of muscle and 5000cc breast size
  • A whole cast of side characters
  • 40 gallery unlockables

The main game will be rated-R with some smutty unlockables.

If you want more details of what the game will be like, please read this document: https://goo.gl/NCNxtA

The Staff

  • Moxy - Project Lead, Artist, Animator, Writer
  • SergeantBuck - Lead Writer
  • Soylent Orange - Writer/Editor
  • SHI-Art - Developer

Meet the Girls!

Each of the girls has their own unique personalities and backstories for you to uncover. In the game, they will all be given multiple acting expressions and different outfits, too!

Aria - The Player Character

Mandy - The Social Media Champ

Aiko - The Petite Powerlifter

Sofia - The Frost Giant

Lacina - The Diva of Diet

Jennifer - The Roid Connoisseur

Wren - The Growth Guru

We need your help!

Like anything work doing, there is a lot to be done on this project! Just for the base version of the game, there needs to be:

  • Coding (Many many hours of game development)
  • Artwork (Hundreds of art assets - UI, sprites, portraits)
  • Writing (Over a hundred thousand words)
  • Sound Design (Hundreds of audio assets)
  • Music (20+ unique musical tracks)

You can help make sure all of the staff is decently-fed and warm at night! Since the game will be free, we are depending 100% on your support!

We're Still Doing a Patreon!

Yes. The contributions here will be geared towards getting the pipeline set up and laying the best possible foundation. Patreon will fund things like continued development of new characters, new locations, and other additional game content. Whether you want to help us by giving to one or the other (or both, or neither) we'll appreciate it no matter what! The Patreon campaign will begin August 1st.

However...if we can't reach $5000 in this campaign I have to cancel the project. The reality is that anything under that amount makes it prohibitively difficult to attract the talent it requires to make such a game.

Stretch Goals!

  • $25,000 - "Incidental" vocal lines for all the girls, plus 5 more gallery unlockables!
  • $35,000 - 2 new dateable girls, 4 new NPCs, 1 new location, plus 10 more gallery unlockables!
  • $50,000 - Character customization, plus 10 more gallery unlockables!
  • $69,000 - FUTA MODE! Playable futa character and brand-new dateable futa girl, new futa-specific items, and "package size" growth system, plus 20 more gallery unlockables!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help out monetarily, you can still join the team by being an active community member: https://discord.gg/ukyqAJd

F.A.Qs

Please gives us any questions you may have!

  • What platform will this game be released on?​
  • PC, Mac, and Linux initially, with a mobile port supported by Patreon contributions.
  •  
  • Do the dateable girls grow?
  • No, it's only the main character.
  •  
  • When will you release the first build?
  • I don't want to set any hard dates, but we'll have our own milestones we want to hit before releasing anything. At least a few months.
  •  
  • Will there be sex scenes?
  • They will be implied. The gallery unlockables will have more risque content, but given that the main character has a fluid body, it'll be difficult to actually draw her together with other characters.

story:
Starwalker, space exploration RPG

Help us develop this old school rpg for pc. Explore new planets, collect plants, animals and minerals to start your own biome. Earth was invaded and it's your task to reclaim it.

The year is 2016 and we have made contact. You wake up in a devastated city with a headache and bad bruises, not sure about what happened. They came and destroyed everything, every city. Now, Earth is lost and you need to leave the planet. In this RPG, you'll need to find your way out of Earth using alien technology, exploring new solar systems, finding plants, animals and minerals to colonize a planet of your choice - swamp, ruined alien city, forest, desert and even an ocean biome. Once you've settled, you'll rule and build a city, a military force, always with the ultimate objective in mind - to retake what's yours. This multiplayer RPG will set players against each other or in cooperation and they'll be able to trade, battle among themselves - on ground or in spaceships - or just sit in a bar and roleplay.

- 8 attributes: Strenght, Aim, Dexterity, Intelligence, Computer, Engineering, Charisma;

- Over 50 skills to choose, including: Bargain (Int) - Hack System (Com) - Hack Panel (Com) - Long Shot (Aim) - Headshot (Aim) - Knock Down (Str) - Evade (Dex) - Open Lock (Dex) - Reprogram (Com) - Program Robot (Com) - Handle Explosive (Eng) - Detect Trap (Dex) - Bluff (Cha) - Persuade (Cha) - Intimidate (Str) - Resist Poison (Con) - Resist Mutation (Con) - Hold Ground (Con) - Crack Code (Int) - Resist Virus (Con) - Craft Explosive (Eng/Dex) - Remove Poison (Dex) - Decypher Language (Int) - Tame Animal (Cha) - Tame Creature (Cha) - Steal (Dex) - Detect Life (Dex) - Investigate (Int) - Cause Chaos (Cha) - Create / Install Virus (Com) - Stealth (Dex) - Develop Program (Com) - Build Robot (Eng) - Build Ship (Eng) - Craft Armor (Eng) - Craft Weapon (Eng) - Tailoring (Dex) - Torture (Str) - Heal Wound (Int) - Laboratory (Int) - Create Solution (Int) - Develop Mutation (Int) - Cure Mutation (Int) - Create Virus (Int) - Analyze Ground (Int) - Find Resources (Dex) - Pilot (Dex / Int / Com) - Mining (Str) - Farming (Dex)

- Also, vehicles, spaceships and space exploration with wild alien life and plants to collect.

Our Greenlight page is up - http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=276517769
Our website - www.themundiproject.com
Our Facebook - www.facebook.com/themundiproject

Rafael Barreto, The Mundi Project Game Studios, CEO

story:
Sollindae (Short summary)

    Sollindae is a game which my friend Jett and I created a year ago. It was originally programmed with the programming language Python, and was completely text-based. The project was almost completely abandoned, and it was a very very small game, not much code. Recently, however, we have decided to revamp the entire thing with graphics and an actual story (INSANE!). This new game would be made with a program called RPG Maker (More specifically, RPG Maker VX Ace), and would have a lot more to do. An immersive story, amazing music, a great map with complete free-roaming ability, as well as tons of side quests. Sollindae, in short, is an innovative twist on the classic 2D RPGs that many gamers would agree are some of the best retro games ever. We're taking elements from modern games such as The Elder Scrolls series (Story, side stories, free roaming capability, and characters with personality), and putting it into a grand indie game.

    Sollindae is a game that will revolutionize the way we see 2D RPGs forever.

 

 

What We Need

In order of importance, what we need is:

  • RPG Maker VX Ace, the program that we're going to make the game with. (~$70)
  • RPG Maker DS Resource Pack, an amazingly large resource pack for RPG Maker, with everything we need to make the game more awesome! (~$30)
  • Posters for certain contributors (~$100)
  • T-Shirts, for certain contributors (~$31)
  • Indie Graphics Builder, a graphics pack that allows you to 'make your own' graphics by combining different elements (~$200)

    That adds up to $431, so the extra $69 is mostly to bring up our goal to the minimum amount required by IndieGoGo. But, we also would love to be able to repay our composers for what we assume will be a great job, and most of all, we may have extra expenses (advertisement, an actual website, etc.), and as well shipping fees for shipping the contributor's items. All contributors will get their names in the credits

The Impact

We believe that this game is a good example of the way that technology can bring people together to do things easier; Back in the 1980's, you had to own a big corporation, pay artists, composers, and programmers thousands of dollars to complete a fourth of the game. Then, you had to get money for manufacturing floppy disks, get with TV stations to advertise, and then with retailers so you can sell it. At this point, it's the luck of the draw whether or not you'll sell enough. Nowadays, we can just do it all ourselves. Or in our case, get together with people in seconds. 

    We got composers to make music for free. We can go and buy all the graphics we need by entering in a credit card number and clicking a button and then downloading a file in a minute. Then, we put it all together with a program over a much smaller period of time. The entire game is a collaborative effort over this massive thing we call the internet. We don't have to meet in real life at all. Indie games don't require too much advertisement, either, we can just spread the word online and others will share it with their friends and so on and so forth. Help us make this another great example of the usefulness of technology, and its abilities.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute money, there are many ways you can help.

  • IndieGoGo has an awesome share tool, use it to share with your friends!
  • Just spread the word. Tell someone in person, through fax, or even snail mail! Any hype we can get is helpful!

Extra, "Legal" Stuff

    Upon recieving a copy of the game, its soundtrack, or a beta version, by downloading, you have agreed not to distribute the game to anyone other than yourself. Piracy on the internet is a big problem, but please note: We don't support SOPA or PIPA sort of ideas, but we want to be paid when someone gets our game. We will have spent a lot of time on this game by the time we release it; We want to be paid for our hard work, so don't distribute copies of the full game, it's beta, or the soundtrack!

story:
The Game of Dungeon Design & Exploration!

Lair is an exciting fantasy adventure board game in which players customize their own labyrinth full of treasures, traps, and monsters – and then bravely traverse their opponent's dungeon in hopes of defeating the evil Dark Lord!

Implementing an innovative map-making mechanic, Lair guarantees that no two games are ever the same - and the simultaneous combat & movement system keeps both players actively engaged throughout, regardless of whose turn it is.

Check out our website at LAIRGAME.CA to find out more!

Lair is one of 5 finalists in Hasbro's Gaming Lab Contest! Chosen from over 640 games across the world, Lair has the chance to become the Grand Prize winner and receive $25,000, a trip to Hasbro headquarters, and the opportunity to work alongside industry professionals who will assist in the production of the game.  

Your support in this campaign is crucial! We need to SMASH our goal, with at least 100 unique backers - so any pledge will be greatly appreciated. however, no matter what happens in the contest, this game will be produced and delivered to your doorstep!

Lair is founded on a rich, engaging backstory that takes place in the wondrous world of Ellandria, a mythical land steeped in lore & magic! Players can immerse themselves in this tale through the rulebook, the standalone graphic novel, and future expansions set to come.

The game of Lair is played in two phases - Design & Exploration.

DESIGN THE ADVENTURE

To begin, each player sets a screen in front of them to preserve secrecy, and then places their walls, monsters, traps, treasures, and artifacts anywhere they want inside the grid, thus creating their own unique dungeon.

Players design their own lair every game, providing endless replay value!

EXPLORE THE UNKNOWN

Once both players have declared their lair complete, the action begins - and it is time to explore your opponents' lair. Each player reveals the location of the HERO and DARK LORD in their own lair, and these coordinates are recorded by the opponent onto their trusty gridmap. 

Players will use their gridmap to navigate through their opponents' lair!

With only this information to guide you, players will then use their gridmap to navigate through the dungeon, not knowing what dangers - or treasures - may come with every step. As your opponent moves your Hero throughout the lair, they must reveal the contents of each coordinate to you, resulting in suspenseful, interactive gameplay like no other!

MONSTERS

Lurking throughout the lair are a legion of undead monsters waiting to bring on your demise. Whenever a monster is encountered, combat immediately ensues - and both players roll the dice against each other, adding any bonuses to determine who wins.

Here is a look at the foul creatures you may encounter in the Lair:

TREASURE

Finding treasure in the lair will allow players to draw an Item card from the deck, which will increase their chances of defeating the Dark Lord before their opponent. 

TRAPS

What lair would be complete without a set of deadly traps waiting to snag an unsuspecting adventurer? Fall into these and you'll miss your next turn.

ARTIFACTS

Powerful weaponry and legendary armor lay scattered throughout the lair, and will permanently boost your combat abilities when discovered!

ITEMS

Whenever a player finds a treasure chest in the dungeon, or defeats a monster in combat, they may draw an Item card from the deck. Items add a great deal of flavour to the experience of Lair, and using them wisely during the game can determine whether you prevail - or perish!

Tired of playing the same old card games? Neither are we! However, Lair is a bonafide board game completely bursting with tons of vibrant components, each of which have been meticulously designed to be visually appealing in nature.

Here's a list of everything you'll receive in the box:

We've put together some great perks to offer our backers!

Achieving our base funding goal will ensure that we'll be able to publish Lair and bring it into production - however, if we exceed our  goal, we can start adding TONS of more exciting content and components to the game!

Here is a list of stretch goals that would allow us to expand the game tremendously - let's do our best to get them unlocked!

The funds we raise will go straight into the production of the game, artwork on various components, component upgrades, and asset retouches. We've set the goal at $2500, which is the absolute minimum amount needed to produce the game. 

    Backing the project isn't just about funds - you can help us by sharing this page, spreading the word to your friends and online communities, and leaving links in your trace. Check out our website at LAIRGAME.CA and follow us on Social Media!

We've put together some great perks to offer our backers!

Backing the project isn't just about funds - you can help us by sharing this page, spreading the word to your friends and online communities, and leaving links in your trace. Check out our website at LAIRGAME.CA and follow us on Social Media!

story:
Summary

  • About us:

We are an individual game studio called WnMStudio. We've already deployed some Android games on Amazon and WP games on Windows Phone Store.  We have a programmer, a ui designer and a game artist.

This time we are building an online card battle game. I used to be a fan of YuGiOh card game and MTG, I tried to make my friends play these interesting games with me, but they gave up as soon as they found it's very difficult to understand complex rules. So I decided to develop this game - War Of Mortal. 

  • About game:

This card game uses an extremely simple rule: there is only one type of card. You put 30 cards in your deck(no more than 3 for cards with the same name), when the game starts you and your opponent both summon a card which we call "Servant" on the ground. Each card has HP and ATK properties, and the two cards on the ground fight each other until one of them(or both of them) lost all HP (Damage = ATK), then you summon a new card to replace the dead one. The first one lost all cards loses. If both lost all cards at the same time, it's a draw.

The fun part of this card battle is a lot of cards have special effects. Such as "when opponent is a dragon, this card gain 500 ATK" or "When this card was summoned, destroy opponent servant immediately" or "This card reverses opponent's DESTROY effect (exchange target)". These effects make the battle full of fun. And players have to pay a lot of attention on how to form their deck and they'll pray for good luck in battle.

WOM will be an online game so that NO ONE CAN CHEAT. We belive this is very important for a game focus on "competition". 

And also, that's why we need fund.

PS:

1.) War of Mortal will be published on Android and iOS platform. We are also considering about publishing it on Steam (means PC platform). 

2.) We are going to print some cards and try to sell them, just like what Konami did.

3.) We've made the decision that War of Mortal will NOT be a free game. Players will get some free game time at the begining of the game, but they need to pay for further game. Also, there will be no In-App-Purcasing items. Only by this way we can make sure our game is fair to every players.

We keep doing some changes so please check "Update" tab.


What We Need & What You Get

  • Why we need fund:

There are mainly three part of costing.

1.) Unity3D pro lisence. We are developing an online game so free lisence is not an option (free lisence does not support socket function). Unity3D pro lisence with Android and iOS support cost $3,000 in all;

2.) Game art work. As you know, card game needs hundreds of images. This part we have two options. One is buy images at a low price, which are all images used by other projects. The other is to hire more artists to draw our brand new images, which is much more expensive.

3.) Server cost. This is also easy to understand as we are developing an online game. We've decided to use AWS (Amazon Web Service) as our game server. If we have a lot of users, that's a lot of money.

  • Why flexible funding:

As you may wondering this, let me explain.

Usually, if a game project cannot collect enough money, it should not be started. But this game is our dream, we have to make it work. No matter how much money we can collect here, we'll finish this game under any condition. So every help we get from you makes our game better. But if we can't move you, we'll change a way to get money (maybe borrow some) to continue develop this game.

So don't worry, this is more like a presale. You'll sure to get what you paid for.

  • What will you get:

As we said WOM is a free game with In-App-Purchasing items, contributors will get a secret code which can become money in the game. 

Also don't forget this is a card game. You may also put yourself in the game as a strong but rare card, or not so strong but common card. You can even decide the card image.

And if you help us really a lot, you may get a physical copy of our the most rare card (God race:P) which will never be printed again (WE PROMISE!).


The Impact

  • What differences will you make:

More money means more cards and better servers, which directly means a better game. And that's just what we need the most. You are making great differences to this game's quality.

  • What's the risk:

The only risk we have is that "It's not good enough". There will be no risk of "We cannot finish that", as I said, this game have to be finished.


If we still cannot move you

That's a sad story TAT. Look into my eyes TAT. T.T. Q.Q. QAQ. TVT

Still not moving you? That's alright. Just, please make more people know this game. You must know some people who like MTG or YuGiOh games. Just tell him/her about WOM.

And share this campaign if you like guys who follow their dreams, which means us :P.

story:
Hello everyone!

Welcome to the page that will tell you how things will work with this app. '''''THIS IS NOT A MINECRAFT LAUNCHER'''''

Here's the link to the interface's most probable look.

Future compatibility with MultiMC!!!

If you would like to become a beta tester for this application, send me an email at: lightenedblade@gmail.com

==User Ranks==

There will be a slight difference in how the app will look depending on which kind of member you are and there are 5 kinds:

  1. Free User
  2. Paid User
  3. Modder (Does not require payment)
  4. Map Maker (Does not require payment)
  5. Admins and moderators (Moderators are still users so you will need to be premium)

Premium Users

The price of premium is 2 dollars and will be a permanent investment (meaning you pay only once), and there will be 2 benefits to premium users:

  1. no ads! Yay~
  2. you will be able to customize the skins of your application (future feature)
  3. Add your server into the Server Index
  4. Apply to become a moderator

Note: if you Pre-Purchase, you're automatically a Beta-Tester. Sign Up Here

User Features!

 

ALL members will have the following features:

  1. Have a profile
  2. Able to submit error messages and get help with mod installations
  3. Create a list of "favorite mods" to check if they have been updated.
  4. view and query( means look for) any mods in the mod index as well as voting for those mods
  5. modders will be able to grant you status of [mod/map name] helper badge which you'll need to give full on reviews as well as help maintain each mod's page information.
  6. You will be able also to add videos to the videos page and tagging them with mod names so people can find videos related to those mods.
  7. You will be able to search through all known mod wikis by the click of a button
  8. You will be able to add friends and block people.
  9. You will be able to download (certain) mods with a click and have it directly moved to your central mods folder for MultiMC
  10. Advanced Review system mentioned below

Modders will have these additional features:

  1. You will be able to create a page for your mod and have all the important information be displayed so your users can find them easily.
  2. You will be able to have your users [non badged] edit the common wiki.
  3. You will be able to decide which long reviews you want to display.
  4. You will be able to set up a download link that is adf.ly
  5. You will be able to design a logo for your mod.
  6. You will be able to join the other modders to discuss your codes in a common chat room!
  7. More to come.

Mappers will have these additional features:

  1. You will be able to create a page for your map with all the important information displayed to impress your audience.
  2. You will be able to have your users [non badged] edit the common wiki.
  3. You will be able to decide which long reviews you want to display.
  4. You will be able to set up a download link that is adf.ly
  5. You will be able to design a logo for your map.
  6. More to come.

Moderators will have the following features:

  1. You will be able to remove innapropriate posts and comments
  2. You will be able to remove mods from the "new mods" list if they are troll mods.
  3. more to come

HOW TO BECOME A MODDER / MAPPER

  1. Submit a mod in the mods page. Your mod will be in the " New mods" List for a week. If the moderators/admins deem it to be a mod unique enough to join the ranks of the mods list, then you will become a modder. Same goes for map makers.
  2. Spamming me with requests to become a modder will not work
  3. If you're a modder/mapper already, you have to confirm your identity using a pm in the minecraft forums! Msg: secretrevelation

Advanced Review System

  1. Basic System
    • Available all registered users: a simple Vote up or Vote Down
  2. Experienced
    • A star based voting system for multiple criteria available to users with certain experience
  3. Veteran
    • Star based review system with a written review and made by modder approved users

How to Sign Up For Beta

Results from you signing up for Beta

  1. You get the program early, which means you get to input your opinion on the future of the application
  2. The developers get to do more developing instead of working part time jobs
  3. We can afford to host the downloads on a dedicated server so that you get it faster!

Steps

Signing up for Beta is equivalent to PrePurchasing Premium Rank!

  1. Register As a new user
  2. Donate $2 or more and type in the username/email combination you gave in the registration form in the note/comment. Note: You will be asked to choose a new username once the program is released
  3. Once the Beta is out, you will get notified right away!

story:
Our story so far

Hello to all! We are a small team, passionate about game development. About three years ago we had the idea about Urban Galaxy Online. After setting the basic outline of the game we started the development on our spare time.

Since then, the game has evolved and, we believe, matured to something bigger than a "garage project". With our passion as a driver we have made bold changes to the gameplay and tested it with some really helpful folks. You can check out the latest Urban Galaxy updates on our site at www.urbangalaxyonline.com. From there, you can access our forum, twitter and facebook pages.

So here we stand, on the final line to our first official release of Urban Galaxy Online, asking for your help in finalizing, tweaking and releasing our child to the public.

About Urban Galaxy Online

Urban Galaxy Online, or UG in short, is a 3D Massively Multiplayer Online Game, placed inside a futuristic megapolis called Anassin. The game runs within the web browser, requiring no client download. We tried to take advantage of this feature in order to include additional staff in the game's web page that users might find useful, such as  social features and walkthroughs that are accessible directly from the web while playing the game.

Basic features

Now on to the game! In UG you can find some good old mmorpg stuff like collecting xp points and upgrading your character through leveling, distributing skill points on class-specific skill trees, completing quest storylines, crafting new items using blueprints, parting with other players, upgrading your ship and gear by looting mobs or accesing city shops, selling stuff in the auction house etc.

In addition, the game features both PvE and PvP areas, daily quests and group fight against powerfull raid bosses.

The setting

The setting is somewhat futuristic retro, somewhat sci-fi. The player chooses among three classes: the Smuggler, the Mercenary or the Carrier, and navigates a vehicle of his/her choice around the city.

We have tried to include features to the city setting to make it look like a living organism. So in the city you can find various animated objects such as vertical train-elevators, ships movement over the docks, traffic etc.

Also, we have added in-game ad-banners with "virtual advertisments" to further enhance the world story of conflict among the in-game corporations.

Another feature on the living setting are the random events happening in the game that may affect a player, such as random meteor showers, earthquakes, buildings set on fire etc.

Trying to make the city appear as lively as possible, we are trying to add more complex behaviours such as fire brigade vehicles trying to put out fires, police vehicles patroling areas and attacking local gang ships etc.

The story

Anassin, the city where the game takes place, is the capital city of the "Dual Solar Empire", a center of commercial, political and cultural activities. The city has entered its age of decandence, with pirates, gangs and corporations fighting over the control of the market and the city neighborhoods. 

The game's story is unfolded to the players through a career path quest story line, with tenths of side quests still available, pushing the players to pick sides over the corporate and gang wars taking place in the game.

Dynamic events

Urban Galaxy features "Dynamic World Events", events happening randomly within the game. Players are given the option to participate in these events (both PvP and PvE), by picking sides. The outcome of those events has an impact on the reputation of the players within the city syndicates, unlocking new quest storylines or triggering new dynamic events.

Dynamic events remove the "static" feeling of the classic MMOs, offering the game a live breathing city where random things can happen.

During the implementation of dynamic events, we tried to capture the gameplay model of popular first person shooters, tailoring it to the gameplay style of our game. For example, a player has the opportunity to take part on PvP/PvE events that emulate Team Deathmatch, Capture the Flag, Control Points and Headquarters mini games. Winning or losing while playing those events, has an impact on the reputation against gangs or corporations and opens another path for collecting xp, credits or other goodies.

Our goal is to extend the dynamic events system even more, where the outcome of those events affect even further the way the city behaves, such as altering the availability and pricing of goods in the shops, the value of items in the auction house and the territorial control from local authorities or city gangs (e.g. how police patrols are performed, number of mobs wandering in the neightborhoods etc).

Game model

The game is going to be a free-to-play MMO (F2P) and users will have unlimited access to all the available content. However, players who wish to shorten the time spent advancing their character, will be given a choice to purchase certain special items and boosts, available through the UG Store, following the microtransaction model.

Develop in episodes

UG is going to be an episodic MMO. While this campaign is running, we are heading towards the completion of the first episode of the game, with another four episodes to come, right after the game's launch. 

We chose the episodic way of developing the game, because we would like users to shape up and decide how the next episodes are going to be. Revenues earned from each campaign are going to be invested into the development of the next episode, thus helping us get earlier in the market and making this effort self-sustainable.

Supported platforms

The game runs on all popular web browsers using Java. Windows, MacOSX and Linux are the supported operating systems.

Development in progress

Currently, UG is about 70% complete, with another 30% in the works while this campaign is running.

We are working really hard to get the public beta of the 1st episode done on time, which is scheduled for the end of 2012 or beginning of 2013.

Our work in progress involves:

  • Finalize our game content, including city levels, player ships, items, weaponry, ship engines, sounds, music etc.
  • Populate the city with lots of dynamic events and scenarios.
  • Introduce the first raid boss encounter of the game, the "Pirate Mothership".
  • Relaunch the game's website, using a brand new layout and more media.
  • Launch the UG Store.

Perks

Our dream is transform the game into a successful MMO, where thousands of players get to play together, in a fresh and unique game setting, outside the sphere of fantasy or space oriented MMOs. In order for this to happen we need YOUR help! All contributions are really welcomed and appreciated!

By backing us up through the perks offered on this site, we are planning to use all the funds raised for making a proper launch and start a marketing campaign that will help us build a strong community around the game. 

To be more precise, funding will be used for:

  • Purchasing an annual cloud hosting service that will be able to host at least 2 game server instances (both in USA and Europe) in a pay-as-you-go plan, capable of supporting at least 1000 concurrent users online, operating 24/7.
  • Game promotion and marketing (Google Ads, banners in relevant web sites).

By claiming the Boost Package perks, you get a head-start in the game, taking advantage of a special discount in the UG Store. In the UG Store, players will have the opportunity to purchase Data Cubes, a virtual currency than can be used in the game to purchase rare and exotic virtual items, ships and boosts.

Boost packages come in the following flavors:

  • For the $20 Boost Package 1, you get the equivalent of $30 Data Cubes
  • For the $30 Boost Package 2, you get the equivalent of $45 Data Cubes
  • For the $50 Boost Package 3, you get the equivalent of $70 Data Cubes

Those who claim the Extra Quest Storyline perk, will have the opportunity to play a special series of extra quests, available only to them, as soon as the first episode is released.

This extra storyline, will not only unlock more mysteries about the Urban Galaxy universe, but will reward the players with special items. Are you up to the challenge?

You like the game so much and you can't wait till the release date? This is the right perk for you.

Claim this perk to get instant access to the game from day one. Watch how the game development unfolds by aquiring access to the development servers. Send early feedback to the development team and help us shape up the game together!

Disclaimer: Accounts accessing the development servers are subject to modifications and all progress cannot be transfered to the official public servers.

By claiming this perk you have a couple of weeks head start in the game before the other players. The official game servers will be open to those who claim this perk, as soon as the game is ready.

All your characters and the progress you have made from the pre-release period to the actual public launch date will remain intact and will be available on the official release.  

Those who claim this perk, will have an exclusive free access to an epic ship. This ship will be designed to stand-out and will have statistics of epic proportions.

This reward will be available upon release of Episode 1 and players will be able to aquire their epic ship in the game through the various shops that are available inside the city of Anassin. The ship will be visible only to you and with zero cost.

So you have this cool idea about a storyline that would be a perfect fit for the Urban Galaxy universe! This is your chance to make it happen. Claim this perk and we will work together to bring your story into the game!

Note that the story must be compatible with the game's universe and must comply to the content rules and technical guidelines or limitations as provided by the dev team.

Did we forget to mention that you will be enlisted in the donor's page as a game design contributor as well?

The city of Anassin is full of virtual advertisement billboards, as a respectful futuristic metropolis ought to be. This perk is your chance to place your own billboard banner inside the city for a whole year!

The banner can be a still image or a 5 frame animated gif image in the dimensions provided by the devs and cannot contain reference to sexual material, alcohol, tobacco and gambling.

Banners can display virtual, personal or real commercial products and services, as long as they comply to the rules above.

Disclaimer: The game might be additionally available through affiliate gaming sites, apart from the official UG servers. For the affiliate editions, the commercial banners are subject to the terms of use of the corresponding affiliate sites.

By claiming this limited perk, you have the chance to put your personal touch on the design of the game, by providing drawings or ideas on the development of either a ship or a building that will appear in the game.

The dev team will work closely with you, in order to bring your idea to fruition, which should comply to the rules of the Urban Galaxy universe and the technical limitations of the game.

Your name and your contribution will also be honored in the donor's page, where you will be referenced as a design contributor! 

The Stailness Steel Model is our grand perk that will be available for a limited number of copies! Those who choose to claim this perk, will be given the option to select their favorite among 4 available ship modes. Their ship of choice will then be mailed to them on their home address as a stainless steel model of about 10cm length.

Apart from the physical stainless steel model, you will have the chance to select an additional perk from the list above!

We would like to thank each and everyone of you who is sharing our vision! We really appreciate your support and we are grateful to anyone that is willing to help bring UG closer to the masses. We hope that you people will be the first to give us constructive feedback and introduce the first revolutionary ideas to make UG a better game.

Even if you do not back our project, there are still other ways you can help. If you are a facebook user you can Like our Facebook page and help spread the word! Additionally, you can follow us on Twitter and retweet or post news about the game or simply tell your friends about it!
story_txt:
Our story so far
Hello to all! We are a small team, passionate about game development. About three years ago we had the idea about Urban Galaxy Online. After setting the basic outline of the game we started the development on our spare time.
Since then, the game has evolved and, we believe, matured to something bigger than a "garage project". With our passion as a driver we have made bold changes to the gameplay and tested it with some really helpful folks. You can check out the latest Urban Galaxy updates on our site at www.urbangalaxyonline.com. From there, you can access our forum, twitter and facebook pages.
So here we stand, on the final line to our first official release of Urban Galaxy Online, asking for your help in finalizing, tweaking and releasing our child to the public.
About Urban Galaxy Online
Urban Galaxy Online, or UG in short, is a 3D Massively Multiplayer Online Game, placed inside a futuristic megapolis called Anassin. The game runs within the web browser, requiring no client download. We tried to take advantage of this feature in order to include additional staff in the game's web page that users might find useful, such as  social features and walkthroughs that are accessible directly from the web while playing the game.
Basic features

Now on to the game! In UG you can find some good old mmorpg stuff like collecting xp points and upgrading your character through leveling, distributing skill points on class-specific skill trees, completing quest storylines, crafting new items using blueprints, parting with other players, upgrading your ship and gear by looting mobs or accesing city shops, selling stuff in the auction house etc.
In addition, the game features both PvE and PvP areas, daily quests and group fight against powerfull raid bosses.
The setting

The setting is somewhat futuristic retro, somewhat sci-fi. The player chooses among three classes: the Smuggler, the Mercenary or the Carrier, and navigates a vehicle of his/her choice around the city.
We have tried to include features to the city setting to make it look like a living organism. So in the city you can find various animated objects such as vertical train-elevators, ships movement over the docks, traffic etc.

Also, we have added in-game ad-banners with "virtual advertisments" to further enhance the world story of conflict among the in-game corporations.
Another feature on the living setting are the random events happening in the game that may affect a player, such as random meteor showers, earthquakes, buildings set on fire etc.
Trying to make the city appear as lively as possible, we are trying to add more complex behaviours such as fire brigade vehicles trying to put out fires, police vehicles patroling areas and attacking local gang ships etc.
The story
Anassin, the city where the game takes place, is the capital city of the "Dual Solar Empire", a center of commercial, political and cultural activities. The city has entered its age of decandence, with pirates, gangs and corporations fighting over the control of the market and the city neighborhoods. 
The game's story is unfolded to the players through a career path quest story line, with tenths of side quests still available, pushing the players to pick sides over the corporate and gang wars taking place in the game.
Dynamic events
Urban Galaxy features "Dynamic World Events", events happening randomly within the game. Players are given the option to participate in these events (both PvP and PvE), by picking sides. The outcome of those events has an impact on the reputation of the players within the city syndicates, unlocking new quest storylines or triggering new dynamic events.

Dynamic events remove the "static" feeling of the classic MMOs, offering the game a live breathing city where random things can happen.
During the implementation of dynamic events, we tried to capture the gameplay model of popular first person shooters, tailoring it to the gameplay style of our game. For example, a player has the opportunity to take part on PvP/PvE events that emulate Team Deathmatch, Capture the Flag, Control Points and Headquarters mini games. Winning or losing while playing those events, has an impact on the reputation against gangs or corporations and opens another path for collecting xp, credits or other goodies.

Our goal is to extend the dynamic events system even more, where the outcome of those events affect even further the way the city behaves, such as altering the availability and pricing of goods in the shops, the value of items in the auction house and the territorial control from local authorities or city gangs (e.g. how police patrols are performed, number of mobs wandering in the neightborhoods etc).

However, players who wish to shorten the time spent advancing their character, will be given a choice to purchase certain special items and boosts, available through the UG Store, following the microtransaction model.

UG is going to be an episodic MMO. While this campaign is running, we are heading towards the completion of the first episode of the game, with another four episodes to come, right after the game's launch. 
We chose the episodic way of developing the game, because we would like users to shape up and decide how the next episodes are going to be. The game runs on all popular web browsers using Java. Windows, MacOSX and Linux are the supported operating systems.

We are working really hard to get the public beta of the 1st episode done on time, which is scheduled for the end of 2012 or beginning of 2013.

Finalize our game content, including city levels, player ships, items, weaponry, ship engines, sounds, music etc.
Populate the city with lots of dynamic events and scenarios.
Introduce the first raid boss encounter of the game, the "Pirate Mothership".
Relaunch the game's website, using a brand new layout and more media.
Launch the UG Store.
Perks

story:
Hello!

My name is Wesley Elder and I am the new manager at The Game Exchange in Roxboro, N.C. I have been a gamer since I was 6 years old playing Super Mario 64 in Toys R' Us. However, I also grew up seeing The Game Exchange in my hometown.

The Game Exchange was hardly ever open growing up, but I decided recently to come in and turn it around. The gaming community in Roxboro has never had a place to call home for video games. We have always had to drive 45 minutes to an hour to get our games, much less a place to go play games together. That's what we're trying to do. We're trying to create not only an amazing store that sells games, but an amazing video game haven.

We want to renovate the second floor of the building and turn it into a big video game tournament/chill area. The building feels old, looks old, and needs an update. It primarily has older games, which are awesome, but needs some newer games. I've been trying to clean, get new inventory, and renovate as much as possible with a $0 budget, but I have hit a wall. Since I started managing the store, there have been many other people who have volunteered as well to turn the store around. All of us are gamers who are passionate about creating a place that will bring gamers alike together.

We want to thank you for reading our page and thank you so much for being a part of The Game Exchange. We hope that each and every one of you can visit us some day and play some games. (:

This is where we are asking you for help! We have a hefty goal ahead of us, but we know that it is possible if the gaming community unites. There are 3 main things that the building needs. The big three are heating, electrical work, and paint. None of these are cheap and all of them are necessary. However, everything is broken down in the pie chart below:


We can't do this without YOU! We hope you're just as excited as we are to become a part of The Game Exchange! 

We have some fun perks and we want to be able to recognize every single person that helps us get there! You will always be immortalized on our wall in our store and then hopefully, one day, you will be able to come by and see it! We also want to play some games with you, so hopefully we make lots of friends!

As I cleaned the store, I found some really cool and old video game memorabilia that are some of the perks. Check out the pics below to see what can be yours today!



And there are many more items that are unearthed every week! We might even put some new perks up. (:

If we reach our goal, you can see clearly where it will all go. However, we do have a stretch goal! There is a 3rd floor and a basement area that I would love to turn into storage, but they need a lot of work as well. The 3rd floor is exposed to outside and the basement is a dirt floor. But we will talk about this after we hit our first goal. Be sure to check out the pictures of the store in the gallery as well in case you didn't watch the video!

Unfortunately, there are many risks to all of this. In fact, this is somewhat of our last resort. If we don't pull this off, Ray might not be able to keep the business running and the time we have invested may go down the drain. Not only that, but I start back to school in January, so I am hoping to have the place fully functional by January so that I can leave my mark in peace. However, I have faith we can do this!

What did Mario do when Peach was kidnapped? He chased after her. What did Master Chief do when the Earth was threatened? He saved it. What did Marcus do when the Locusts were trying to rule Earth? He killed them all. And like those icons, we can save The Game Exchange!

Let's pull this off and turn it around gamers!

Thank you SO SO SO much for checking us out! We appreciate all the support we can get. And I get it. Sometimes there just isn't money to give. But, we can still be friends and use your support through social media!

Give us a big 'ole like on Facebook or follow us on Twitter! You can keep up with the updates, renovations, and all that good stuff as it happens in the following months. If you're local to us or want to stop by, give us a call and we would love to chat or maybe trade some games! Also, be sure to use the hashtag #levelupthegamexchange when talking about us! THANKS!

story:
It's time to do something good!

Watch the live stream: http://twitch.tv/swashin

For details regarding this event, please watch our featured video.

About St. Jude's Children Research Hospital

The mission of St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital is to advance cures, and means of prevention, for pediatric catastrophic diseases through research and treatment. Consistent with the vision of founder Danny Thomas, no child is denied treatment based on race, religion or a family's ability to pay. 


Learn more: http://www.stjude.org/

Here is an amazing story that shows what St. Jude does for families:


All proceeds will go directly to St. Jude Children's Research Hospital.

story:
Short Summary

One day, in August of 2011, I devised Ravecraft. Ravecraft wasn't supposed to be a brony server at first... But it just kind of happened. We've had 10 maps, and me and my moderators feel it's time to expand.

What We Need

We need enough money to pay for a linux VPS to host the server on for a year. If we don't meet our goal, we may not be able to expand, and the lag on the server will continue. This is you chance to help Ravecraft do something groundbreaking! Help us get to the top.

What's in it for me?

We want you to get something in return for helping us, so we thought out some rewards. Check them out in the perks section.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help us with money, you can help by spreading the word to fellow bronies, and trying to find people that will help our cause. Remember, the more people you tell about it, the more we push forward to our goal.

story:
The Story of Min

Cwerki Studios is a newly formed indie game studio founded by Daniel George Haddad. Shortly after competing in the Microsoft Imagine Cup 2011 World Finals - Daniel (Glenview Illinois) formed Cwerki Studios joined by Michael Taylor (Audio Design - United Kingdom), later joined by Max Cunningham (Artist - San Francisco), and then followed by a handful of other artists.


Since then we have all been hard at work on Cwerki's debut game, Min: A Space Adventure, a game we would like to release on the iOS, Mac, and PC starting with an episodic release of the game on the iOS by the end of this year.


The Impact

So far, Cwerki Studios has been funded primarily by Daniel himself but now we would like to take this further. Confident and very passionate about Min, we need help securing more money to help take this project further. This stage of funding will primarily go towards securing the artistic assets needed to build the first chapter of the game. 


We are focused on delivering a quality experience and the targeted money will help us do so. No matter how much we manage to secure, Min will remain under development but the experience as a whole may suffer as we will need to compromise based on the financing we have available. 


What We Need 

At this stage we are hoping to secure anywhere between 4000-8000$ which will primarily go towards building 2D and 3D assets for the game, securing better audio equipment, securing more voice talent, and helping us begin the promotional process for our game. 


We would like to release the first chapter of Min: A Space Adventure on the iOS by the end of 2011 or early 2012. This funding stage will help us insure we hit that deadline. The more money we make the better the first release will be, the less money we make the more we would need to compromise and push the deadline.


What You Get

In exchange for your financing we have a wonderful list of perks for you to benefit from that you can find bellow!


We will also offer exclusive skins, items, and upgrades for those who contribute that will be announced later provided we hit our targeted range. More information to come!


Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help us by using the share feature and spread the word about Min. Tell your friends about it, mention us on Twitter, Facebook and help us get the word out. If you do share this project you will automatically enter a draw to win valuable prizes ranging from free copies of the soundtrack, game (iOS, PC, Mac) as well as unique skins, avatars, and in game items. Help us spread the word and build a vast universe for the little Minimar to explore!
story_txt:
The Story of Min
Cwerki Studios is a newly formed indie game studio founded by Daniel George Haddad. Shortly after competing in the Microsoft Imagine Cup 2011 World Finals - Daniel (Glenview Illinois) formed Cwerki Studios joined by Michael Taylor (Audio Design - United Kingdom), later joined by Max Cunningham (Artist - San Francisco), and then followed by a handful of other artists.

Since then we have all been hard at work on Cwerki's debut game, Min: A Space Adventure, a game we would like to release on the iOS, Mac, and PC starting with an episodic release of the game on the iOS by the end of this year.


The Impact
So far, Cwerki Studios has been funded primarily by Daniel himself but now we would like to take this further. Confident and very passionate about Min, we need help securing more money to help take this project further. This stage of funding will primarily go towards securing the artistic assets needed to build the first chapter of the game. 

We are focused on delivering a quality experience and the targeted money will help us do so. No matter how much we manage to secure, Min will remain under development but the experience as a whole may suffer as we will need to compromise based on the financing we have available. 


What We Need 
At this stage we are hoping to secure anywhere between 4000-8000$ which will primarily go towards building 2D and 3D assets for the game, securing better audio equipment, securing more voice talent, and helping us begin the promotional process for our game. 

We would like to release the first chapter of Min: A Space Adventure on the iOS by the end of 2011 or early 2012. This funding stage will help us insure we hit that deadline. The more money we make the better the first release will be, the less money we make the more we would need to compromise and push the deadline.


What You Get

In exchange for your financing we have a wonderful list of perks for you to benefit from that you can find bellow!


We will also offer exclusive skins, items, and upgrades for those who contribute that will be announced later provided we hit our targeted range. More information to come!



Other Ways You Can Help
You can also help us by using the share feature and spread the word about Min. Tell your friends about it, mention us on Twitter, Facebook and help us get the word out. If you do share this project you will automatically enter a draw to win valuable prizes ranging from free copies of the soundtrack, game (iOS, PC, Mac) as well as unique skins, avatars, and in game items. Help us spread the word and build a vast universe for the little Minimar to explore!

story:
ABOUT THIS CAMPAIGN

“The Guarding of Eden:  A Dragon's Dream” is a fast-paced 2-D Character Action game with a redemptive story, set in the imaginative wonderland of Eden!

You play as Slash Talon, a tiny dragon with a huge quest.  The Dragon King, Slash’s maniacal father, is keeping the young drake prisoner with plans to mold him into Eden’s most fearsome creature!  Slash has two objectives:  Stay Alive and Break Free.  His fervent hope of a brighter future, and dreams of soaring over the horizon to an Adventure far beyond, have filled him with the courage needed to stand up against the evil that surrounds him!

However, before he can escape he must battle an onslaught of killer enemies, obtain the legendary Veritas Blade, and use it break the curse on his diabolical dad!

Slice, Burn, and Learn in this action-packed adventure set in a marvelous new world!

If you love the feel of classic arcade games full of big action and even bigger bosses, the sound of inspiring music, the look of stylish art with the charm of the best Saturday Morning cartoons, and a real heart for what really matters in life… Then The Guarding of Eden is for you!  Can you help Slash make it to Eden?


WHY OUR TEAM NEEDS FUNDING

Due to our overflowing enthusiasm and passion for this project, our vision has quickly expanded in scope and we really want you to be a part of making it flourish!  


  • $5,000

    • “Bare-bone” Alpha build of “A Dragon’s Dream”
      (PC release)

    • Basic Gameplay mechanics implemented & standard moveset

    • One stage and Boss Encounter complete: Dragon’s Keep Arena & Bubbles the Mutant Goldfish

    • Three Enemy variations

VISION

We are pleased to invite you into the new and vividly fantastical game series: “The Guarding of Eden.” 

PROJECT EDEN “ENTER EDEN”

“The Guarding of Eden” is a MASSIVE Adventure story that can only be told through a MASSIVE game series.  That’s why we’re splitting it into two games.  “The Guarding of Eden: A Dragon’s Dream” and “The Guarding of Eden: Escape to Eden.”  Both games are designed to encourage players to learn about themselves through the choices they make.  Just as Frodo’s journey across Middle Earth in “The Lord of the Rings” changed him forever, “The Guarding of Eden” seeks to give players the chance to explore and interact with a story that touches on some of life’s biggest questions by providing fun and engaging ways of interacting with a Paradise in ruin.

We came to IndieGoGo so we can have YOU as companions along for this amazing journey.  Whoever you are and wherever you’re from, we invite you to become a Guardian of Eden!  Not only will your involvement make it possible for us to create and realize the dream to bring Eden to you, exactly as we envision it, it also allows us to form a worldwide community where we can collaborate in shaping Eden’s world and design.  We want your help!  So come along and join us in this mission to create something incredible together!

“Even the smallest person can change the course of history.”– Tolkien in The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring.

THE STORY: “A Paradise in Ruin”

Have you ever dreamed about saving the world? How about outright destroying it? In "The Guarding of Eden" you can choose between both!  Play as Slash Talon, the cocky dragon prince, who must venture outside the castle walls that bind him -and ultimately himself- in a world overflowing with beauty, danger, and adventure as he seeks his true purpose in life.  Explore a vast land of literary dreamscapes, encounter awesome animal rivals to obtain their unique abilities to aid you on your quest, and vanquish the Seven Deadly Sinister Villains who rule over this paradise in ruin- all the while deciding to either make the sacrifice to use your abilities to be a true Protector of Eden, or give in to the sheer fury of power and become Eden’s biggest Predator!  Gameplay will be fast and fun, simple to pick up but rewarding of finesse. Are you ready to enter Eden?


A Word from the creator, Peter Venoit Jr.

This story has long been compelling me to tell it through games as it slowly took shape and developed around the experiences in my own life.  I envisioned a paradise inhabited by only talking animals (Redwall anyone?) that was created to operate in perfect harmony, but over the course of history selfishness crept in and the land began to sink into turmoil and ruin.  

Fast forward a couple dozen centuries and I imagined what it would be like to want to explore this land, but have to fight against the darkness that had sunk its roots deep.  By which time, a systemic evil would have entwined itself with the innate good and unique diversity of these various animal societies with the goal of complete dominance, resulting in a confused nature.  

How would one approach this kind of subtle evil?  I would imagine it would take the most pristine of virtues: Courage, Faith, Persistence, Humility, Discipline and the like.  I would imagine it would require a hero, but what kind of a hero would emerge from such a broken paradise?  These are the types of questions that fascinate me and inspired me to explore them in a game that is the best parts of Megaman X and A Link to the Past, incorporated with the fast-paced accessibility that modern technology affords.  I truly hope you will enjoy this and I invite you to explore Eden with us in our first game: “The Guarding of Eden: A Dragon’s Dream.”


In this bite-sized adventure you are Slash Talon, a tiny-but extraordinarily-powerful dragon.  Slash begins his journey trapped in the iron fortress known as “The Dragon’s Keep,” run by his dad, where he is forced to fight an onslaught of fearsome foes.  Recently he has heard the call of the Author in his heart and though he only knows violence, he dreams each night about escaping to the wonderland of Eden just beyond the horizon.  Through his window he can only see a volcanic wasteland of iron and smog, his heart yearns to explore the grassy meadows and mysterious ruins that lay beyond!


ARE YOU READY TO BREAK FREE?

Burn, Slice, and Slide your way through this real-time action RPG, minus the aimless wandering and errand running.  Though restricted, your mission is simple: Use your reflexes to outmaneuver and defeat waves enemies, build up the courage, and use your wits to liberate yourself from the Dragon’s Keep once and for all! Before you can reach your freedom, you must battle your way through armies of killer robots, monsters, and mutants to realize Slash’s dream of escaping to the beauty beyond!

Like we said before, "The Guarding of Eden" is a MASSIVE Game/Story. The extent of sacrifice needed to fully tell this story will be talked about for years to come.  A US Army General, Creighton Abrams, once said: "When eating an elephant take one bite at a time," 

. . . Gulp!!

But seriously, armed with that nugget of wisdom, we plan to start out small.

  • The release of  "The Guarding of Eden: A Dragon's Dream" is a bite-sized chunk of whole "The Guarding of Eden" story and is planned for release as a downloadable game for PC as an introduction to the world of Eden.  
    Tentative release date Fall 2016.

  • We will then build "The Guarding of Eden: Escape to Eden" off of the success of “A Dragon's Dream.”  With a bigger team and bigger budget, we plan to release the next chapter of Eden within the next 2 years.

  • In addition to contributions from YOU, our fellow Guardians, our strategy is to also generate funds by working around-the-clock to deliver top quality animation, interactive media, and graphic materials to help other clients reach their graphical needs.  


WE CAN DO IT!!

Ok . . . It’s no secret we are newbies to the gaming industry.  So instead of rushing into battle without a plan, we've enlisted the support and counsel of industry professionals to learn from their years of experience and life lessons so we can avoid the dangerous pitfalls of inexperience.

To name a few, there’s Joseph Spadaford our background artist who worked at Big Idea Production, the folks who made Veggie Tales a subsidiary of Dreamworks.
Dr. Kevin Crawford, an active Hollywood screenplay writer, and a whole lot of other support from many wise counselors!

With your help in achieving our initial goal of $11,500 we can take that first huge step in accomplishing this massive adventure, and be able to pay and supply our core Team with the resources necessary to build a “A Dragon’s Dream.”

The higher stretch goals will help us to more fully realize the Complete Version of the game, and to begin pre-production on “The Guarding of Eden: Escape to Eden.”


LIGHTHEART LABS, is a new, Faith-based, independent studio founded by animator, game designer, and programmer: Peter V.  The studio's first project, THE GUARDING OF EDEN, will be his first commercial release. This is both a passion project (born from comics he drew in middleschool) and learning experience that he hopes is just the beginning of the greatest game library of all time.

LightHeart Labs is the embodiement of a dream long in the making. A dream to create a place where possibilities are endless and every action is motivated by a love to learn! We think the best art enlightens the mind and uplifts the soul. Come join us as we explore the world around us with hearts on fire!   

Long before the beginning of the project, we’ve surrounded ourselves with talented artists, storytellers, and individuals with like-minded passions.  With this influence we hope to make a huge and positive impact in the entertainment community for fun games with a purpose. Our aim is to make gaming an inclusive experience that strengthens relationships and challenges the heart! 


Peter Venoit Jr. ~ Game Director
[ Concept / Animation / Programming ] 

My name is Peter Venoit Jr. and I have been creating stories and characters since I was just a pup. From even before I can remember, I was filling up notebooks with worlds and faces of the characters that live in my head. Oceans of doodles have spilled onto almost every page that has ever been placed in front of me. No margin or napkin is safe from my lead (or ink)-filled weapon of choice. 
I am an animator and illustrator by trade, but I would like to make the transition to making Games full-time.
I have always been fascinated with how games offer us the ability to explore and interact with the dreamscapes that other's have crafted. I know firsthand how much a good fictional story can really inspire reality. I love all games, but my favorite is the Super Smash Bros series. Games also challenge me to achieve a level of technical perfection, while always providing the fun to give me a good laugh. I am a driven team-player with a passion to create games that provide fun experiences that challenge the heart. 


  • Hiring Talent:  We have amazing people who have agreed to put their all into this project and need to be compensated for their awesome talents and hard work.  Being able to hire additional programmers would seriously lighten the load for us and allow us to focus on our strengths: storytelling and animation to craft the final realization of the game.

  • Company Operation costs:  In order to fully create and distribute our game to any platform we first need to cover our company’s start-up cost.  This will take a significant amount of funds and include extra hardware, software licensing fees, legals fee, and other costs to make sure we are fully compliant with State and Federal Authorities.

  • Community Cultivation and Support:  We very much want the community to be involved in the development of Eden as it grows, but in order to achieve this we’ll need a forum and a technical support team to set up accounts, respond to questions, fix bugs, and etc.  All of this goes towards creating a friendly environment for you our fans to contact us and engage with this Dream.

  • Tithing:  As a Faith-based venture, we believe it is very important to give back and help those less fortunate.  10% of our earnings will be given to our local churches and/or other Non-profit Christian organizations.  


We believe some of the best creations come from working with the fans.

We welcome you to become a part of the development team, where your input- along with everyone in the Eden community- can help shape the game.  We will do this through special events such as: polls; to help the team choose between characters and ideas they've already come up with, surveys; to help judge our overall priorities distribution options, along with interacting with fellow Guardians to help create characters and populate Eden.

Your Part in this Journey:

  1. Find out more about our game and mission by hanging out with us over the internet:  Our Website, Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, and Instagram!  Follow us and let us know what you think!

  2. Already following our progress?  Help us to spread the word and reach as many fans as we can!  We can't do it all alone, so please help us by sharing what we post.  If you are inspired to create something based on our game, we'll even share it!  It's all about collaboration and we want you to be a part of it.

  3. Invite everyone you know to make some noise about our game, over the social media tool of your choice! (#GoEden), and use the IndieGoGo share tools to help promote the game!  

  4. No contribution is too small and every dollar helps us achieve this dream.  Consider that if just 600 people gave $2.50  per week for the next 8 weeks, then "The Guarding of Eden: A Dragon's Dream" will be a reality,

  5. Need some art or animation for a project of your own?  Give us the chance to earn your business! We love meeting new people and helping clients reach their goals.


We may be inexperienced, but we view ourselves as underdogs who have great relationships with a lot of professionals and experts that will help to direct this project to completion.

Delays and the unexpected may be out there, but we are dedicated to completing this game and exhausting every resource at our disposal to bring it to you.
