story:
GreenCubes will be a MMORPG game with a fully changeable sandbox world, a rich RPG and crafting system, an unscripted player-driven world and open market economy. Decorative wearables workshop is planned as well.

Game will be available on Windows, Mac OS X, Linux.

You can play an early version right now, to do so you should register and download the game from this link . Most of features described here are still not implemented.

Besides contributing funds, a great way to help our project is to share this page on social media! Help to spread the word!

Russian version of this text is available on our site. / Русская версия данного текста доступна на нашем сайте.










Click on the title to scroll down to read more about it


Single World Created by People

The World of GreenCubes is fully changeable. It is not divided into locations or instances so you will never run into loading screen while traveling. One world for everyone, single server. It is voxel-based, quite similar to Minecraft but even better.

As you can find from our history, we have a big world as our great heritage. We never wiped it completely. It is filled with stories about existing and ancient cities, political games of great players, tricky trading frauds... This world's mysteries are endless. Due to continuous renovation and expansion, everyone has the opportunity to colonize it. Thanks to the features we plan to realize this world will get a second birth, its golden age is still ahead!

The world like this is a real challenge for developers, however we have experience of maintaining it for years. These features will help to solve main difficulties:

  • Complex land domain system
  • Personal space for everyone
  • Automated world-wide subway system (Already done!)
  • Tools for planning and designing new buildings (sort of singleplayer)
  • A lot of decorative blocks (Already done!)
  • Tools for selective cleaning and regeneration of land

Besides the main world there is a parallel one with free PvP. There you can find a special resource required for high-level crafting. In addition to the hordes blood-thirsty players, this world is aggressive by its own: earthquakes and destruction makes it impossible to live in.


Skills

The path of each character is unique. There is no such thing like a class or profession, player is not limited in progress and almost every combination of skills is accessible. Player doesn't have level — skills progress during use of them. The important part of this system is that skills don’t limit player’s actions but conversely improve them. The high skill is required for very high-leveled actions only, other types of actions can be performed without high skills but their performance will be poor.

Skills are all connected and form a skill tree — from the more general to more specialized ones. More common skills affect all lower ones and all kinds of activity but they are more difficult to improve.

There are four root groups of skills:

  • Character skills affect characteristics and abilities of the character and are separated from the others. Skills like this have special ways of development.
  • Crafting skills affect players ability to work with materials and items: crafting and modifying items, repair and recycling. Also it includes variety of skills related to creating consumable items. Players with high-level crafting skills can participate in grandmasters rating, advertising their services in such a way.
  • Usage skills affect the ability of using items, powers or modifications. In this branch you can find all fighting and spell skills.
  • Researcher skills affect the chances of critical hit, ability to collect animal-related resources, healing of creatures (including players). Particularly, disease healing also included in this group. Yes, there are diseases!

Rich crafting

Opportunities for the item creation and modification are huge. Crafting system allows player to create a variety of unique items for every taste.

System is based on drafts, which determines the item type. Each draft has slots for applying materials, every material has its own characteristics, look and enhancements options. Skills of working with specific type of item and material have a big impact on items characteristics. Equipment used for that is important as well.

Enhancements are effects applied to the items. They can endue an item with various abilities or characteristics. Some enhancements may have more value than basic characteristics of the tool or weapon. Possibilities for applying enhancements are determined by the item materials almost always. Some materials don't have any important battle use other than to powerful enchantment placement.

Notice: currently in our in-dev client is a craft window, which do not have anything alike this craft system, it is a temporary replacement for an older craft.


Land Domains

Seamless, constantly changing and populated world needs a good solution for managing land rights. Currently we are using the old and obsolete region system, which must be replaced by a new land domain system.

Domain is an area, rights to which are limited by a special magical structure at its center — the Domain Core. The size of this area can vary greatly — from small homes to large cities. The interface allows you to customize the size of ownership and permissions of each member. Also, it has slots for special items, determining the specific settings of domain. Maintenance of domain regularly consumes a small amount of ingame currency — this ensures that the domain belongs to the active player.

Major domains have a title, description, color and icon to display on the map of the world, which are also shown at the entrance of the domain. Every domain is a part of the political map of the world.

Cities need more fine tuning of citizen's permissions, all along of large amounts of different areas. The older region system is used for this purpose. All regions inside the domain are affiliated to it. It means that during the owner of the domain changing affiliated region rights also change their ownership.

Domains can be traded, auctioned, regenerated and even conquered in a fair fight. Read more about domains and regions.

Domain system implies integration with organizations. Read more about them.


Ore and Mineral System

Almost every item which you can buy it the players shops was produced by using materials mined by players. Our ore and mineral system is interesting, expandable and contains no design problems that have been an issue in Minecraft.

The entire ground is filled with ore veins mixed with each other. In addition to ores, there are other things, necessary to make underground more interesting. During the processing of rocks you get two different types of material: waste rock and ores. Waste rock has no value except as a building material, and the ore can be processed to get minerals. From each type of ore you can obtain minerals of different tiers:

These are examples of minerals divided by tiers

The quantity and quality of minerals depends on the equipment used for the extraction of minerals. The better the equipment, the greater the amount of material obtained by processing ores. The best equipment will also provide a small amount of higher-tier mineral.


Personal Space

In the single populous world a patch of land may be too expensive for a rookie. That's why everybody has their own personal space. It is not a part of giant main world, player never pays for it and can never loose it. On the other hand, it can not be shown to the others. It is just a personal area, private warehouse and workshop, a small room, which is otherwise essential for a newbie. Experienced players can use it for storing their most expensive items.

Access to the personal space goes through special portals placed and supported by players. It is expensive to make that kind of portal so it is a nice aim for a group of players. However there are some portals constantly placed near the spawn point to give new players a chance for using the personal space.


Non-target Combat System

The combat system based on the different types of damage and attack. Various types of damage are differently absorbed by armor, types of attack are what differs a bow from a sword. Every type of weapon has its own type of attack and most of them has no target and attacks selected side or region.

Monsters and players have a complex system of determining the result of attacks which depends on the armor. It means that headshot damages only armor in the slot of the helmet and only this piece of armor absorbs damage. It is just an example for the physical attack, magic and other attack types may work differently. The system is easily expandable, so we can add variety of new types of attacks and protections against them such as damage inflicted on the area, blocking projectiles with shield, poison clouds, chain lightning and critical hits.


Item Workshop

Community of players will be able to create their own decorative items: clothes, finery, even hairstyles. There will be a lot of slots on the character for all kinds of things. Furthermore, many objects can have alternative decorative modification (styles). But that is not all. It is possible to create even visual effects for some items. And for adjusting color balance in decorative effects we have universal system of color modifiers.

We have already developed drag'n'drop support for FBX asset format, which is the industry standard right now. By the way, we were the first ones to implement and to commit it to opensource-engine JME3, which we are using.


Economy

Almost all of the elements of the game are linked with the economy, it is the heart of the world. It is very important part for the game with rich crafting, so we are well thought out everything related to the economy. GreenCubes has an open market economy. There are no NPC traders, no fixed prices, and our currency doesn’t fall from every monster. Only players, their money and goods. Our in-game currency called «Greeny» (do not be confused with GC Coins — currency for project's shop).

Each player chooses their own path of progress, a combination of skills and crafts. You can sell and buy not only items and resources but even service can be bought and sold. Craft and combat system are constructed in such a way that the trade could never been stopped, so everything from raw materials to the most complex items is always has demand. Even the most common materials always have a price because they are needed in large quantities. Unnecessary items can be recycled to get some raw materials from which they are made.

Trading tools are necessary to make this a reality.


Additional Articles

In addition to the main features presented above, we have several articles about significant parts of the game, quite important in our community. You can find these articles on our site.

  • Organizations — unite players under one flag, our version of the «guilds».
  • Domains — land management system.
  • Decorative blocks — a huge arsenal for creative people. (Already done!)
  • Trading tools — for a lively and growing economy.
  • Worldwide subway system — automatic transport network, built and supported by players. (Already done!)
  • Hostile creatures — enemies for players to use their weapons, skills, armor, to unite against.
  • Modding - flexible interface and textures modification.
  • Tools for planning new buildings — to allow constructions of truly amazing and epic buildings.
  • Books — stories that fill our world. You can become a writer, keep a journal or even start a publishing office. (Already done!)
  • Support system — a unified system for bug reports, protection removal requests, pardon and ban requests, land regeneration requests and others, fully integrated with our infrastructure. (Already done!)

The Story

The magic in this world is not a medieval delusion but laws of physics. Effective study and use of these laws has led civilization to prosperity. This is not a classic fantasy with castles and knights, this is a world of opportunities and magical technologies. Little time has passed since the scientific discoveries and magical breakthrough, so in this world medieval castles and flying ships can stand next to modern factories and underground fortresses.

Storyline has not yet thought over in detail, and we determined only general concepts and visual style of the game. The story is not very important for the sandbox RPG like ours, so we are focused on thinking through the game mechanic,developing technical features and visual style.


What we will sell

GreenCubes — Free to Play. The game is free but we will be selling some in-game items, mostly for the decoration use.

We plan to sell:

  • Decorative wearables.
  • Alternative styles of tools and weapons.
  • Decorative effects, modifiers and counters.
  • Other decorative stuff.
  • Items, which open secondary skills, which don't gives much advantage but offer gameplay diversity.
  • Some other items and skills that do not affect the balance of the game.
  • Services related to domains and land operations (i.e. terraforming).

The items listed above will not necessarily be sold directly — for example, decorative cloths are made by normal in-game crafting with clothing skill but require some ingredients from GC shop. Besides that, any item that is available through purchase could be obtained by trading with players due to developed economy.

We shall not sell:

  • Basic resources
  • High-level weapons and armor
  • Instantaneous skill maximizing

Our Team

Our main team, working on project as a full-time job:

  • Anna ‘Rena4ka’ Dorogova — lead programmer, team leader.
  • Elina ‘Feyola’ Zhernova — game designer, project leader.
  • Sergey ‘MushroomKiller’ Tsvetkov — 2d-artist.
  • Maria ‘MushrO_om’ Tsvetkova — community manager, helpers/moderators manager.
  • Fluffy — 3d-artist, concept artist.

Our super-volunteers:

  • Arseniy 'Kern0' Maximov — web developer, who created the Support system for us.
  • Vitaliy 'Xitaly' Mikheev — our spellchecker, translator, moderator, and 2d-artist who created more than 250 block/terrain textures for our client.
  • Venus — translator and moderator.
  • Alexandra 'tort32' M. — client-side programmer on vacation.
  • Destr — enthusiastic programmer.
  • Kunik — Server-side programmer.

We also have a group of volunteers working as in-game moderators and helpers, they are important part of the team too. At last, we have some loyal players ready to provide assistance in number of areas.


Spending Plan

First of all, 12% of raised money will go to the fees and taxes. 68% will be used for a salaries of people who work full-time on project. The remaining 20% will be used to cover the rental of servers and software we use and that are necessary to supporting game. We are working remotely, so we don't pay office rent.

Additional funds we can use to:

  • Extend our team, primarily by employing our volunteers on a full-time job, accelerating the development of the game and improving its quality in general.
  • Extend the period in which we can work in full force, adding more features and content without worrying too much about in-game content sales aka microtransactions.
  • More perks can be added if funding summ greatly exceeds requirements.

Work plan

Our general goal for the year — adding core functionality with a small amount of secondary content to the game, it's almost all the major game features. At the end of the year game will not be quite ready but will be fully playable. We can reach self-sufficiency with well-working core gameplay and basic additional content.

  1. Finish client version 1.0 — support for all current server functions.
  2. Full international support.
  3. New inventory, part 1: fractional amounts of materials, non-slot inventories, separation of materials and items.
  4. New inventory, part 2: new slots on the character, active slots, types of damage, the new armor system.
  5. The new resource system: ores, minerals, refineries and self-sustaining undergrounds.
  6. New character model, armor and clothes. Will be carried out by artists simultaneously with the steps 1-5.
  7. Trading tools revision: trading hubs, small vending machines, direct exchange, currency exchange. There is an article about this feature.
  8. Skills: adding a technical and interface framework for a variety of skills, introducing and tuning of the first skills.
  9. Full revision of the new combat system with support of skill, inventory and armor systems.
  10. Aggressive monsters and FreePvP-world.
  11. Workshop for decorative items.

It is just a short list of general goals. We will also deal with small tasks that appear on the go, like additional features, overall improvements, bug fixes and community management. Do not forget that tasks will be divided between several people, so work can be done faster and in a different order.

We reserve the right not to follow this plan precisely or change it in the future in case we consider it incorrect, unreasoned or not beneficial to the project.


Our Current State

Most of the described features are not done yet, so our current game reminds of our past as a Minecraft server, because we are not have gone very far from it in matters of gameplay. But we already have our own client and server! Even though they are completely written and drawn by us and does not contain someone else's content, we need to maintain compatibility with older versions — GreenCubes is a huge world full of live players. We do not just change the existing game, we change the world itself.

With funding, we will be able to implement all our plans and exciting features without worrying about what we should sell to people next month

About the current appearance of the character

The biggest and most noticeable flaw of game in current state is boxed character inherited from Minecraft. Our players drew and sold each other skins for years, so while we do not have a strong alternative to skins, we can not just remove this feature. We have plans about the workshop which will give players the ability to create clothing, and that would be an excellent alternative to skins. However, we need a large amount of time and effort to create a new look for character and armor. Until now, our artists have been busy creating our analogues of content from Minecraft and now we did it! So after receiving funding, our artists will take care of this immediately.


Risks

MMORPG is always a large and complex project but game with a voxel world is even more difficult. Yes, this is a great project, even a description of all its features do not fit on the page of the campaign. But we have a stable and high-performance server and fully customizable client to start with. We are ready to add content of the game itself, rather than engage in invisible to the user technical development. We have many years of experience with voxel world and the issues that it generates. (And there are more issues than it seems at first glance!) In addition, we have an awesome community of moderators and helpers and other loyal and talented people willing to help.

We fully realize what we need to do to make this game a reality. Each of us have years of experience in this field. This is our full-time job and we don't want to leave it! We have a plan and done a lot of game design, with a complex technical base already developed.


Project history

GreenCubes project was founded in November 2010 as a Minecraft server for Russian-speaking audience. There were only two of us. In spring 2011 we started to develop our own server (GreenServer) for this game, because the original server could not handle a large number of players. In the summer of 2011 we moved to our GreenServer. Many of the features of Minecraft were not implemented and we decided to stop adjusting our server under official updates and go with our own way. We still used Minecraft as game client but we seriously modified it, as well as abandoned its official updates. Since November 2011 and until the summer of 2013, we added a lot of our own content. Since the summer of 2013 we were working on a new game design. Since the beginning of 2014 we have been devoting ourselves to a new client, and now it is already playable, have better graphics and a new craft system. We realized that we can transform our server into a full independent game. Currently we well-thought all you can think about before the start of an active development. Now we just do not have enough funds.

We developed a new client by selling decorative content in our old game, which is strongly modified Minecraft. But now, more than a year, we are fully dedicated to the development of a new game and have made great progress in the development of a new client for it. But the old game disregarded and no longer profitable. So now we can not make it without Your support!

GreenServer

GreenServer is our server. It is a stable, proven technical basis, which is necessary for server of any game. GreenServer is a powerful basis for a fully variable (voxel) world, which is not common feature for a game server.This is our own server, written entirely by us, so we know it better than if we had used someone else's product.Which means that we can easily modify and add to it the gameplay functionality of the game!

GreenServer actively developed from April 2011 until the spring of 2012. Then it became our server, which worked in pair with our old client. After that, we started working on the game, client and community. You can find a video on YouTube showing early version of the server. Its main advantage was then the high performance compared to Minecraft server.


FAQ

  • Q: Which game engine do you use?
  • A: We use JME3 — open-source game engine programmed entirely on Java. To the extent possible we are also engaged in its development.
  • Q: In which languages the game will be available?
  • A: We shall translate game to English and Russian by ourselves but website, reference materials, tutorials — all this is unlikely to be translated in the nearest future. However, all messages within the game can be translated to any language by community. In-game channels and section of the forum will appear when necessary.
  • Q: What about Steam Greenlight?
  • A: We are working on it.
  • Q: What are system requirements?
  • A: We are doing game with target to not last generation computers. You can find more on game downloading page.
  • Q: How I will receive my perk?
  • A: When the time comes, you will be emailed with special code and activation instructions.
story_txt:
GreenCubes will be a MMORPG game with a fully changeable sandbox world, a rich RPG and crafting system, an unscripted player-driven world and open market economy. Decorative wearables workshop is planned as well.
Game will be available on Windows, Mac OS X, Linux.
You can play an early version right now, to do so you should register and download the game from this link . Most of features described here are still not implemented.
Besides contributing funds, a great way to help our project is to share this page on social media! Help to spread the word!
Russian version of this text is available on our site. / Русская версия данного текста доступна на нашем сайте.

















Click on the title to scroll down to read more about it


Single World Created by People
The World of GreenCubes is fully changeable. It is not divided into locations or instances so you will never run into loading screen while traveling. One world for everyone, single server. It is voxel-based, quite similar to Minecraft but even better.
As you can find from our history, we have a big world as our great heritage. We never wiped it completely. It is filled with stories about existing and ancient cities, political games of great players, tricky trading frauds... This world's mysteries are endless. Due to continuous renovation and expansion, everyone has the opportunity to colonize it. Thanks to the features we plan to realize this world will get a second birth, its golden age is still ahead!
The world like this is a real challenge for developers, however we have experience of maintaining it for years. These features will help to solve main difficulties:

Complex land domain system


Personal space for everyone
Automated world-wide subway system (Already done!)


Tools for planning and designing new buildings (sort of singleplayer)
A lot of decorative blocks (Already done!)

Tools for selective cleaning and regeneration of land

Besides the main world there is a parallel one with free PvP. There you can find a special resource required for high-level crafting. In addition to the hordes blood-thirsty players, this world is aggressive by its own: earthquakes and destruction makes it impossible to live in.


Skills

The path of each character is unique. There is no such thing like a class or profession, player is not limited in progress and almost every combination of skills is accessible. Player doesn't have level — skills progress during use of them. The important part of this system is that skills don’t limit player’s actions but conversely improve them. The high skill is required for very high-leveled actions only, other types of actions can be performed without high skills but their performance will be poor.
Skills are all connected and form a skill tree — from the more general to more specialized ones. More common skills affect all lower ones and all kinds of activity but they are more difficult to improve.
There are four root groups of skills: 


Character skills affect characteristics and abilities of the character and are separated from the others. Skills like this have special ways of development.

Crafting skills affect players ability to work with materials and items: crafting and modifying items, repair and recycling. Also it includes variety of skills related to creating consumable items. Players with high-level crafting skills can participate in grandmasters rating, advertising their services in such a way.

Usage skills affect the ability of using items, powers or modifications. In this branch you can find all fighting and spell skills.

Researcher skills affect the chances of critical hit, ability to collect animal-related resources, healing of creatures (including players). Particularly, disease healing also included in this group. Yes, there are diseases!




Rich crafting

Opportunities for the item creation and modification are huge. Crafting system allows player to create a variety of unique items for every taste.
System is based on drafts, which determines the item type. Each draft has slots for applying materials, every material has its own characteristics, look and enhancements options. Skills of working with specific type of item and material have a big impact on items characteristics. Equipment used for that is important as well.
Enhancements are effects applied to the items. They can endue an item with various abilities or characteristics. Some enhancements may have more value than basic characteristics of the tool or weapon. Possibilities for applying enhancements are determined by the item materials almost always. Some materials don't have any important battle use other than to powerful enchantment placement.

Domain is an area, rights to which are limited by a special magical structure at its center — the Domain Core. The size of this area can vary greatly — from small homes to large cities. The interface allows you to customize the size of ownership and permissions of each member. Also, it has slots for special items, determining the specific settings of domain. Maintenance of domain regularly consumes a small amount of ingame currency — this ensures that the domain belongs to the active player.
Major domains have a title, description, color and icon to display on the map of the world, which are also shown at the entrance of the domain. Every domain is a part of the political map of the world.
Cities need more fine tuning of citizen's permissions, all along of large amounts of different areas. The older region system is used for this purpose. All regions inside the domain are affiliated to it. It means that during the owner of the domain changing affiliated region rights also change their ownership.
Domains can be traded, auctioned, regenerated and even conquered in a fair fight. Read more about domains and regions.
Domain system implies integration with organizations. Read more about them.

These are examples of minerals divided by tiers
The quantity and quality of minerals depends on the equipment used for the extraction of minerals. The better the equipment, the greater the amount of material obtained by processing ores. The best equipment will also provide a small amount of higher-tier mineral.

The combat system based on the different types of damage and attack. Various types of damage are differently absorbed by armor, types of attack are what differs a bow from a sword. Every type of weapon has its own type of attack and most of them has no target and attacks selected side or region.

Workshop for decorative items.

It is just a short list of general goals. We will also deal with small tasks that appear on the go, like additional features, overall improvements, bug fixes and community management. Do not forget that tasks will be divided between several people, so work can be done faster and in a different order.
We reserve the right not to follow this plan precisely or change it in the future in case we consider it incorrect, unreasoned or not beneficial to the project.

Our Current State
Most of the described features are not done yet, so our current game reminds of our past as a Minecraft server, because we are not have gone very far from it in matters of gameplay. But we already have our own client and server! Even though they are completely written and drawn by us and does not contain someone else's content, we need to maintain compatibility with older versions — GreenCubes is a huge world full of live players. We do not just change the existing game, we change the world itself.
With funding, we will be able to implement all our plans and exciting features without worrying about what we should sell to people next month
About the current appearance of the character
The biggest and most noticeable flaw of game in current state is boxed character inherited from Minecraft. Our players drew and sold each other skins for years, so while we do not have a strong alternative to skins, we can not just remove this feature. We have plans about the workshop which will give players the ability to create clothing, and that would be an excellent alternative to skins. However, we need a large amount of time and effort to create a new look for character and armor. Until now, our artists have been busy creating our analogues of content from Minecraft and now we did it! So after receiving funding, our artists will take care of this immediately.

Risks
MMORPG is always a large and complex project but game with a voxel world is even more difficult. Yes, this is a great project, even a description of all its features do not fit on the page of the campaign. But we have a stable and high-performance server and fully customizable client to start with. We are ready to add content of the game itself, rather than engage in invisible to the user technical development. We have many years of experience with voxel world and the issues that it generates. (And there are more issues than it seems at first glance!) In addition, we have an awesome community of moderators and helpers and other loyal and talented people willing to help.
We fully realize what we need to do to make this game a reality. Each of us have years of experience in this field. This is our full-time job and we don't want to leave it! We have a plan and done a lot of game design, with a complex technical base already developed.


Project history
GreenCubes project was founded in November 2010 as a Minecraft server for Russian-speaking audience. There were only two of us. In spring 2011 we started to develop our own server (GreenServer) for this game, because the original server could not handle a large number of players. In the summer of 2011 we moved to our GreenServer. Many of the features of Minecraft were not implemented and we decided to stop adjusting our server under official 
updates and go with our own way. We still used Minecraft as game client but we seriously modified it, as well as abandoned its official updates. Since November 2011 and until the summer of 2013, we added a lot of our own content. Since the summer of 2013 we were working on a new game design. Since the beginning of 2014 we have been devoting ourselves to a new client, and now it is already playable, have better graphics and a new craft system. We realized that we can transform our server into a full independent game. Currently we well-thought all you can think about before the start of an active development. Now we just do not have enough funds.
We developed a new client by selling decorative content in our old game, which is strongly modified Minecraft. But now, more than a year, we are fully dedicated to the development of a new game and have made great progress in the development of a new client for it. But the old game disregarded and no longer profitable. So now we can not make it without Your support!
GreenServer
GreenServer is our server. It is a stable, proven technical basis, which is necessary for server of any game. GreenServer is a powerful basis for a fully variable (voxel) world, which is not common feature for a game server.This is our own server, written entirely by us, so we know it better than if we had used someone else's product.Which means that we can easily modify and add to it the gameplay functionality of the game!
GreenServer actively developed from April 2011 until the spring of 2012. Then it became our server, which worked in pair with our old client. After that, we started working on the game, client and community. You can find a video on YouTube showing early version of the server. Its main advantage was then the high performance compared to Minecraft server.

FAQ

Q: Which game engine do you use?
A: We use JME3 — open-source game engine programmed entirely on Java. To the extent possible we are also engaged in its development.
Q: In which languages the game will be available?
A: We shall translate game to English and Russian by ourselves but website, reference materials, tutorials — all this is unlikely to be translated in the nearest future. However, all messages within the game can be translated to any language by community. In-game channels and section of the forum will appear when necessary.
Q: What about Steam Greenlight?
A: We are working on it.
Q: What are system requirements?
A: We are doing game with target to not last generation computers. You can find more on game downloading page.
Q: How I will receive my perk?
A: When the time comes, you will be emailed with special code and activation instructions.

story:
Questions regarding the campaign or your perk purchase? Please send an email to: supportgogo@48hstudio.com.

Welcome to our crowdfunding campaign for Exgenesis!

We strongly believe in this ambitious project but only with your help we can make it happen. And every bit counts, so even if you can’t contribute please share this campaign: tell your friends, parents, neighbours, dogs, cats and even your grandma...




Exgenesis is a point and click adventure game for PC (Windows) with a peculiar graphical style that blends true photos with computer graphics to create a dreamlike and mysterious atmosphere.

Set in a dystopian future the game will have the player explore the most intimate places of his personality, accompanying him on a journey to discover the secrets of existence.




Classic point and click gameplay.

We are big fans of the genre and the game will reflect that. You can expect puzzles to solve, items to collect and use, places to explore, dialogues… all that good stuff.


All the choices presented are viable.

The protagonist is the player himself; what’s right or wrong is up to him and the story will take shape accordingly. This leads to high replayability and multiple endings.


Mix of real world photos and computer graphics.

All the scenes in the game are artfully composed by photo editing from various sources. We blend together photos (including real historical landmarks and handcrafted clay models) and computer generated images to produce distinctive, eye-catching visuals. All of this presented in full HD resolution.


Immersive surreal experience.

The peculiar graphical style, together with the story based on real ancient beliefs, creates an unique experience that sends the player on a strange journey full of mystery and discovery.




We can’t reveal all the details yet but here is a small introduction to the plot:

Everything we’ve been taught about the Creation is a lie. The true story of the genesis has been lost to the ages. Our ancestors failed to preserve the truth and the purpose of our existence has been forgotten.

Many years from the greatest war the world has ever seen, mankind has completely lost his spirituality and is now living only to fulfill his material needs. This isn’t acceptable anymore. A new beginning is needed. A new earth.

They’re already watching us. They’re judging us. They’re already choosing who's worthy of watching the dawn of the new humankind, and those who will take part in it.



The story behind Exgenesis is based on real legends and beliefs and it offers an original take on the genesis myth.

Everything takes place in a dystopian future where mysterious entities put the player to the test as he tries to uncover the true nature of the world.




There are various ways to help us achieve our goal of making a game you’ll love (or at least we hope so):

  • Back us through this campaign and receive EXCLUSIVE rewards.
  • Vote for us on Steam Greenlight.
  • Tell everybody you know about us and our game.
  • Follow us on our socials (links at the end of the page)





As most of you know developing a game requires lots of time and, as a consequence, money. For the past several months we have been working on Exgenesis relying only on our savings. Unfortunately they’re running out and if we want to continue working full time on the project we need new funds. That’s where you come in. If this campaign is successful we’ll be able to make our vision come true unhindered and bring you a finished and polished game.




A huge thank you from all of us. Your name will be on the game credits as a “Follower”.


  • Digital Wallpapers pack (#3 wallpapers)
  • Digital copy of the Exgenesis OST


  • Everything from the "Devout Follower" perk
  • Digital copy of the game (and a Steam code if we get GreenLit)


  • Everything from the "Devout Follower" perk
  • Digital copy of the game (and a Steam code if we get GreenLit)


  • Everything from the "Adept" perk
  • Access to the BETA
  • Access to the Forum
  • Your name will be on the credits as a "Dreamer"
  • IF we reach the "Exgenesis: Chapter 2" stretch goal, you will receive the new episode too.


  • Everything from the "Dreamer" perk
  • Digital artbook in pdf format.


  • Everything from the "Fervent Dreamer" perk
  • A poster of Exgenesis (30x50)
  • Your name will be on the credits as a "Traveler"
(Price includes shipping within the European Union. Please add 10€ for shipping outside the EU.)


  • Everything from the "Fervent  Dreamer" perk
  • An EXCLUSIVE poster signed by us
  • Your name will be on the credits as a "Truth Seeker"

(Price includes shipping within the European Union. Please add 10€ for shipping outside the EU.)


  • Everything from the "Truth Seeker" perk
  • A Special Limited Edition T-Shirt.
  • Your name will be on the credits as an "Enlightened"

(Price includes shipping within the European Union. Please add 10€ for shipping outside the EU.)


  • Everything from the "Enlightened" perk
  • A UNIQUE poster (70x100). There will be only one copy of this poster in the world. The first come is the first served.

(Price includes shipping within the European Union. Please add 10€ for shipping outside the EU.)

  • Everything from the "Enlightened" perk
  • A scale model of one of the sphinxes present in game. 
  • Your name will be on the credits as a “Chosen”.
(Price includes shipping within the European Union. Please add 10€ for shipping outside the EU.)

  • Everything from the "Enlightened" perk
  • A silver medallion of the Exgenesis logo.
  • Your name will be on the credits as a "Sage"

(Price includes shipping within the European Union. Please add 10€ for shipping outside the EU.)


  • Everything from the "Sage" or "Chosen" perk (your choice)
  • One week of online mentoring from our graphic designer.
  • Your name will be on the credits as a "Guide"

(Price includes shipping within the European Union. Please add 10€ for shipping outside the EU.)


  • Everything from the "Sage" and "Chosen" perks.
  • A physical copy of the artbook and the OST.
  • A Super Exclusive Collector's pack. (It's an awesome plastic box designed by our graphic containing all the rewards).
  • Your name will be on the credits as a "Guardian".

(Price includes shipping within the European Union. Please add 10€ for shipping outside the EU.)


  • Everything from the "Sage" or "Chosen" perk (your choice)
  • A 3-day trip to Italy to visit us and the real places we've used in the game so far.
  • Your name will be on the credits as a "Master"

(Price includes shipping within the European Union. Please add 10€ for shipping outside the EU.)





Various licenses. In order to have the full team working on the project we need to buy additional Unity3D licenses.

Photos. This particular graphics style comes with difficulties. Taking the proper shot takes time, patience and sometimes we even have to build a photo set.

Localization. English is not our native language, so we’ll need someone to help us translate and proofread all the game text.

Bills and administrative costs. We try spending as less money as possible but running a business has its costs and we have to take that into account.

Food. And last but not least, as human beings we need to eat in order to continue working on our game. And yes, beer is food too.




This is the first time we try our hands at a project with such a prominent narrative component but we strongly believe that our team is more than capable of delivering a satisfying and polished game.

It is obviously possible that unforeseen circumstances or technical problems will slow down the development but apart from that we really don’t see what could go wrong.




We are 48h Studio, it’s a pleasure to meet you. We try to do what we love: creating videogames for all of you to enjoy (or at least we hope so!). Earlier this year we released our first commercial game “Avoid - Sensory Overload”, available worldwide for Windows PC, Mac, iOS and Android. Our team is composed of:


Katalin Negretti - Composer / Sound Designer

Andrea Pantaloni - Lead Programmer

Tommaso Pantaloni - CTO / 3D Artist / Programmer

Francesca Sasso - Graphic Designer / 2D Artist

Michele Sasso - CEO / Communication Manager




Q: When will Exgenesis be released? 

A: We estimated about 6 months of development left so it will probably released in the first half of 2015.


Q: What platforms will Exgenesis be available for? 

A: It will surely be available for Windows PC. Ports for Mac, Linux, iOS (iPad only) and Android (tablet only) will be made if we reach the appropriate stretch goals.


Q: Why are you not considering a smartphone version? 

A: To really enjoy Exgenesis we think that a bigger screen is needed.


Q: Who should I share my campaign link with?

A: Share the campaign with everyone you know! Remember, this is not just restricted to email, you can share on Twitter and Facebook too. Don’t be afraid of annoying friends and family...


Q: If I am an international funder, are there additional shipping costs?

Yes. If you are an international funder, you will find your additional shipping costs included at the bottom of each perk.  When you check out, be sure to manually add in this amount (Indiegogo does not do this for you!).


Q: What if I left out the shipping costs by mistake?

A: You can make an additional donation in the amount required for your perk and just notify us through the comments. We will be reading them all.

story:
Welcome to our campaign, if you love adventure games full of action and with epic story line this is for you!

After sometime into the campaign, we realized that we were spending too much time into promoting the campaign itself, leaving us with little time for the project itself. So we have re-planned our funding, and are now focusing on developing varoius games using our same characters, both as a way to expand our promotion, as as a way to fund the development of this project.


Thank you for supporting us, and we will deliver the rewards to the ones who supported us, as promissed.


We are planning to release the game this year, with your help we'll be able to release it sooner and with the best quality.


Our game will be available for PC, iOS, Android and Blackberry, so check back our site to stay up to date with the project.

story:
The Baxter

Hello Everyone, 

We are The Baxter - a bar and arcade set to open in Chapel Hill, North Carolina. We started as four friends, bartenders, and gaming enthusiasts that wanted to bring a new kind of bar to the Triangle - These bars have popped up all over the Metropolitan areas of the US, and they serve a two-fold purpose: one is to serve drinks in a vintage, nostalgic environment. The other purpose is to preserve these pieces of art so that generations to come can appreciate the humble beginnings of the gaming world. We want to keep these games just as we all remember them - completely awesome and operating in the best condition possible. Our forty machines run the gamut of arcades in their prime, from 1978 to 1998. If you can think of the top fives games that you loved as a child, we probably have at least a few of them!

The Baxter team has financed everything up this point. We are now mid build out, and finishing construction along with restoring these machines to their original glory is becoming costly. Instead of going to a bank for a small loan, we thought we would appeal to the teenager in all of you - to see what kind of help we could get from the Internet community.  We are trying our hardest to open by the end of August, when the students at UNC Chapel Hill return to school. That means completing our bar build out and getting our machines fully restored as soon as possible. We want to make sure these games can handle being on for 8+ Hours a day - and some of these beauties are from 1978...a lot of TLC needs to go into them!

Every little bit of money can help with something, light fixtures, arcade parts, etc. You could even help by just spreading the word about us. Please help share our campaign, and thank you for your time and donation. 

Sincerely, 

The Baxter crew


P.S. Please visit our Facebook page to see updates.

story:
UPDATE (7/30/12): GOAL REACHED!

Now for the fun part.


First of all, I just want to thank all of you for your unpredecented outpouring of support for Brian. You all work hard to earn your money and you didn't have to spend it this way, but you chose to, and I can't even begin to thank you enough for what you've done for my friend (and yours). Truly we have the best fans on the whole entire Internet.

Anyhoo, you may have seen Brian say this in other places by now, but he asked me to update this page to reflect the news, and so here it is:

Some time ago Brian jokingly mentioned in passing the idea of doing a "We Didn't Start the Fire"-style parody of all his talkthroughs. It was just a joke, but people have been bringing it up and badgering him to do it ever since. He had never seriously considered it before, but now, thanks to all the support he's received, Brian has stated that if this campaign reaches $1500 he will write lyrics and perform this exceedingly embarrassing song for his fans. It's just a little cherry on top of an already wonderful sundae, but for those who were maybe waiting for a payday to donate, this is to let you know that there's still incentive to do so.

story:
The Mission

Welcome to RISE UP, the sport of Ultimate’s first professional instructional video series. If your goal is to become a better ultimate player or make your team better, you've come to the right place.

The mission of RISE UP is to improve the level of play of Ultimate teams and players through the creation of engaging instructional videos created by experts. 

Our goal is to create useful teaching tools that empower players at any level to call a friend, grab a disc, and immediately improve their game. 

The Story

RISE UP began with a story that many Ultimate players can relate to. It started in the heart and mind of an ultimate player who found himself addicted to a phenomenally intriguing sport community, and wanted to learn everything he could about how to play, but lacked the resources or connections to help himself get better. As someone who attended a school that lacked Ultimate tradition, I found myself, essentially, teaching myself how to play, learning by trial and error, and watching other great teams and players at tournaments in order to gain insight. Those incredible teams seemed to, not only be miles ahead of where I was, but also, because their schools had recognized, established Ultimate culture and programs (i.e. Wisconsin, Carleton, Paidea, Amherst), those players also seemed to be learning at a rate that was much quicker than me and my small-school teammates. I realized those programs had people (captains, coaches, alumni) who had played at the highest level of the sport, and were now passing on everything they knew, allowing players to skip the inefficiency of trial and error, moving quickly towards best practice. My team didn't have access to people like that. The deck seemed to be stacked against us. 

This situation still exists for a majority of the players in the ultimate community. Enter, RISE UP.

The Need for RISE UP

The sport and community of Ultimate is growing and expanding at an incredible rate, an Ultimate renaissance is at hand. Thanks to incredible organizations like Skyd Magazine, Nexgen Network, and Ultivillage, Ultimate players and fans who have been starving for more of what they want are finally feeling like they have resources to quench their thirst.  With this growth in the spread of news, knowledge, and ideas, we think it makes sense that there should also be progress and growth in the way people learn how to PLAY Ultimate. We are proud and humbled to hope to create what will be an ultimate education revolution... RISE UP. 

The Product

What will each video have? Each video will include:

  • 1. An explanation of why the skill is important
  • 2. Game footage (NGN + Skyd Magazine) that shows high-level players using the 
  • 3. A step-by-step explanation of how to perform the skill
  • 4. A drill to help you practice AND an explanation of how to coach the drill
  • 5. How to evaluate success using the skill

Where will I be able to watch the videos? www.RISEUPultimate.com. 

How much will each RISE UP season cost? $20 each for Seasons 1 and 2.

How many videos are in each season? Approximately 10-12.

How long is each video? Videos will be approximately 3-12 minutes long, depending on the content. For example, it might only take 3 minutes to teach you how to throw an upwind huck, but it might take 12 minutes to explain everything you need to know in order to break a 3-man trap zone. 

When will Season 1 be released? Fall 2012. 

How often will new videos be released? Approximately weekly. Videos in a season will be released regularly over a span of about 2 months. 

Will there be any free content? Yes. For each season, we will release at least 1 (but probably more) video for free, and some teasers of other videos. 

Who is the target audience for RISE UP? RISE UP is meant for anyone who wants to get better at ultimate or improve their team. This includes coaches, youth, college players, club players, international players.... everyone.  Specifically, RISE UP was created for players who don't have access to someone who has the high-level knowledge or coaching experience to help them get better. 

What content is planned for seasons 1 and 2?

Season 1: Handler Offense

  • The moment of the catching: improving your hands
  • Stationary dump cutting: reading the defense and reacting
  • Motion dump cutting, from the sideline
  • Backhand give-go moves
  • Practicing give-go moves
  • Receiving and attacking from dishy cuts
  • The dump swing
  • Horizontal stack handler cutting and clearing
  • The 3-man game: vert stack handler movement
  • Receiving the pull
  • Being the 2: what to look for from the defense
  • Picking the disc up from a turnover
  • Walking the disc to the line after an end-zone turnover 

Season 2: The point of attack (Marking and Breaking the Mark)

  • Marking from motion (the stop-continue drill)
  • Changing the mark to combat horizontal and vertical offenses
  • The best possible break-mark drill
  • The 'shimmy' move
  • Breaking a thrower's rhythm with off-rhythm jabs
  • The force-middle mark
  • Hucking and the straight-up anti-huck mark
  • Marking against the hammer
  • Marking matchups
  • Practicing off-hand throws
  • Practicing throwing into space

What content is planned for Season 3 and beyond? We currently have ideas for over 200 total videos, but want to make sure we create content that people really want. During Season 1, we will be getting feedback from subscribers in order to guide our decision making on what videos get created. 

Will there be DVD's? For now, the plan is no, just the website.

Why did you choose the name RISE UP? We spent a serious amount of time considering the right title for this project. After much deliberation, we chose RISE UP because it's empowering, a call to action, to grow, and succeed. RISE UP is an Ultimate education revolution.

The Team

Mario O'Brien - Producer/Creative Director

  • 4-time Rhino Captain, 2 years International Ultimate Coaching Clinic Experience (6 countries), 12 Years Coaching Experience in Multiple Sports, 5 Years Teaching Experience (Middle and High School - Math and Spanish), Master's Candidate - Curriculum and Instruction + Educational Leadership and Policy

Elliot Trotter - Marketing/Business Manager

  • Skyd Magazine Founder/Editor-in -Chief, 7 years playing Ultimate, 4 Years Coaching Experience, Event Manager at Cu1timate, Seattle Voodoo

Andy Lovseth - Web Designer/Manager

  • Co-creator of "The Huddle", 15 years playing Ultimate, 6 years Coaching Ultimate Experience, 10 years Web Design Experience

Ben Wiggins - Coach for Seasons 1 and 2

  • 3-time USAU Club Champion, 2003 Callahan Winner, 5-time Sockeye Captain, Co-creator of "The Huddle", 12 years Ultimate Leadership/Coaching Experience, Instructor at University of Washington (Biology) and Doctoral Student in Education

story:
A Game like no other...


Aetherguilds Novel Design infuses an application strategy game with the community role playing experience of a massive live world.
Your awakened character in nothing less than a version of you where you manifest powerfull abilities, craft artifacts battle monsters and other players and at the same time you build and control an army to incrase your Guilds influence.


Fusing Game Genres

"Its like Travian and Tribal Wars meets a light version of Hearthstone"

- Stratos "Drendor" Jimis, PvP enthousiast Beta Tester


    Game Features

  • Aetherguilds is designed so that there are many different things to do. One day you might just work on crafting and alchemy, while another day you might go on an adventure.
  • Play to have fun not to be oppressed. Timed events give you plenty of time to react so you do not need to check every now and then what is happening. Login whenever you feel like it.
  • Classic pen and paper Role Play gamers that want to feel the same experience but do not have the time anymore will be thrilled to participate in our community in the time they can spare.
  • Players are encouraged to create real life events embedded in the storyline as diplomacy meetings and live action special event sessions.
  • 5 year long storyline is titled in every direction depending on the community's actions. Every week a new decision is made and the storyline progresses!
  • Play as a Guild. Found your own guild or join an existing one. Use our automated match system and accept a guilds invitation to make new friends.
  • Every Character is unique. Select a combination of Heritage and Path, prepare Abilities and choose Weapons and Elixirs.
  • All items are craftable. Gather monster loots and use them in Alchemy to Upgrade Abilities Weapons and Elixirs. 
  • Economy solely influenced by players. Immediately sell anything to the market. Offer and Demand adjusts prices. Why not play as a trader?
  • Advance to our world's society hierarchy and gain more powerful status tittles. Control all different aspects of community like from military enforcement to underground mafia, from academia to the occult and many more.
  • Complete online application missions against other players and gather resources for your guid. Through these missions discover our 5 years planned storyline.
  • Use our automated Session module and join a classic pen and paper session with your character based on the current point in storyline or create one on your own.
  • Master your combat techniques while Hunting monsters or face other Guilds in the Arena
  • Participate in Unit Auctions and create your army. Each unit has special abilities so choose wisely where to bid.
  • Equip your units with the same Abilities, Weapons and Elixirs that player characters use. Give them a name and level them up through combat.
  • Conquer lands for your Guild while fighting against npcs or other Guilds territories. Protect strategic points and gather resources but be vigilant against npc or enemy guild attacks.


Player Driven Storyline

"The twists and turns in this storyline, It feels like awakening in the Matrix and trying to survive in Game of Thrones"

- Tereza "Lini Star" Mazurkiewicz,  Tabletop Role Player Beta Tester


  The Story

The Setting of the story is set on each players city. The date is today. The characters are not fictional personas. Your character is YOU.

It is called the Awakening.. The instant you discover your whole life was a lie. It is then when you acknowledge your true Heritage. It is then when you first select your Path. The world will hunt you like a monster. Fight you like a Villain. You will have the opportunity to prove their fear right. You will have the opportunity to destroy their world forever...

The choice will be always yours...


Live Community

"Online, We fought to the death. In Real life we became best friends"

Harry "Shadowdancer" Dasios, Ioanna "Darkiwa" Samarnioti
Community Legends


   Honest Thanks to our Community

We would have never got this far if it was not for our community support. Our Development team will like to honor all these people by including them here and publically and honestly thanking them. Their characters may have battled in closed beta tests these last years against demons and gods. However the Players behind the characters are the real heroes.

We Sincerely thank everyone of you.

Especially we thank 

Anatelon Elias, Alexandros Alexandratos, Alexandros Doom Manolatos, Andreas Etrigan Manolatos, Argiro, Aristidis Allucard Veligiannopoulos, Ayla, Ballerond, Christos Koufakos Bracier, Constantine Lyhnus Lychnaropoulos, D127 Thalia Xomeritaki, Darioula Dabria Tretiakova, Despoina Sindel Karfi, Dimitra Nymeria Bakagianni, Dimitris House Doxopoulos, Eleni Stam, Evi Swer Tzou, Fakriadis Savvas Kain, Fotis Gatz Kolliatsas, George Kafa, George Sollomher Kafa, Giannis Anthallen, Ioanna Darkeca Samarnioti, Irini Alice Markaki, Jack A. Stibium, Jeff quorthon the Valiant Dragon, Kelthamon Iceheart, Kevi Desease Magel, Kirki, Kyriakos Poimenidis, Manos Ragiadakos, Rmanos, Maria Kotiva, Marios Jillian Michos, Marios Psilopoulos, Marwan Dragobeast Sanoussi, Mela BlackAngel Melaki, Michail Narleth Bogdanos, Mistery, Nefelli sv, Nemi, Nick Corvo Levendis, Nikos Bonfire Tzanopoulos, Nikos D. Fade, Nymeria, Nικολαος ο Μεγας, Pabis Noctis Tsaous, Pamelita Πέννυ δρουζα, Panos Vavaroutas, Polinikis Papoulias, Sangy, Sfein Light, ShadowDancer, Shiva, Sodeli, Sotiris ophidian, Stef Dimou, Twistedfate, Vaios Zisopoulos, VampireKon, Vangelis Vantor Kratsas, Vasilis Raziel Messas, Vasilis Souvatzoglou, Wolfakos, Xalazonitis, Xristos Kiratzopoulos, Αθηνά Γιοκαρίνη Scarlet, Αλέξανδρος Διαμαντούρος Obscurus Sidus, Άφτερη Πεταλούδα, Γιάννης Firebrand Μιχαλόπουλος, Γιάννης Rudie Σιδερίδης, Γιώργος EstiLaRal, Γιώργος Τυρπανης, Ελενη Σταμουλη,Σωτήρης Πεκτελίδης Enethil, Μηνάς Δασκαλόπουλος, Νικος Azad Γκογκας, Παναγιώτης Kikaze Μανίτας, Στελιος Εzeriah, Χρηστος SuperONE Μπαχτσεβανιδης, Χρήστος Αντώναρος


Be the Guild

"United we Stand. Archons!"

-Vangelis "Vantor" Kratsas, Archon Dominus, Guild Master


Upadate!

We are happy to announce that our players are already organizing into Guilds.

These Guilds will be featured here at the estimated date of Monday 22 February!



Special Thanks to our Partners

Karliene for her enchanting Vocals on the AetherGuilds theme song 


I would like to take a moment to say hello to all the fans of Aetherguilds. If you aren’t already familiar with me, my name is Karliene and I’m a celtic singer/ musician from Scotland with a growing online fan base. The team at Aether Guilds came to me through my music showing an incredible amount of support and positivity for what I do and when they mentioned they were looking for a singer for their amazing new game I jumped at that chance. I can safely say it’s been one of the most lovely and rewarding experiences of my career and I’m thrilled to have been able to add something to this exciting and passionate project. I wish them all the best for the future and hope we can work again some day. I hope you all enjoy the game and the song.Karliene.

You Tube : http://www.youtube.com/user/heartofsnow23

Facebook Page : /KarlieneMusic

Twitter : @KarlieneMusic

website : Karliene.com

Aneta for her inspiring Illustrations

Hello Aetherguilds fans. My name is Aneta and I am freelance illustrator and concept artist based in Poland. First of all I want to thank the team for the chance to be a part of this awesome project.  I hope you will enjoy the game as much as I enjoy creating artworks for it. Have fun on your first mission! :)


Dangerously addictive


"I dont mind what happpens to me. I just want my character to be allright"

-Darioula "Dabria" Tretiakova, Live Action Beta Tester

Join us in our adventure

This is an open invitation to all. 

Either an old supporter or a possible new friend.

We want you to be part of our new larger community. 

Join us in our adventure, in wars and diplomacy.

The world of Aetherguilds calls you!

story:
MESSAGE FROM THE HEART

 

PLAYING GAMES HAS

NEVER BEEN SO REAL


 

ABOUT REAL LIFE GAMES

Do you eat, sleep and breathe video games?

Now you can live them.

Welcome to Real Life Games, where we take virtual games and make them reality.

Our founder, Nick Hobson, started this venture with the idea of combining the atmosphere of a Renaissance faire with the experience of a video game. From there, he enlisted Matt Swanson, Director of Marketing/PR, to flesh out the details. Soon, Real Life Games was created and we began our first game pitch.

At heart, we’re a group of people trying to do something fun with our friends. Our aim is to design a world where our customers can come together with their friends and experience their favorite video games firsthand.

We wanted to create a space where friends of different backgrounds can come together and enjoy the game. A place where nerdy friends, athletic friends and gamer friends can all unite to have a good time.

 

Our idea is simple: Take a virtual universe and create its real world counterpart.

Real Life Games is the first of its kind. Virtual reality’s goal is to put you into the game, our goal is to bring games to life. We’re bringing you an experience created by real gamers.

Our team has the talent of a three time Emmy Award winning set designer, David Weller; combined with the expertise of writers, makeup artists, actors and stunt crews. This is truly a company of passionate creative individuals ready to put the work in and create something unforgettable.

We work together to bring our games into existence. It’s time to get up and play for real!

 

PERKS AND LOOT

retain all of your loot as you level up! Each level contains it's own loot including all of the prizes previous to it.

 

WHAT WE DO

Step one, the idea. First things first, we get together with a big empty white board and begin brainstorming. Ideas get thrown out left and right until our board is filled, or we get tired of insulting one another. We then begin the process of elimination until we are left with an idea the whole team can feel excited about.

Step two, the concept. After the idea is selected, we split up and do what we do best, artists begin drawing visual concept art, while marketing and sales team starts strategizing. Of course, everyone is super excited and much of our time is spent spying over the artist’s shoulder to see what things look like, but hey, can you blame us?

 

Step three, the pitch. When we have our art, sales and marketing planned, we put the pitch together. We head to the races hoping our client loves the idea as much as we do.

Step four, design. The groundwork has been laid, now we need to knuckle down and iron out the details. We work on scale first, making sure we have our proportions down, building models of each game until we love what we have. After the models are outlined, we pick the materials for each wall and prop to create the most realistic experience possible.

Step five, build. Construction begins, our sales and marketing teams are hyping up the game, posting updates and sharing our progress with you guys, the players. This way you can keep track of everything that’s happening start to finish.

Step six, beta. Donators on our closed beta invite list will be notified of our new game release. The set will be constructed and beta play will commence. Initial play allows us to find design flaws, safety issues or any inconsistencies with our projects. Simultaneously, we will record and share the beta footage to really get people pumped!

 

Step seven, play. The moment you’ve all been waiting for! We tear down, pack up and ship out. Our crew arrives at our events early and sets up an unforgettable experience for everyone involved.

 

HOW WE MAKE OUR MONEY

 

Real Life Games is currently a business facing company. Our goal is to work with, or for other businesses. We enhance the customer experience at conventions, create new corporate team building activities and develop amazing PR stunts.

 

Each project will be sold differently. Some projects will be pre-sold to advertisers, while others will bring in revenue from ticket sales. We might be a business facing company, but we always have the consumer in mind.

 

We want to make all of our experiences readily available for you, the players. The more backers we get, the more appealing our company becomes to events and advertisers. That means more events close to you!

 

CUSTOM AND LICENSED BUILDS

For full scale replication we carefully investigate each of the game’s areas creating Auto CAD overlays and measuring scale to get the most accurate representation. As our designs evolve, we send the plans back and forth to our clients and the game creators for approval before moving on. We keep a constant open flow of communication to make sure we produce something everyone can be excited about.

 

16,000 square feet. You read that right, that is the size of our largest design to date. We can’t tell you what it is since this project is still underway, but our pictures can give you a hint or two. We carefully deconstructed this game and meticulously designed the field from an incredibly popular competitive play map.

 

Originally created by Paul Hobson, Open Door Save Princess ran into a stalemate when life got the better of our CEO’s younger brother. With a daughter to take care of and a job to do, he simply didn’t have the resources to finish his creation any longer. It is our absolute pleasure to take on his ideas and create a live Flagship Game.

"Homage to the Thales of Miletus, this maze explores the peculiar theory of unified physics that holds the belief that EVERYTHING IS WATER; This theory later becoming outwitted by the atomic theory that EVERYTHING IS MOST DECIDEDLY NOT WATER, BUT STILL UNFAVORABLY IS INCONSISTENT, and was later utterly destroyed by the invention of the umbrella, keeping people relatively water-free since 1852."

Above is one of the actual hand drawn mazes done by Paul in the early days of his plans. Each maze, although following a continual story, has it’s own witty theme and series of challenges to complete. Adventure through the winding hallways and solve challenging puzzles with your friends as this epic story unfolds maze after maze.

 

Sometimes the constraints of square footage hit us hard but that doesn’t mean we can’t host an amazing event with awesome content! Our Real Life Mini Games are designed for just those situations, created to fit within 1000 sq. ft. of space, these games will be able to squeeze into most convention hall meeting rooms. We can design new, customized and personalized mini   games for any event.

 

 

BIG IDEA

Our ultimate goal is to have fully immersive games available for play in multiple locations at any time.

The first game we have in mind takes place in a space station. Using RFID tagging equipment and HUD overlays to display health, player level, ammunition and mission tracking you may just forget you’re in a game.

The station will be built as a massive movie set and employees will be full time characters in the game. Our team of actors and various stunt personnel will play as the villains taking over parts of the station and requiring players to retake sections one at a time.

The entire game will run back end on a server tracking statistics, analytics and story updates just like a video game. Your missions will be received via Bluetooth earpiece from our base command operative, walking you through each objective as you play.

Gather friends and play as tanks, healers or damage dealers in order to protect the earth from invasion!

This idea is an enormous undertaking for the future and we need your help to accomplish it. Donate, share our info with your friends, follow our social media, if you believe in this as much as we do then let’s come together to make this a reality.

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

The journey of establishing a start up is creative and exciting, but it can also come with many hurdles. In order to execute a project, we first need to complete the design and build the construction phases. One of our major hindrances is the time between planning and constructing the games. Our process requires both the time to design and construct each game before they are playable.  For a small business like us, those gaps in revenue can be constraining.

Real Life Games needs funds to properly build, execute and explore all possible recreations of your favorite games. We are requesting your help with raising the capital necessary to see our projects to fruition. With your sponsorship, we can make this a reality and truly bring games to life. 
Don't let it be game over for this great idea.

 

THE TEAM

Founder/CEO

Nick Hobson

The kind of guy that sets his mind on an idea and goes for it.  Nick spent 5 years running one of the largest martial arts tricking events in the USA as the founder/director of operations.

Back in the early days of Steam he played as a competitive counter-strike player sponsored by his local LAN center “LAN Mine”as a young teen, then once more after moving by “Net Jam” as a young adult in the Coachella Valley.  While in the valley he began a career coaching women’s artist gymnastics recreationally and then as a high level competitive coach later on including invitation only training at the United States Olympic Training Center for the sport. During that time he trained in many of his own disciplines such as:
Martial arts, Tricking and Parkour/Free Running.

After a 12 year career in coaching he then began and runs Real Life Games as its Founder/CEO.

Director of Marketing/Public Relations

Matt Swanson

Problem solving is one of his favorite challenges, his analytic thought process helps him break down and find solutions to just about any problem he comes across.  Matt worked with nonprofits in promotions and public relations during his college years including time in conjunction with the California Women’s Conference marketing team to create hype and raise awareness.

His competitive and analytic habits keep him involved in skill based games competing at high levels in everything he does. He attended California State University, Long Beach for public relations and marketing, followed after by aiding with content and graphic layout for Congressman Pete Aguilar in Redlands, CA.

Set Design

David Weller

8 time nominee and 3 time Emmy Award winning set designer David Weller works to ensure a high quality design and a visual experience to be remembered.  He has over 25 years experience including work on 7 Superbowl shows, Madison “Scare” garden, Oprah Winfrey, Maury Povich and much more.  His creative mind and wealth of design experience coupled with his amazing personality proved to be a great match for us here at Real Life Games right off the bat.

 

ADDITIONAL UNLOCKS

Special thanks to all of the love and support we've received so far in our journey.  We just wanted to take a line here and shout out some amazing people.

Miller Farm Media
Jayson Duncan
Rae Driver
Jeff Huang
Christian Cruz
Armando Rodriguez
Dania Beltran
Joe Gentner
Spencer JaQuay
Kayla Garcia
Branden Hansen
Thekla Hutyrova
Graham Hooper
Jay Kwon
Travis Wong

and of course our families who put up with our crazy ideas. 

We are truly blessed to be surrounded by these amazing people and can't wait to show the world what their support can help us accomplish.

MESSAGE FROM THE HEART

 
PLAYING GAMES HAS

Do you eat, sleep and breathe video games?
Now you can live them.

At heart, we’re a group of people trying to do something fun with our friends. Our aim is to design a world where our customers can come together with their friends and experience their favorite video games firsthand.
We wanted to create a space where friends of different backgrounds can come together and enjoy the game. A place where nerdy friends, athletic friends and gamer friends can all unite to have a good time.

story:
Hello Adventurers, welcome to Gemronimo!

We are a team of unique individuals with a similar dream. The project started with a total of three people as they worked on design and concepts. Later, two developers, a Lead Artist, a Lead Writer, a few concept designers, and another writer joined the team. It has been going at full steam ahead ever since.

All of us are located all over and we share the dream, desire, and passion about Gemronimo. Each of us work hard and hold a strong dedication for the completion of the game.

(wip)

 

Gemronimo is a unique gem-matching mobile game that takes users on an adventure to find the missing hero, Bobby. Travel across Sironica to stop greedy bandits, collect creature companions, and eventually, save the world!

Currently, development is going well and we’re advancing through the design stage as we speak. Testing is expected to start this spring! We encourage you to read over our game summary doc, which can be seen here https://gemronimo.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Gemronimo.pdf, and stick around for the updates!

The team have all donated to Gemronimo in monetary donations and of course time, to help start the process and get us off the ground and in motion. Developers have also chosen to wait for game release to begin taking payments, as they believe in its vision entirely. That’s where we can use your help!

We are looking to raise $6,500.00 to cover the entire project of Gemronimo. Funds will be used to purchase licenses for software, pay artists, music & sound, server & game costs, etc. Anything raised over that amount will go directly back into Gemronimo for future expansions.

Most of our donors will get rewarded for donating with both in-game and out of game merch!

***NOTE THAT SOME REWARDS ARE AFTER GAME RELEASE! LIKE BOOSTER PACKS, VIP TIME, & ENERGY.​ (Be sure to read the lower tiers descriptions that apply to higher tiers)***

**BONUS REWARDS IF YOU PLAY ON RANCH N’ CRAFT**

Some of our team members come from a horse-based Minecraft server called Ranchin’ Craft. The server chat has been running for over 5 years. Some aspects from Ranch n’ Craft have been added into the game; such as stories and characters found in the server.

Users who donate and show proof can even earn some cool Ranch n’ Craft in-game merch! (Turn in proof to MysticTrev, ShiningSolo, or TyshowUri)

***SHIRTS ARE ALL MADE TO ORDER! PLEASE ALLOW TIME FOR PRINTING & SHIPPING!***
