What We Need & What You GetThe cheapest quote I can get to repair the device is $250. If I raise that, they'll restore what they can. However, this thing won't let me ask for less than $500. Extra funds will go towards paying for Steve's mental health and other nice things.If you contribute and the data is saved, you'll get:A copy of my Famous Five RPG the moment it's finishedA free copy of my adorable "Rime Dragons" RPG the moment it's finished (this game will then be on sale for others, but you get it free)Credits in both worksAnything else I can findMy undying gratitude

story:
My name is Wojciech Gal and with my wife Agnieszka Gal we are creating team ZBB Games, based in Malbork, Poland.

I have been active on Polish gaming scene since 2008. Starting in journalism, I've quickly jumped to games review and commentary on YouTube which I continue to this day.

In late 2013 I've decided to go step further and after gathering money, when I was working on immigration in United Kingdom, I was able to mainly focus my energy on gaming programming.  The fruit of my work is Mumbis, game that I want to present to You today.

With a little help from IndieGoGo community we will be able to finish Mumbis on Windows, Mac and Linux, improve audio and visual assets, as well as gather minimum founds to promote our game.

Mumbis is currently in alpha development stage.


Mumbis is a rare combination of board game and action rogue­like. You will be visiting cities, encountering camps and merchant posts, but most importantly you will be travelling the land of Mumbis in your vehicle and camp in wilderness. All of those elements will be randomly generated for each of your new game.

Game­play is mainly focused on survival. In order to succeed in your mission one of your heroes have to destroy Nerh’Zul. That means that you have to learn how to survive on your journey. Scavenge and gather supplies, cure party members, repair your vehicle and improve your equipment. All of these to manage and more for player to discover.

This is just a quick summary of our project. If you wish to learn more about the game please visit our detailed FAQ at Mumbis FAQ, and check out our development blog at ZlyBratBlizniak.pl.






 

We truly believe in this project, and we would like to be able to invest our money in it. Problem that we currently having is very similar to other campaings on IndieGoGo- we are struggling with the current economic state in Poland, and for us funding projects has become more difficult than ever.

This is where IndieGoGo comes into play: we look at it not only as the way to get the resources for Mumbis, but also to spread the word about this project beyond our current reach.  To have the IndieGogo community involved in the creation our project is very helpful and encouraging for us.


The total estimated minimal cost for finishing the development of Mumbis is €2200, but we will fund €768, that's around 1/3 of whole project. We believe in our project and that's a real proof of it. 

The rest €1432 is up to IndieGoGo community. Your contribution will be used to finalize our little rouguelike. Below I present to You pie chart with "things to buy" and summary of costs:


More detailed:
  • GML Modules, are Linux and Mac export modules, as well as YYC- more powerful compiler for programming library in which Mubmis is developed,
  • Audio Assets is audio (music, game sounds, effects and ambient) library that will be used in Mumbis,
  • Visual Assets is graphics and animation library that will be used in our game,
  • Promotion Costs are advertisements, promotional materials and builds, as well as other forms of promotion of Mumbis through internet and media,
  • Minor Costs are all the little costs related to licensing, server costs, testing on various platforms and other unplanned expenses.

If you wish to help us finalize Mumbis, the best way it to choose a perk that is best suited for You and support us.

But if you haven't got the money at the moment, and You still would like to help turn our project into reality, don't worry - you can still help! 

  • You can share our Mumbis IndieGoGo project on Facebook and Twitter, 
  • You can vote for our project on Steam Greenlight
  • You can tell about it to Your friends and colleges,
  • You can contact your favorite YouTube creators and give them a hint about Mumbis.

All of above means a lot and if You have done all of it, You are Awesome! No, seriously- Awesome Person! Thank You!


    As with developing any video game there are a lot of risks and costs involved... But we are 100% confident that ZBB Games will overcome and achieve the goals we set forth.

    1. Release Date- Late 2014: If it would just depend on our two we could release our game in the next few months, but due to Steam Greenlight and others interested publishers we need to plan to deliver our game simultaneously on all hardware platforms, as well as all, available for us, publishing platforms. Therefore late 2014 is the most secure date that we can estimate for now.

    2. Quality: Matching the quality of Mumbis and resolving all found development bugs prior to it's release date. We cannot assure that we will find all of them, before game launch date, but the game will be provided with free of charge patches to do so after the launch.

    3. Distribution: We are currently on Steam Greenlight as many of other developers from IndieGoGo gaming campaigns. Depending on the result of our vote- if we would get approve to publish on Steam, backers will be able to get their activation code for their gaming platform. We cannot assure Steam's approve for publishing, because it not depends on us.

    5. As requested by PayPal: "The delivery of rewards or perks are subject to best efforts and not guaranteed." (We don't foresee this being a problem, but we are required to include it.)


    If you have any questions about Mumbis, our development plan other things linked to our team, don't hesitate to ask:

    Development Blog: ZlyBratBlizniak.pl
    Facebook Page: Mumbis Fan Page
    Twitter: @ZlyBratBlizniak


    Thank You for Your time and have a nice day!

We cannot assure Steam's approve for publishing, because it not depends on us.
5. As requested by PayPal: "The delivery of rewards or perks are subject to best efforts and not guaranteed." (We don't foresee this being a problem, but we are required to include it.)

  

If you have any questions about Mumbis, our development plan other things linked to our team, don't hesitate to ask:
Development Blog: ZlyBratBlizniak.plFacebook Page: Mumbis Fan PageTwitter: @ZlyBratBlizniak

 Thank You for Your time and have a nice day!

story:
Short Summary

Frontier Town is a top-down RPG in which players can take on a multitude of roles within society. Set in the medieval era, players can do jobs such as farming to grow food for the populous, smithing to create new tools to equip the townsfolk, and building residences and workshops in order to encourage specialists to move in, or to sell to other players.


The Idea

The original idea was a singleplayer game with the basic task of gathering enough food to keep your town fed, as well as building and decorating homes for more people to move in to. A simple mockup of this can be found here.



Basic Features

Various roles - Take on the role of your choice and find your place in the world.

  • Blacksmith - Create tools to supply the other workers with.
  • Farmer - Sow seeds and rear animals in order to feed the other townsfolk.
  • Builder - Create houses and workshops, which will encourage others to live and work in the town.
  • Labourer - Lumber wood and mine stone/ores to supply builders and blacksmiths with the resources they need to carry out their jobs.
  • Craftsman - Create furnishings to decorate houses, increasing the chance someone will move in.

NPCs - AI characters who will move into free housing and take on a role within the town, some of whom will barter with the players.

Multiplayer - Build up a thriving town with friends.

Inventory - Carry around items for trading and crafting with


Advanced Features

(note: many of these are just ideas at this stage and may not actually be implemented)

Weapon/tool equip - Equip from your inventory and use them to complete various tasks (such as an axe for cutting trees down).

Wear clothing/armour - Equip different clothing through the inventory with different stats and visuals.

Further roles - More roles available within society.

  • Tailor - Create clothes using wool, linen, and other materials.
  • Hair dresser - Style the hair of villagers and other players.
  • Brewer - Use various plants to brew alcohol.
  • Mayor - Become mayor of your own town. Collect taxes from the people and choose to be fair or corrupt. Balance taxes and the sum of money going towards maintaining and expanding the town in order to create a true paradise, or a source of great wealth.
  • Fisherman - Buy a boat and a rod and get fishing, the bigger the boat the more people can crew it, allowing for other players and npcs to board with you.
  • Architect - Design your own buildings from a set of simple tiles.

More advanced AI - NPCs with jobs will go to work each day and live based on their earnings, which will then affect the overall wealth of the town.

  • Player Relations - NPCs will react differently to the player depending on how well they get on, an NPC who likes you will be more inclined to aid you by loaning you items or completing a task for you. A friend who is a shop keep is more likely to give you a discount.
  • NPC Relations - NPCs who like each other are more likely to buy from each other, to help each other out in times of need, and to gossip.
  • Gossip - Acts the player carries out will become known to the town members if it is witnessed, or if one of them is told.
  • Romance - Court NPCs and win their favour in order to marry.
  • Back Story - A randomized back story for each NPC which will change the way they behave and how they react to situations.

Settle and build your own town - Create a town of your own, and choose to become mayor or appoint someone else (player or NPC). The surroundings of the town will influence what kind of business is best suited to it, and so what class and trade of people it will attract (for example, a town near a large area of water is likely to become a fishing/trading port, whereas one further inland could be a small farming village).

Advanced Inventory - Chests to store items in, weight system.

Trade - Swap items with other players/NPCs.


Technology

The game is being developed using the LÖVE engine, and being written in Lua.

It is being developed primarily for Windows, though LÖVE also supports OS X and Ubuntu, so support for these platforms is also a possibility.


What We Need & What You Get

With partial funding, a basic version of the game will be completed (all of the Basic Features list will be implemented, and maybe a few of the more advanced features) and funds will go towards acquiring other aspects of the game such as art & sound effects.

Complete funding will ensure that a more advanced version of the game is completed (more of the Advanced Features list will be implemented).


Background

I have over four years experience in creating games and mods, and am currently studying game design at university.


Throughout my time developing games I have created many variations of this basic idea, a medieval RPG in which the player takes on a role within society and has the ability to create for themselves.

Much of my experience has been gained through creating game modes for Garry's Mod;

  • Medieval Roleplay - My first game mode, a simple medieval mod built on top of other mods, which gave the player the ability to mine and smith items. The old page for the mod can be found here, though the actual mod no longer works.
  • The Middle Ages - My follow up to the Medieval Roleplay game mode, added more advanced skills such as crafting and alchemy, and a simple inventory.  Experimented with a fantasy theme, as well as NPCs.
  • Garry's Mod Civilizations - Another take on the idea, this time more focused on realism, with pre-designed buildings to construct, and further advancements such as trading, chests, farming and a faction system. A demonstration of game play and features can be seen here.


Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends! Help to spread the campaign. Share this page and the indiedb page here.

Critique and suggestions are more than welcome, please help us make the game better by giving your thoughts here.

story:
UPDATE #5

Your contributions are 100% allocated to the development of NovaScape. Our partner company AppBury, located in San Francisco, is ready to move full steam ahead into the Development Phase of the NovaScape project.
 

Your funds will fuel this final phase of the project which includes the actual coding and graphical design development for the game. With the completion of the previous Design Phase which included the Mock-Up Graphics and Pre-Devleopment graphical assets, the final phase of development is before us.

 

UPDATE #3

$50 - Indiegogo Exclusive T-Shirt

Also included at this Contribution Level:

  • Copy of NovaScape
  • Your Name in the Credits Section
  • Exclusive Info and Update

INTRODUCTION

Let me start off by introducing myself. I am a 22 year old entrepreneur with a young start up company and a passion for the gaming industry. My company 3BrosStudios was started with my long time two best friends. Our goal is to create innovative game titles to keep our video game enthusiasts coming back for more. I need help fundraising money, along with the support of my local community, to get my passion for video games out for the rest of the world to enjoy. 

As of right now NovaScape is in its early design phase with much more work on the horizon. Were ready to move into the Development phase, the only issue is funding. I have been able to get NovaScape this far with family investments along with multiple loans but I need help with this final push. Its time for me to take NovaScape and 3 Bros Studios to the next level and dedicate 100% of my time and energy to this project. I am 75% there and need help with this final push my make my vision a reality.

 

 

 

NovaScape is a mobile phone based video game application, in which the player will control a spaceship using the gyroscope within their phone. The player will tilt their phone from left to right in order to control the side to side flying motion of their spaceship.

The inspiration behind NovaScape came from a very simple game I used to love and play called Cube Runner. The purpose of the game is to achieve a high score based on flying distance, the longer you fly by avoiding the obstacles the more your score would increase.  What I want to do is take Cube Runner to an entirely new level. NovaScape will have the following:

  • Intuitive Gameplay Controls
  • Online Multiplayer
  • Global Leaderboards
  • User Customization
  • iTunes Playlist Connectivity
  • Facebook and GameCenter Integration
  • Push Notifications
  • Achievements
  • Usercard with Lifetime Statistics

  

   <--CUBERUNNER

 

The purpose of the game is to achieve a high score by flying the greatest distance possible while avoiding incoming asteroids and meteors. The longer the player stays alive by avoiding these impacts the more their score will increase and the harder the game play will get. Such increasing difficulties will included; meteor showers, black holes, comet strikes, etc.

If the player crashes into such objects, their health bar will decrease and the Supernova will encroach ever closer. Better watch out! If you mess up too many times you will be engulfed within the fiery abyss to never see the universe and all its splendor again... Or you could just press replay and give it a second shot. Good Luck! Lets see if you got what it takes to NovaScape!

 

 

The "Continuous Runner" Application Model

Right now the mobile market has a few #1 hit  sensation Continuous Runners. Continuous runner games are platform games in which the player character moves forward continuously through a theoretically endless game world. Game controls are limited to making the character jump, attack or perform some other special action.

The object of these games is to get as far as possible before the character dies. Endless running games have found particular success on mobile platforms, which are well-suited to the small set of controls these games require – often limited to a single screen tap for jumping.

Subway Surfer and Temple Run lead the ranks in the #1 most played mobile applications.

 

 

 

-Take NovaScape from Design into the Development phase.

-Finalize iOS Development and move onto All other mobile platforms.

-Create a MultiplayerNovaScape Pro edition with an HD format.

-Finalize and Perfect all Animations.

-Add even More Obstacles to overcome.

-Have NovaScape be a 100% FREE application for all to enjoy.

-Eventually move from mobile devices to PC, Xbox and Playstation!

 

 

 

Once NovaScape loads you will be taken to the main screen. On this main screen your options will be to :

-Play the game

-Learn how to play the game

-Enter the Space Station to choose or upgrade your spaceship

-Check out the Global High Scores

-Edit your Settings ex.(Music, Gyroscope Sensitivity, Sound Effects)

-Connect with Facebook (Share stats, Records and High Scores)

 

 

During the gameplay the player will collect special bonus stars that can be used to purchase upgrades such as:

-New Spaceships

-Ship upgrades:

     *Invincibility

     *Iron core upgrade (less damage taken upon impacts)

     *Increased health bar

     *Modify color of spaceship

 

COLLECTABLE STAR

 

Spaceship Designs

So far I have been able to complete 4 Spaceship designs that will be playable with NovaScape. My goal is to have over 10 completely unique and iconic ship designs! This will be possible if my pledge goals are reached and we progress through the Stretch Goal Graph!

At randomized points throughout the game, a bright shooting star will fly over the ships wing and take a flying position in front of the player. If the player can catch up to the shooting star and collect it, the gameplay will be transitioned into a first person cockpit mode.

Within this cockpit mode the player will press a hyperspace button flashing on the screen in front of them and send them through hyperspace. During this hyperspace boost that will last 10 seconds, the spaceship will fly through a bunch of bonus stars.

 

 

When hyperspace ends, the spaceship will be launched into a new and colorful galaxy.

If the player fails to catch up to the shooing star in a set amount of time, the star will shoot off and you will have to wait until it comes around again. The incentive behind the bonus round is to:

  • Add a bonus score multiplier 
  • Hyperspace to a new galaxy
  • Increase the players score

Within the game, there is the ability to share and log your stats and high scores on Facebook. There will also be a Global Leaderboard and the ability to look up users personal stats via a Usercard.

 

 

Risks and challenges

As we all know designing games is a tough challenging road and full of risks to overcome. I believe that the reward is in watching your users enjoy your hard work that you have spent hours designing, coding and implementing. So far NovaScape has come from my personal investments to fund all of the operations that entail the video game development. I decided to go the Indiegogo route due to the availability of external resources and feedback I can obtain.

There is minimal overhead associated with NovaScape and my start up company 3 Bros Studios, LLC but I plan on expanding and hiring shortly. My passion is to take my visions of video game imaginary and bringing them to reality. This undoubtedly takes resources in the form of money, which at my age are hard to come by. Therefor I have to express my need for help on this project.

I have been working night and day on this game and to get my company afloat. I will stop at nothing to achieve my dreams of running a top notch game development company, not only for mobile devices but for all platforms. That being said, if this campaign fails I will only get up, brush myself off and try again. I will take what I have learned from why I failed and apply the knowledge to a positive future.

The risk associated with this projects bottlenecks to the point of personal investments that if needed I will continue to find a way to make. If needed I'll work two jobs to make this game happen and make sure it is taken the the level of perfection I such desire.

So that is it Indiegogo, that is where you come in to play. Help me make this the next Hit Sensation that the mobile world has yet to set their sights on. Help me get my company off its feet and begin to fly higher and higher to always develop the next "big thing".

Thank you again for reading my story. I hope you have some insight now to who I am and what I am capable of. I will stop at nothing to obtain what I have set out to achieve and I hope you will stop at nothing to help me.

As of right now NovaScape is in its early design phase with much more work on the horizon. Were ready to move into the Development phase, the only issue is funding. I have been able to get NovaScape this far with family investments along with multiple loans but I need help with this final push. Its time for me to take NovaScape and 3 Bros Studios to the next level and dedicate 100% of my time and energy to this project. I am 75% there and need help with this final push my make my vision a reality.
 

 

 
NovaScape is a mobile phone based video game application, in which the player will control a spaceship using the gyroscope within their phone. The player will tilt their phone from left to right in order to control the side to side flying motion of their spaceship.
The inspiration behind NovaScape came from a very simple game I used to love and play called Cube Runner. The purpose of the game is to achieve a high score based on flying distance, the longer you fly by avoiding the obstacles the more your score would increase.  What I want to do is take Cube Runner to an entirely new level. NovaScape will have the following:

Intuitive Gameplay Controls
Online Multiplayer
Global Leaderboards
User Customization
iTunes Playlist Connectivity
Facebook and GameCenter Integration
Push Notifications
Achievements
Usercard with Lifetime Statistics

  

   <--CUBERUNNER
 
The purpose of the game is to achieve a high score by flying the greatest distance possible while avoiding incoming asteroids and meteors. The longer the player stays alive by avoiding these impacts the more their score will increase and the harder the game play will get. Such increasing difficulties will included; meteor showers, black holes, comet strikes, etc.
If the player crashes into such objects, their health bar will decrease and the Supernova will encroach ever closer. Better watch out! If you mess up too many times you will be engulfed within the fiery abyss to never see the universe and all its splendor again... Or you could just press replay and give it a second shot. Good Luck! Lets see if you got what it takes to NovaScape!
 

 
The "Continuous Runner" Application Model
Right now the mobile market has a few #1 hit  sensation Continuous Runners. Continuous runner games are platform games in which the player character moves forward continuously through a theoretically endless game world. Game controls are limited to making the character jump, attack or perform some other special action.
The object of these games is to get as far as possible before the character dies. Endless running games have found particular success on mobile platforms, which are well-suited to the small set of controls these games require – often limited to a single screen tap for jumping.
Subway Surfer and Temple Run lead the ranks in the #1 most played mobile applications.
 

 

 



-Take NovaScape from Design into the Development phase.
-Finalize iOS Development and move onto All other mobile platforms.
-Create a MultiplayerNovaScape Pro edition with an HD format.
-Finalize and Perfect all Animations.
-Add even More Obstacles to overcome.
-Have NovaScape be a 100% FREE application for all to enjoy.
-Eventually move from mobile devices to PC, Xbox and Playstation!
 

 

 
Once NovaScape loads you will be taken to the main screen. On this main screen your options will be to :
-Play the game
-Learn how to play the game
-Enter the Space Station to choose or upgrade your spaceship
-Check out the Global High Scores
-Edit your Settings ex.(Music, Gyroscope Sensitivity, Sound Effects)
-Connect with Facebook (Share stats, Records and High Scores)
 




 
During the gameplay the player will collect special bonus stars that can be used to purchase upgrades such as:
-New Spaceships
-Ship upgrades:
     *Invincibility 
     *Iron core upgrade (less damage taken upon impacts)
     *Increased health bar
     *Modify color of spaceship
 
COLLECTABLE STAR


 
Spaceship Designs
So far I have been able to complete 4 Spaceship designs that will be playable with NovaScape. My goal is to have over 10 completely unique and iconic ship designs! This will be possible if my pledge goals are reached and we progress through the Stretch Goal Graph!





At randomized points throughout the game, a bright shooting star will fly over the ships wing and take a flying position in front of the player. If the player can catch up to the shooting star and collect it, the gameplay will be transitioned into a first person cockpit mode.
Within this cockpit mode the player will press a hyperspace button flashing on the screen in front of them and send them through hyperspace. During this hyperspace boost that will last 10 seconds, the spaceship will fly through a bunch of bonus stars.
 



 
When hyperspace ends, the spaceship will be launched into a new and colorful galaxy.
If the player fails to catch up to the shooing star in a set amount of time, the star will shoot off and you will have to wait until it comes around again. The incentive behind the bonus round is to:

Add a bonus score multiplier 

Hyperspace to a new galaxy

Increase the players score



Within the game, there is the ability to share and log your stats and high scores on Facebook. There will also be a Global Leaderboard and the ability to look up users personal stats via a Usercard.
 



 

Risks and challenges
As we all know designing games is a tough challenging road and full of risks to overcome. I believe that the reward is in watching your users enjoy your hard work that you have spent hours designing, coding and implementing. So far NovaScape has come from my personal investments to fund all of the operations that entail the video game development. I decided to go the Indiegogo route due to the availability of external resources and feedback I can obtain.
There is minimal overhead associated with NovaScape and my start up company 3 Bros Studios, LLC but I plan on expanding and hiring shortly. My passion is to take my visions of video game imaginary and bringing them to reality. This undoubtedly takes resources in the form of money, which at my age are hard to come by. Therefor I have to express my need for help on this project.
I have been working night and day on this game and to get my company afloat. I will stop at nothing to achieve my dreams of running a top notch game development company, not only for mobile devices but for all platforms. That being said, if this campaign fails I will only get up, brush myself off and try again. I will take what I have learned from why I failed and apply the knowledge to a positive future.
The risk associated with this projects bottlenecks to the point of personal investments that if needed I will continue to find a way to make. If needed I'll work two jobs to make this game happen and make sure it is taken the the level of perfection I such desire.
So that is it Indiegogo, that is where you come in to play. Help me make this the next Hit Sensation that the mobile world has yet to set their sights on. Help me get my company off its feet and begin to fly higher and higher to always develop the next "big thing".
Thank you again for reading my story. I hope you have some insight now to who I am and what I am capable of. I will stop at nothing to obtain what I have set out to achieve and I hope you will stop at nothing to help me.

story: qwr
story_txt: qwr

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Try the beta version of the game now

Windows

Mac OS X

Linux

Android

Web (Unity WebPlayer / Flash Player)

No iOS version because of Apple policy of no beta versions :(

We will create & release additional 4 levels for everyone to play for every 500$ collected. Current beta version has 15 levels.

So even if we don't reach the goal everyone gets to play some new fun and tricky levels :)

Tiny Lab Productions

We are a small game dev studio from Lithuania, Eastern Europe. Our workplace is located at StartupSpace - the place for young creative people to start their own companies. We love to create games and every happy player makes us more and more excited. We rounded up about 4 years ago and started working as a team on our first project "Nebula44". Right now we are creating a new game called Orborun.

 

While we have a cool team and great ideas it is hard for us to concentrate on game development because of our limited resources. Our goal is to make Orborun into really addictive and enjoyable game. We ask you to take part in this process by supporting us and spreading the word about the upcoming game to your friends.

What to expect? When is the next version coming?

We need some funding so that we could fully concentrate on development of Orborun. We would like to spend all our time on creating awesome content for it, however due to lack of resources we cannot do that.


As we have promised, we will create and unlock 4 levels for every 500$ collected. If we reach 45 levels we will build an iOS version and add it to the Apple store as well.

Help Orborun without donating

Tell your friends, family or foes about this campaign. Announce about the upcoming game and encourage them to try the beta version.

Share this campaign using the IndieGoGo social tools, your favorite social media platforms, or just by linking to it on forums!

Final words

Please do not hesitate and leave your questions and comments, we'll try to answer to them all!

Thanks!

story:
Hello Everyone,

My name is Milly Beddall. I am 24 years old and I live in London. I am currently working for Aston Martin as there showroom host. I have been lucky enough to be a reasonably good skier, It is something I love, my family also love it and annoyingly for me are a lot better than I am!

I am so honoured to have been accepted as part of the Skiing With Heroes team as a buddy, It is through my boyfriend Tom that I intially heard about this extraordinary charity.

For those of you that have been skiing you will know the feeling is like nothing else. It gives you a sense of freedom like no other- the fresh air and scenery gives you a new lease of life.  The fact that this can be given back to wounded ex-soldiers who may have thought they would never get the chance to ski or do any sort of sport again is just such a great thing. 

This is a chance to give people that have fought for their country something in return. Skiing can help with rehabilitation both physically and mentally.  They can start building up core muscle strength and use muscles they wouldn't otherwise be able to use. The outdoors and fresh air is good for their health and will hopefully make a difference to how they feel at the end of the trip.

Being a ski buddy will be an amazing opportunity to make the ex-soldiers time as fun and enjoyable as possible. We will have to be enthusiastic and energetic at all times- I am hoping to keep a smile on everyone's faces.

If I could go to Kloster's knowing I had raised the amount of money I am hoping to I think the trip will be perfect. As this is a relatively new chairty I would like to aim high to get a good start to the fundraising for 2013.

http://www.skiingwithheroes.com/#homehr Please have a look at the website to understand more about Skiing With Heroes.

What We Need & What You Get

If you have been on a skiing trip you will know the extreme costs that go into it!

We have been asked to raise £750.00 each to cover flights, ski hire and ski passes.

Accomodation will be through contacts that the chairty has out in Klosters- We have been asked to give a small donation to whoemever we stay with. I imagine about £100 each will suffice. 

Tom and I would also like to buy gifts so at the end of the trip supper we can give out prizes so everyone has something to take away with them.

We also need to pay for our food- lunches and suppers when we are out there.  I don't mind paying for the majority of this but it would be nice to have a small amount of extra money for the ocassional spagetti bolognaise if any of the ex-soldiers feel like it!

I would like to offer for anyone that donates:

£10 or under- A personal thank you email and updates of the trip

£30 or under- A written letter and some photographs of the trip after we have returned.

£50 or under-An Aston Martin Iphone case, a written letter and some photos after the rip.

£100 under or more- And Aston Martin Iphone case, magazine and poster, a written letter and some photos after the trip.

If there is anything specific you think would be nice to see or hear about from the week then I am open to ideas as well.

Thank you.

Apologies about the £2 perks below- The system seemed to crash on me and wouldn't allow me to delete the unwanted boxes!

The Impact

I really believe that this could change the lives of some people who might have thought nothing good was coming their way in 2013.

It is a way of showing that help is out there and they are not alone in their injuries. I think it is a great way of demonstrating how far chairities have come in being able to help give something back.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you have read this and it is something you feel is worth talking about then please spread the word.

Post the website on facebook or follow them on twitter @Skiing_Heroes. Tell your friends and family.

Any help is much appreciated.

http://www.skiingwithheroes.com/#herohr

Thank you all so much for reading this and hopefully sponsoring Tom and I.

Love,

Milly and Tom

story:
In 2010, I wrote a book that was not supposed to be taken seriously. It was a humorous but educational self defense book about bar fighting. 

7 years later, we are about to launch a game that will redefine the term "Nightlife" combining bar fights, beer pong, boozing and much more!

story:
Update 2/27, Day 27

We are down to just under 3 days left in the campaign and while it looks unlikely that we will reach our goal, you can still help us finish strong.  We have decided that everyone who contributes to this campaign will automatically be bumped up a reward tier in regard to the digital content and in game credit.  There is still time to get the word out about this game and what we are trying to do for mobile games in general, so please help us in whatever ways you can!

Update 2/25, Day 25

We have uploaded a new video showing the successful testing of importing an animated character into the game engine.  With the engine being on the newer side it took some effort, but our talented team was able to sort through it.  Take a look here.

Update 2/22, Day 22

We have just over a week to go, and we are still hoping to get closer to our goal.  We have uploaded another video, showing the animation of one of our models, Barnubus no less, from the game engine.  Please check it out here.

Also, just to reiterate the fact that this will not be more of the same for mobile, here are a few highlights.

  • Airship Downs will allow up to three games to be played at the same time using our player network
  • It will be extremely replayable, and will allow players to add more of the optional features as they learn how to play
  • The amount of content and features included will easily make this game worthy of a PC title, but we want to bring it to mobile devices

This truly will not be more of the same, so if you want to see more game brought to your mobile devices, please support us today!

Update 2/15, Day 15

We are halfway through the campaign, and haven't quite reached it to the halfway mark yet, but that's OK!  We know that mobile video game players are ready for more game than what is currently out there, and we are still making headway on the project. 

We have chosen the option on our campaign, which will allow us to recieve most of the funds collected, REGARDLESS of whether or not we make the goal.  Every dollar will help us out folks, so please help us by contributing or spreading the word.

The time for a mobile video game revolution will soon be upon us, and you can be a part of that now!!

Update 2/8, Day 9

We have uploaded some footage from the city building portion of the game.  We are now working on the UI, so should have something cleaner within a week or so.  Also, don't be discouraged by the goal amoun, every little bit will help us get to the next stage of funding. 

Update 2/6, Day 7

Don't give up on us yet folks, because we haven't given up on you!  We are working on getting some gameplay footage up within the next day, so stay tuned.  And don't forget that we have a forum on our site that you can use to ask questions. 

Update 2/2, Day 3

Added "What we need, and where we are" section during the closing.

Update 2/1, Day 2

Added gameplay section to clarify gameplay and differences compared to current mobile city builders.

A BIG SHOUT OUT!! to those of you who have already contributed.  We greatly appreciate it!!

Here is a compilation from our audio team to listen to while you read.

Also, please check the quick links section at the bottom of the page for more information.

Introduction

Welcome to our Indiegogo.com campaign! We are EVV Games, a group of indie developers with a passion for games that want to expand the frontier of mobile gaming. This campaign started with our disappointment with the quality of Free-to-Play titles on the mobile market. To change that, we are working fervently on Airship Downs to bring you an innovative and quality-packed title that is geared around delivering gameplay. One of our goals is to bring Freedom to Free-to-Play. You will be able to enjoy an un-crippled Airship Downs experience without spending a penny.

We are committed to communicating with you and taking your input in to full account as development progresses. For this, we are integrating an extensive player network at our site www.airshipdowns.com. Please, reach out to us with your suggestions and concerns where your opinion can and will make a difference.

By supporting our campaign, you can help us develop our unique title to the fullest of its potential and deliver it as soon as possible, which is currently set for August, '13. We are confident that Airship Downs can not only push the limits of mobile gaming, but of city-building simulators as a whole. Along with release on iOS and Android mobile devices, we are also expanding Airship Downs to other platforms including the Ouya and web browser.

 

Types of play

Single Player

The single player mode will be what you spend the majority of your time with. The main part of this will be the city building. This portion will start you with a cache of stores, and you will start off with building housing and resource collectors to begin building the city.

Each building will have its own storage. The food will essentially be stored as a whole, and will feed the city based on the demand. This will essentially be gathered and parsed out in the background automatically.

The populace will gather food after building and occupying farms, fisheries, and hunting grounds and it will sustain the population. Initially, you start with four people in the population, one Player Character (PC) and three Non-Player Characters (NPCs). These people will all need housing in order to be able to be assigned to buildings. Once the housing is built for all four characters, they will occupy the initial buildings. From here you will be able to utilize the resources and begin creating your city!

The combat that takes place in the quest line and in the main game will be determined by whether you have selected the extended combat mode to be enabled. If not, you will still have all the standard battle capabilities; however, there will be some changes. You will have no military to maintain and will only receive units on an as needed basis with the option to auto-play the combat. At the end of battles you will receive rewards of gold, xp, crafting items, and more.

Cooperative

You will be able to build a cooperative network with your contacts which will allow you to take advantage of several features. You will be able to interact with each others cities by assisting your contact in collecting rewards and reloading shop recipes. In addition, you will be provided with standard and premium currency that you can send to your player network contacts. Interaction with your contacts will also be streamlined and user-friendly within the network.

If the extended combat is enabled, the cooperative mode will allow two players to join one screen, with one maintaining control, and the other viewing. Once a battle is engaged, the standard battle screen will pop up, and each player will be given a turn to place their units and enjoy the tactical gameplay together.

Player vs. Player

PvP will also be available if the extended combat is enabled. The rewards from combat will be in the form of a point system, and you will be able to accrue these points in order to purchase rewards specific to the extended combat mode.

Player Network

The player network will allow you to have access to an initial three game slots (which can be expanded), which you can use to store different game saves. This data will be accessible from whichever platform you decide to play the game on at any time.

Another beneficial feature included with your network will be a purchase tracking and reward system. Any players who decide to purchase premium content will not be overlooked. We will have a tiered discount system to reward those who spend on the title.

 

Gameplay

First, Airship Downs will include some of the standard gameplay that has always existed in city builders, as well as some of the newer good features. You will gather resources from the resource collectors, and these will be used to build your buildings and fuel your shops. The shops will make items, based on timed recipes, and return rewards in the form of coins and experience. The gold will help you purchase more items, such as decorations and building upgrades, and the experience will help you gain levels. As you gain levels, you will unlock new buildings, enhancements, decorations, and more.

There will also be the “Creature Keeper” element, in the form of city Automatons. One of the special buildings will be the Automaton Workshop, which will take resources and coin to produce an Automaton. There will be at least three levels of rarity that can be produced with one recipe, and the resulting automaton will affect the city as a whole, a building that it occupies, or both.

Some of the differences will start in how you can setup your game. There will be many optional gameplay elements available to you as you learn more about the game, or for more experienced gamers. Once you join the player network, you will be given three game slots to play from and save to, so you will be able to have multiple different gameplay setups. The optional elements will be the technology web/pyramid and turn-based strategic combat. If you select the optional combat you will be able to opt for the dungeon crawling element and the “Death” mode, which will be a more difficult all or nothing style of play.

Our premium currency system will be generous in comparison to those from some developers, and more along the lines of what has traditionally been done. For example, most buildings will have a premium version which will produce rewards better than the normal version. Once a new version of this buidling, let's say a metal shop, is available, this upgraded metal shop will have rewards at least as good as the previous premium version of the metal shop. In order to make sure that you don't feel slighted by this new building, you will be able to downgrade the previous premium version of the metal shop back into the normal one. When downgrading, you will receive a percentage of your premium currency back, and then be able to upgrade to the newer and better normal metal shop, using standard currency. Of course you will also have the option to upgrade to the new premium version, at a discounted rate. The items and features available through premium currency will essentially save you some time, but will not effect the gameplay to an extensive degree.

The city that you will be able to create in Airship Downs will truly be a reflection of how you want to play the game. This will be done through what you can build in your city. There will be a wealth of decorations that can be used to either enhance other buildings or just make your city look the way you want it to. There will also be a class of buildings that will allow you to create landmarks for your achievements, which will enhance large parts of your city or produce currency and/or experience. The shops themselves will be a way to define the way you want your city to work. The three main resources used to supply your shops will be metals, wood, and stone. Each of these three shop types will give rewards, which will be either balanced, currency favored, or experience favored. The shops will also be able to be modified, in order to fine tune the rewards. Along with the decorations that will be available to enhance your shops, you will truly be able to build your city exactly how you want it. In addition, all buildings will be able to be upgraded in order to keep up with your level advancement.

One of the best optional features will be the technology web or pyramid. This is going to be entirely different from the static and linear technology tree, which was awesome in it's day, but we feel it is time for something a little more dynamic. This tech web will essentially consist of four different main specialties, which will be arms, ciphering, cultivation, and mechanization. Arms will center around hand tools and items that will increase efficiency on an individual scale, and mechanization will be it's opposite, increasing efficiency in a broader sense.

Of course, they will also have effects for the military players, which will coincide with the obvious purposes. The cultivation discipline will allow you to concentrate on the cultivation of both food and xp, while the ciphering path will grant better savvy with gold from the various possible income sources and the resource market. Each of these disciplines will also be connected to each of the other three, which will provide paths for them to come together. These will become more of a combination between the first two and will then work inward toward the other two.



A good way to visualize this is to draw a square and connect the diagonals. Then picture one diagonal creating a triangular base with the two connected sides, and the remaining lines form into the apex of a triangular pyramid. Once you see this, you will see the four triangular faces of the pyramid, which will allow all four disciplines to connect to each other equally. Hopefully this helps to explain why this will be the tech "web".

The learning on this will consist of being able to spend points in each of the technologies you want for your city, with these points being earned every time your city gains a level. You will be able to spend multiple points in the technologies, with the only limitation being that you will need a certain amount of points (starting with just one for the edge skills) in a connecting technology. As you work inward, you will need a higher level of points the further you go. Another limiting factor will be that you will never be able to learn everything in the pyramid, which will mean that you will have to decide a path. This will also allow you to start another city and explore the avenues that you think will work the best.

The optional combat will also help to further define this game as unique. While you are in your city, or traveling to other areas via the overhead map, you will find “hotspots” that have enemies ready to be engaged. Once you engage them, you will place your units on the grid, and then engage the enemy. You will be able to use each of your units as they are available, so will conceivable be able to use more than one unit per turn. The grid will be a square “star” grid, so it will allow for 8 directions of aiming and movement, but will also allow for some units to be larger than just one square.

If you do not choose the optional combat, you will still be able to engage enemies, you will just have your units provided on an as needed basis. You will also have the option to “auto-battle” so you can just watch the AI determine the outcome while you watch.

What we need, and where we are

Essentially, you will help us bring this team together, and from a group of 12 volunteers, a professional game development company will be formed.  The LLC Ex Vortex Vita has already been formed in Monroe, GA, and is the entity that will be receiving these funds.  The funds received here will allow everyone on this team to work at least full-time on this game for at least a couple of months.  We will also utilize some of the funding to enhance our team by hiring professional consults in a few areas that we are still weak in.  Another part of the funding, about $3k-$5k, will allow our founder to fly around and seek further funding from investors.  It will also allow us to purchase the software licenses that we need.  You can help EVV Games become a true force in the Indie Game Developer industry, and we will then bring this spectacular title to your mobile devices.

We are currently in the prototyping stage of development.  We have been building our asset pool (in-game items/objects), and building the framework within the game engine.  If you care to check out the engine we are using, it is Shiva 3D.  We already have the main storyline well established, a first completion of the game design document, and are now working on more models for the buildings and the UI design.  We know you will like this game, so we will make this happen.

 

The Impact

For whatever reason, some developers think you are content with the stagnant, unoriginal state of the industry. By contributing to our campaign, you will be doing more than helping a single game and studio.  A contribution to this game is a contribution to the revolution in the air, to break the monopoly that major publishers have and give people the games they want. Even if you can't contribute, or haven't decided to yet, please help us get the word about this project out.  Chances are you or someone you knows plays a mobile video game or two, and anyone who has played any knows how much pressure is made to spend money on those games.  Help us do away with this common practice!  Thank you so much for your time to read this and hear us out, and we look forward to seeing you on the site!

 

Quick Links

More Information on the Team.

Some more on the game.

The tutorial storyline.

This stage of funding.

Forum for any questions regarding this campaign, OR

E-mail us with any questions.
story_txt:
Update 2/27, Day 27
We are down to just under 3 days left in the campaign and while it looks unlikely that we will reach our goal, you can still help us finish strong.  We have decided that everyone who contributes to this campaign will automatically be bumped up a reward tier in regard to the digital content and in game credit.  There is still time to get the word out about this game and what we are trying to do for mobile games in general, so please help us in whatever ways you can!
Update 2/25, Day 25
We have uploaded a new video showing the successful testing of importing an animated character into the game engine.  With the engine being on the newer side it took some effort, but our talented team was able to sort through it.  Take a look here.
Update 2/22, Day 22
We have just over a week to go, and we are still hoping to get closer to our goal.  We have uploaded another video, showing the animation of one of our models, Barnubus no less, from the game engine.  Please check it out here.
Also, just to reiterate the fact that this will not be more of the same for mobile, here are a few highlights.

Airship Downs will allow up to three games to be played at the same time using our player network
It will be extremely replayable, and will allow players to add more of the optional features as they learn how to play
The amount of content and features included will easily make this game worthy of a PC title, but we want to bring it to mobile devices
This truly will not be more of the same, so if you want to see more game brought to your mobile devices, please support us today!
Update 2/15, Day 15
We are halfway through the campaign, and haven't quite reached it to the halfway mark yet, but that's OK!  We know that mobile video game players are ready for more game than what is currently out there, and we are still making headway on the project. 
We have chosen the option on our campaign, which will allow us to recieve most of the funds collected, REGARDLESS of whether or not we make the goal.  Every dollar will help us out folks, so please help us by contributing or spreading the word.
The time for a mobile video game revolution will soon be upon us, and you can be a part of that now!!
Update 2/8, Day 9
We have uploaded some footage from the city building portion of the game.  We are now working on the UI, so should have something cleaner within a week or so.  Also, don't be discouraged by the goal amoun, every little bit will help us get to the next stage of funding. 
Update 2/6, Day 7
Don't give up on us yet folks, because we haven't given up on you!  We are working on getting some gameplay footage up within the next day, so stay tuned.  And don't forget that we have a forum on our site that you can use to ask questions. 
Update 2/2, Day 3
Added "What we need, and where we are" section during the closing.
Update 2/1, Day 2
Added gameplay section to clarify gameplay and differences compared to current mobile city builders.
A BIG SHOUT OUT!! to those of you who have already contributed.  We greatly appreciate it!!
Here is a compilation from our audio team to listen to while you read.
Also, please check the quick links section at the bottom of the page for more information.
Introduction
Welcome to our Indiegogo.com campaign! We are EVV Games, a group of indie developers with a passion for games that want to expand the frontier of mobile gaming. This campaign started with our disappointment with the quality of Free-to-Play titles on the mobile market. To change that, we are working fervently on Airship Downs to bring you an innovative and quality-packed title that is geared around delivering gameplay. One of our goals is to bring Freedom to Free-to-Play. You will be able to enjoy an un-crippled Airship Downs experience without spending a penny.
We are committed to communicating with you and taking your input in to full account as development progresses. For this, we are integrating an extensive player network at our site www.airshipdowns.com. Please, reach out to us with your suggestions and concerns where your opinion can and will make a difference.
By supporting our campaign, you can help us develop our unique title to the fullest of its potential and deliver it as soon as possible, which is currently set for August, '13. We are confident that Airship Downs can not only push the limits of mobile gaming, but of city-building simulators as a whole. Along with release on iOS and Android mobile devices, we are also expanding Airship Downs to other platforms including the Ouya and web browser.
 
Types of play
Single Player
The single player mode will be what you spend the majority of your time with. The main part of this will be the city building. This portion will start you with a cache of stores, and you will start off with building housing and resource collectors to begin building the city.
Each building will have its own storage. The food will essentially be stored as a whole, and will feed the city based on the demand. This will essentially be gathered and parsed out in the background automatically.
The populace will gather food after building and occupying farms, fisheries, and hunting grounds and it will sustain the population. Initially, you start with four people in the population, one Player Character (PC) and three Non-Player Characters (NPCs). These people will all need housing in order to be able to be assigned to buildings. Once the housing is built for all four characters, they will occupy the initial buildings. From here you will be able to utilize the resources and begin creating your city!
The combat that takes place in the quest line and in the main game will be determined by whether you have selected the extended combat mode to be enabled. If not, you will still have all the standard battle capabilities; however, there will be some changes. You will have no military to maintain and will only receive units on an as needed basis with the option to auto-play the combat. At the end of battles you will receive rewards of gold, xp, crafting items, and more.

Cooperative
You will be able to build a cooperative network with your contacts which will allow you to take advantage of several features. You will be able to interact with each others cities by assisting your contact in collecting rewards and reloading shop recipes. In addition, you will be provided with standard and premium currency that you can send to your player network contacts. Interaction with your contacts will also be streamlined and user-friendly within the network.
If the extended combat is enabled, the cooperative mode will allow two players to join one screen, with one maintaining control, and the other viewing. Once a battle is engaged, the standard battle screen will pop up, and each player will be given a turn to place their units and enjoy the tactical gameplay together.
Player vs. Player
PvP will also be available if the extended combat is enabled. The rewards from combat will be in the form of a point system, and you will be able to accrue these points in order to purchase rewards specific to the extended combat mode.
Player Network
The player network will allow you to have access to an initial three game slots (which can be expanded), which you can use to store different game saves. This data will be accessible from whichever platform you decide to play the game on at any time.
Another beneficial feature included with your network will be a purchase tracking and reward system. Any players who decide to purchase premium content will not be overlooked. We will have a tiered discount system to reward those who spend on the title.
 
Gameplay
First, Airship Downs will include some of the standard gameplay that has always existed in city builders, as well as some of the newer good features. You will gather resources from the resource collectors, and these will be used to build your buildings and fuel your shops. The shops will make items, based on timed recipes, and return rewards in the form of coins and experience. The gold will help you purchase more items, such as decorations and building upgrades, and the experience will help you gain levels. As you gain levels, you will unlock new buildings, enhancements, decorations, and more.
There will also be the “Creature Keeper” element, in the form of city Automatons. One of the special buildings will be the Automaton Workshop, which will take resources and coin to produce an Automaton. There will be at least three levels of rarity that can be produced with one recipe, and the resulting automaton will affect the city as a whole, a building that it occupies, or both.
Some of the differences will start in how you can setup your game. There will be many optional gameplay elements available to you as you learn more about the game, or for more experienced gamers. Once you join the player network, you will be given three game slots to play from and save to, so you will be able to have multiple different gameplay setups. The optional elements will be the technology web/pyramid and turn-based strategic combat. If you select the optional combat you will be able to opt for the dungeon crawling element and the “Death” mode, which will be a more difficult all or nothing style of play.
Our premium currency system will be generous in comparison to those from some developers, and more along the lines of what has traditionally been done. For example, most buildings will have a premium version which will produce rewards better than the normal version. Once a new version of this buidling, let's say a metal shop, is available, this upgraded metal shop will have rewards at least as good as the previous premium version of the metal shop. In order to make sure that you don't feel slighted by this new building, you will be able to downgrade the previous premium version of the metal shop back into the normal one. When downgrading, you will receive a percentage of your premium currency back, and then be able to upgrade to the newer and better normal metal shop, using standard currency. Of course you will also have the option to upgrade to the new premium version, at a discounted rate. The items and features available through premium currency will essentially save you some time, but will not effect the gameplay to an extensive degree.

The shops themselves will be a way to define the way you want your city to work. The three main resources used to supply your shops will be metals, wood, and stone. Each of these three shop types will give rewards, which will be either balanced, currency favored, or experience favored. The shops will also be able to be modified, in order to fine tune the rewards. Along with the decorations that will be available to enhance your shops, you will truly be able to build your city exactly how you want it. In addition, all buildings will be able to be upgraded in order to keep up with your level advancement.
One of the best optional features will be the technology web or pyramid. This is going to be entirely different from the static and linear technology tree, which was awesome in it's day, but we feel it is time for something a little more dynamic. This tech web will essentially consist of four different main specialties, which will be arms, ciphering, cultivation, and mechanization. Arms will center around hand tools and items that will increase efficiency on an individual scale, and mechanization will be it's opposite, increasing efficiency in a broader sense.Of course, they will also have effects for the military players, which will coincide with the obvious purposes. Once you see this, you will see the four triangular faces of the pyramid, which will allow all four disciplines to connect to each other equally. Hopefully this helps to explain why this will be the tech "web".The learning on this will consist of being able to spend points in each of the technologies you want for your city, with these points being earned every time your city gains a level. The optional combat will also help to further define this game as unique. While you are in your city, or traveling to other areas via the overhead map, you will find “hotspots” that have enemies ready to be engaged. Once you engage them, you will place your units on the grid, and then engage the enemy. You will be able to use each of your units as they are available, so will conceivable be able to use more than one unit per turn. The grid will be a square “star” grid, so it will allow for 8 directions of aiming and movement, but will also allow for some units to be larger than just one square.
If you do not choose the optional combat, you will still be able to engage enemies, you will just have your units provided on an as needed basis. You will also have the option to “auto-battle” so you can just watch the AI determine the outcome while you watch.
What we need, and where we are

We are currently in the prototyping stage of development.  We have been building our asset pool (in-game items/objects), and building the framework within the game engine.  If you care to check out the engine we are using, it is Shiva 3D.  We already have the main storyline well established, a first completion of the game design document, and are now working on more models for the buildings and the UI design.  We know you will like this game, so we will make this happen.
 
The Impact
For whatever reason, some developers think you are content with the stagnant, unoriginal state of the industry. By contributing to our campaign, you will be doing more than helping a single game and studio.  A contribution to this game is a contribution to the revolution in the air, to break the monopoly that major publishers have and give people the games they want. Even if you can't contribute, or haven't decided to yet, please help us get the word about this project out.  Chances are you or someone you knows plays a mobile video game or two, and anyone who has played any knows how much pressure is made to spend money on those games.  Help us do away with this common practice!  Thank you so much for your time to read this and hear us out, and we look forward to seeing you on the site!

story:
About us:

My name is Charles, also known as Vellusian. I'm the owner and administrator of a small, 20-person Minecraft bukkit server. We've been operational for over ten months now and it's starting to show. Our worlds and plugins have expanded over the months to the point that my locally hosted server cannot keep up with demand. It's our hope to raise enough money to get a box dedicated to the server that has more processing power and RAM to feed our growing needs.

Here's the plan:

Here's how I'm planning on on spending the money if we manage to reach our goals.

Of the $500 of the starting goal, ~$40 will be expenses of the campaign, since the platform takes a cut. 

My current build that I have in mind is in the link below.

http://secure.newegg.com/WishList/PublicWishDetail.aspx?WishListNumber=23239652

If we manage to surpass our goal, I have several stretch goals in mind.

For $150 more ($650) total, I'll double the total RAM making a server with 32 GB.

At $750, I'll switch to a Phenom chip with a higher cache and the case/power supply will be swapped out with one with more fans and watts.

At $850, I'll look into getting a higher performance modem to see if opening up that choke will decrease latency and any dropped packets.

If we go higher than that, I'll have to come up with something else. We can make this happen!

In exchange:

I promise that the resulting machine will be used for the server and related tasks.
For your donation, as shown elsewhere on this page, we will build a Donor's Hall, with your name immortalized in the Overworld of the server.
Every level of donation gets credits to use in a planned in-game shop. These can also be obtained from in-game tasks.
At the Gold level, you have the option to append [VIP] as an additional suffix to your name. This tag is updated to [Elite] for an Emerald level donation. These tags are optional.
Curated nicknames are available with a Diamond level or higher donation. These nicknames are changed by server staff and cannot create confusion between players (i.e. using a name similar to another player's or appearing in staff colors). These are limited in change, likely once a week, to enable staff members to play and deal with other situations.

What this means:

Quite simply, this expansion should reduce server lag, potentially allowing us to turn up the number of active chunks, increase our player cap, as well as enable further growth.
As the server administrator, I can confirm that the simple process of running the server takes all of the resources I can provide to it. We're limited to 1 GB of memory and 1 core of my processor; both of which are at max most of the time. I've slimmed down what I can without affecting gameplay, but we're running at what I'd consider the core of our server.

Can't donate, but want to help:

We're happy if you share the server with your friends and online communities. We're always looking for new, good players and look forward to welcoming them into our community.

story:
Welcome to the QuizComp Indiegogo Campaign!

QuizComp is set to be the first competitive quiz/trivia app that will support thousands of players competing in real-time quizzes around the globe and will include a variety of interactive question formats. Compete against players across the globe, against people of your league/level, and even contribute to your country's progress at the same time!

We are very excited about this app and have already put it through a scoping and prototyping phase with one of Australia's top app development companies, where we worked to refine the idea and plan the development phase. We also produced a prototype which top contributors will be able to view and discuss with us, including the full list of features that aren't disclosed here in the interests of IP protection. We are now inviting you to help this app reach its full potential during the development phase.

Our founder is currently completing his PhD and has always loved puzzles and quizzes of all kinds. However, when looking at all the quiz apps currently available on the market, we were disappointed to see that all the apps were lacking in various areas:

The problems we found with currently available quiz apps:

  1. They use outdated and obscure questions.
  2. They do not have a realistic competitive feel.
  3. They don't offer any reason to complete the quiz i.e. no sense of achievement, competition, leveling etc.
  4. They are all single format questions e.g. the typical multiple choice trivia question with four options.
  5. The questions are not interactive i.e. just press the answer and lock it in.
  6. The apps that do have leaderboards require you to complete hundreds of quizzes to reach the top and require the download of third party software.

Seeing all of these shortcomings, we saw the opportunity to develop an ultimate quiz experience for casual gamers and hardcore quiz fans alike.

In particular, we are producing an entirely new up-to-date question database for the game, rather than simply purchasing an outdated database and this will include interactive questions of a variety of different formats. Follow our Facebook and Twitter pages to keep up to date and answer daily questions until the game is released!


Development Costs

During the scoping and prototyping phase, an estimate of $40,000AUD was reached for an iOS (iPhone) build of this app. This is what has been estimated in order to achieve a world-class level app, including all of the core features. After all, nobody wants an app that is barely functional. This campaign has been listed at $45,000AUD to allow for any unforseen development costs that may arise and to build a website for the app.

If the campaign reaches ~$90,000 then an android build (estimated at $50,000) will begin development as well, as we would really love to see this game made available across as many current mobile devices as possible.

Any money raised above this will be used to build some of the extra features into the app that were put on hold to reach the more realistic cost of $40,000.

If the goal of $45,000 is not reached, then we will work with the development team to scale back the build to fit within the budget, however this may severely impair the core concept so please show your support for this exciting app and help it to reach its full potential :-)


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is able to contribute financially. If you love our concept and would still like to be part of the QuizComp story, we would be very grateful if you could "like", share and answer our daily quizzes on our facebook page at www.facebook.com/QuizComp or tweet us at www.twitter.com/QuizCompGame (you will receive in-game credits when the game is released to thank you for your support)

We would love for you to help us build our new question database, simply submit any questions you would like to see in the game to quizcompgame@gmail.com (preferably in a spreadsheet or word document if you have multiple questions) and we will be sure to include them in the release. We would also love to hear from you with any ideas, questions or any other features that you would like to see implemented to make this the ultimate quiz app.

Please email any questions, ideas etc to quizcompgame@gmail.com or contact us here or on facebook or twitter.

We have just created Facebook and twitter pages so jump onto www.facebook.com/QuizComp or www.twitter.com/QuizCompGame and be the first to tweet, like and share us. Everyone who Tweets, Likes, Shares and answers our daily quizzes on our pages will receive some in-game credits when the game is released! :-)

Happy quizzing,
Andrew at QC
